description: Microfinance lender Ujjivan Financial Services has raised Rs 300 crore from a clutch of investors, including HDFC Life and Sundaram MF, in a pre-IPO placement.
title: Ujjivan Financial raises Rs 300 cr in pre-IPO placement  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Microfinance lender Ujjivan Financial Services has raised Rs 300 crore from a clutch of investors, including HDFC Life and Sundaram MF, in a pre-IPO placement."Ujjivan Financial Services which filed its draft red herring prospectus on December 31, 2015, with market regulator Sebi seeking permission for its initial public offering has completed its pre-IPO placement of approximately Rs 300 crore," the company said in a statement.Investors including HDFC Life, Sundaram MF, Shriram Life and Family offices and HNI's such as Desai Bros and others participated in the pre-IPO placement, it added. The funding values the company at around Rs 2,000 crore. The company intends to raise between Rs 1,000 and Rs 1,200 crore through its initial public offer (IPO).The offer consists of a fresh issue of equity shares aggregating up to Rs 650 crore and an offer for sale of up to 2,49,68,332 equity shares. The selling shareholders who would participate in the OFS include Elevar Equity Mauritius, International Finance Corporation, India Financial Inclusion Fund, Mauritius Unitus Corporation, Nederlandse Financierings - Maatschappij voor Ontwikkelingslanden N V, Sarva Capital LLC, WCP Holdings III and Women's World Banking Capital Partners, LP.Since the pre-IPO placement is completed, the number of equity shares issued will be reduced from the fresh issue, subject to regulatory requirements, the statement said. Kotak Mahindra Capital Company Limited, Axis Capital Limited, ICICI Securities Limited and IIFL Holdings Limited are the book running lead managers to the offer. Till date, only one microfinance firm SKS Microfinances had tapped the capital markets. In 2010, SKS raised Rs 1,654 crore in its maiden public offering. The proceeds of the issue would be utilised towards augmenting the company's capital base to meet future capital requirements. In addition, the company "intends to reduce its foreign shareholding in accordance with the requirements of the SFB (Small Finance Bank) in-principle approval to set up a SFB." Ujjivan Financial Services has also received an in-principle approval from Reserve Bank to set up small finance banks. This is the second microfinance institution after Equitas Holding to approach the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) for an IPO this year.The equity shares are proposed to be listed on BSE and NSE. $("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Gaurang Shah of Geojit BNP Paribas suggests exiting Adani Port on rallies.
title: Exit Adani Port on rallies, says Gaurang Shah  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Gaurang Shah of Geojit BNP Paribas told CNBC-TV18, "In this kind of a market you need to be careful what you are buying in case if you are buying it from a short to medium term. And if you are buying stocks which have been under pressure, my sense is that you may end up on the losing side. So, in case if you want to exit from here and of course you have got a whole host of events lined up today, the last day or the next week we come back we face the expiry and the week after that we will face the Budget. So, our sense is that at least for the next week or 10-15 days the markets are going to be extremely choppy."He further added, "One may use any kind of pull back on the higher side to lighten up Adani Port and if you are looking at it from a long term point of view then our advice would be to look at private sector banking which has corrected. From a long term, private sector banks looks quite attractive. Even something in autos like Tata Motors DVR , Tata Motors look quite promising to me from a long term point of view. So, use pull back to lighten up these kind of stocks."$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

So, with that perspective and given that Tata Elxsi has run up quite a bit, you might see some kind of volatility, so you need to stay away from that kind of volatility.""In our view, Infosys or HCL Technologies, either of these companies may turn out to be a better investment idea from a long-term point of view and it may actually create great value for you. description: SP Tulsian of sptulsian.com has a positive view on Gokaldas Exports and feels that one can hold the stock with a view of one year.
title: Positive on Gokaldas Exports, advise hold: SP Tulsian  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}SP Tulsian of sptulsian.com told CNBC-TV18, "If you see the financial results of Gokaldas Exports , Q3 clearly establish the operational turnaround of the company. Because the operating profit at earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortisation (EBITDA) level whatever you may see, there is loss of about Rs 14-15 crore on a quarterly basis that has converted into a profit of Rs 7-8 crore.""It is exporting to all the prominent labels across the globe and they have been holding a lot of owned premises. Blackstone is a promoter of the company, 56-57 percent stake is held by them and we know that Blackstone right now is the largest real estate holder in India as a private equity investor," he said."They have been selling those properties and making the company debt free because large amount has been availed for the working capital. But that has not been seen in this quarter. Whatever other income or exceptional income has come, that has not been factored into.""I am still keeping the positive view. I am not saying that buy or you jump in today only but those who are holding the stock, they need not book profit if they have a one year horizon."$("

description: Gaurang Shah of Geojit BNP Paribas is of the view that one may pick Arvind, Lupin or HCL Technologies.

content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Gaurang Shah of Geojit BNP Paribas told CNBC-TV18, "One does expect some kind of recovery post the big event in form of Budget once it is done and dusted with and if the Finance Minister has to deliver some pleasantries, so don’t sell it out at current levels. Wait out; Century Textiles is down because the entire market is down and so is the markets globally, so you don’t need to worry about that.""The problem is from a long-term point of view whether it is advisable to stay invested in this stock. There have been a lot of news flows surrounding this particular company. In case if you want to say with the textile sector, our preference would be Arvind . This is one particular stock which has delivered consistent numbers and the outlook looks quite positive in terms of their business. So, if you want to stay in the textile, maybe something like a Arvind is preferable. So, you can lighten up on Century Textile at any kind of pullback," he added. "In case if you want to make a shift from here and look at a relatively safer bet, then maybe Sun Pharmaceutical or Lupin from the pharmaceutical pack or in the IT space, HCL Technologies or Infosys ; this is the broad preference that I can suggest," he said.$("

description: Shares of Monsanto India, the agriculture company, declined 4 percent intraday Thursday to hit a fresh 52-week low of Rs 1,900.20 after its anti competitive behaviour suspected by country's antitrust regulator.
title: Monsanto down 4%, CCI suspects anti competitive behaviour  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Shares of Monsanto India , the agriculture company, declined 4 percent intraday Thursday to hit a fresh 52-week low of Rs 1,900.20 after its anti competitive behaviour suspected by country's antitrust regulator. Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Wednesday suspected that a Monsanto joint venture had abused its dominant position as a supplier of genetically modified (GM) cotton seeds in India, a media report said. Local farmers and some of their associations, including one affiliated to the ruling BJP, have complained that Monsanto overprices its products using its position as the supplier of GM seeds used in more than 90 per cent of the country's cotton cultivation. US-based Monsanto launched a GM cotton variety in India in 2002 despite opposition from critics who questioned its safety, a report said. At 11:38 hours IST, the scrip of Monsanto India was quoting at Rs 1,933.00, down Rs 46.30, or 2.34 percent on the BSE.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: SPA research is bullish on Simplex Infrastructure and has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 410 in its research report dated Feburary 17,2016
title: Buy Simplex Infrastructure; target of Rs: 410 SPA research  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}SPA research report on Simplex Infrastructure Simplex Infrastructureregistered mixed set of numbers with top-line reporting a decline of 3.2% (driven by tepid execution) and profitability registering a growth of 28.9% YoY largely owing to lower tax outgo in Q3FY16. Operating margins declinedby 42 bps to 9.5%. SIL continued with its approach of selectively bidding for new orders resulting in inflows of INR 32.3 bn in 9MFY16 (INR 55.6 bn in 9MFY15). Given SIL's quest for controlling working capital (continues to remain elevated at 224days) and slowing down execution (2.6x book to bill), we change our estimates and retain our BUY rating on the stock with a revised target of INR 410 (earlier target INR 558), based on 14x FY17E earnings.Valuation SIL with proven track record & efficient project delivery mechanisms is expected to be one of the prime beneficiaries of expected revival in capex cycle. Government's efforts to major infrastructure bottlenecks and improving funding situation in the sector will lead to increased order inflows. Strategy of selectively bidding for high margin orders in addition to declining competition will lead tomargin improvement. Although currently it is facing headwinds in terms of tight liquidity conditions and deteriorating working capital, its strong and good quality order backlog provides comfort on long term growth. Given SIL's focus on reducing working capital cycle by slowing execution, we change our estimates and retain our BUY rating on the stock with a revised target of INR 410 (earlier targetINR 558), based on 14x FY17E earnings. description: SPA research is bullish on Bank of Baroda and has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 137 in its research report dated Feburary 17, 2016
title: Buy Bank of Baroda; target of Rs 137: SPA research  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}SPA research Report on Bank of Baroda BoB reported disappointing set of numbers for Q3FY16 with 64% increase in GNPA resulting into net loss of INR 33.42bn. NII declined by 17.67% YoY to INR 27.05bn due to interest reversal on higher slippages and base rate cut. NPA provisioningincreased by 5.5x YoY to INR 64.74bn as the bank took full impact of AQR and provided extra provisioning for standard assets. PCR declined to 53% from 58% in Q2FY16. On back of surge in NPAs and lower than estimated operating performance, we cut our estimates sharply and change our recommendation to HOLD from BUY with lower TP of INR 137, based on 1.5x FY17E ABV.Outlook & ValuationBoB continues its crusade against bad loans and classified loans as NPAs far in excess of that required due to AQR. Of the total slippages in Q3FY16, only 47% of slippages were due to AQR while Slippages outside AQR were INR 83.85bn much higher than last ten quarters average of INR 24bn as the bank tried to clean up the book aggressively so that it can concentrate its effort on recovery.The management has come out with strong statement that NPA ratios have peaked for the bank and it does not require capital for next 4-6 quarters as it would be raising INR 25bn from sale of non core investments. Going ahead, bank will focus on NPA recovery, increasing retail focus with thrust on improving the digital experience and shrinking its overseas trade finance book. We note that there are several challenges ahead even if impairment ratios are addressed, but the current management is forging ahead in building the bank in a refreshingly new way with focus on low risk assets. On back of surge in NPAs and lower than estimated operating performance, we cut our estimates sharply and changeour recommendation to HOLD from BUY with lower TP of INR 137, based on 1.5x FY17E ABV. description: SPA research is bullish on Ahluwalia Contracts  and has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 312 in its research report dated feburary 17,2016
title: Buy Ahluwalia Contracts ; target of Rs 312: SPA research  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}SPA Research report on Ahluwalia Contracts ACIL's quarterly numbers were largely in-line with our estimates driven by improved execution in some of its key projects. While revenues improved by 20.0% in Q3FY16, operating margins improved by 294 bps to 12.4%, owing to better marginsorders booked over the past 18 months & reducing share of low margin legacy orders. Order inflows have revived as ACIL booked orders of INR 13.3 bn (FY15 INR 13.8 bn) in 9MFY16. This coupled with book to bill of 3.4x (Order Backlog -INR 38.3 bn) provides strong growth visibility. We continue to retain our "BUY" rating on the stock with a target of INR 312.Outlook & ValuationsACIL is well placed to benefit from increasing opportunities in construction space owing to its superior execution capabilities. Robust order backlog of INR 38.3 bn coupled with upcoming opportunities of +INR 15 trn provides the company with a great platform to achieve healthy growth. Declining share of fixed pricecontracts along with increasing share of government orders and limited competition for composite EPC contracts will ensure improved margins. Moreover easing working capital cycle and minimal capex would result in net debt free balance sheet in FY17. We continue to retain our "BUY" rating on the stock with a target of INR 312.For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. description: ICICIDirect has recommended hold rating on NMDC with a target price of Rs 85 in its research report dated February 15, 2016.
title: Hold NMDC; target of Rs 85: ICICIDirect  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}ICICIDirect's research report on NMDC NMDC reported a subdued set of Q3FY16 numbers primarily on the back of lower-than-expected realisations and higher-than-expected operating costs The company reported a net income from operations of | 1517.2 crore, down 5.3% QoQ, 48.5% YoY and below our estimate of | 1595.0 crore. While iron ore sales volume came in line with our estimate at 7.2 million tonnes (MT), blended realisations came in at | 2061/tonne, down 15.2% QoQ, 50.5% YoY and below our estimate of | 2171/tonne NMDC reported an EBITDA of | 644.1 crore (EBITDA margin of 42.5%), down 28.6% QoQ and 66.9% YoY and below our estimate of | 824.7 crore (EBITDA margin estimate of 51.7%). EBITDA/tonne of iron ore operations came in at | 894/tonne, down 36.0% QoQ, 68.0% YoY and below our estimate of | 1150/tonne The ensuing PAT came in at | 655 crore, down 19.2% QoQ and 58.9% YoY and below our estimate of | 798 crore The company gave a healthy interim dividend of | 9.5/share NMDC has raised receipt request for DMF payments from steel players. The same is sub judice. The same has been accounted for in the topline (| 178.95 crore for 9MFY16) and in royalty and other levy expense (| 205.83 crore for 9MFY16) NMDC reported a muted Q3FY16 performance on the back of subdued realisations and higher-than-expected operating costs. However, a healthy dividend payout of | 9.5/share augurs well. We have downward revised our FY16E sales volume estimate to 28.0 MT (from 30 MT earlier), while maintaining our FY17E at 32.0 MT. We value the stock at 6x FY17E EV/EBITDA (upward revised from 5.5x earlier) and arrive at a target price of | 85. We have a HOLD recommendation on NMDC. description: KRChoksey is bullish on IGL has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 595 in its research report dated February 15, 2016.
title: Buy IGL;target of Rs 595: KRChoksey  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}KRChoksey's research report on IGL Indraprastha Gas reported its Q3FY16 results, which were marginally below our estimates due to one-offs. The topline declined 1.6% YoY to | 929.2 crore against our estimate of | 950.7 crore while the PAT declined 2.8% YoY to | 105.1 crore against our estimate of | 120.5 crore Volumes of 4 mmscmd were in line with our estimates. The gross margins stood at | 9.9/scm, marginally above our estimates of | 9.8/scm Higher employee costs of | 24.4 crore against expectation of | 17.1 crore and accounting of | 12.3 crore towards one time settlement for take or pay obligation under long term gas purchase agreement led to EBITDA margins of 20.2% against our estimate of 22.7%. Subsequently, EBITDA came at | 187.3 crore came in below our estimate of | 215.3 crore .IGL’s sales volumes have grown at 7% CAGR over the last five years and stands at 3.8 mmscmd in FY15. IGL’s core operations in NCR offer good demand potential due to lower CNG and PNG penetration and on account of the Supreme Court’s directive to have all public transport vehicles necessarily run on CNG. We believe IGL’s investment in Maharashtra Natural Gas (MNGL) (| 180.5 crore) is positive, giving it access to industrial gas demand in Pune, without much impact on its balance sheet. At 0.3 mmscmd, MNGL offers high growth potential. Also, investment of | 69 crore in Central UP Gas (CUGL), which is engaged in CGD in the cities of Kanpur and Bareilly, Unnao and Jhansi in Uttar Pradesh presents a growth opportunity. We value IGL based on the DCF methodology to arrive at a target price of | 595 (WACC – 12%, terminal growth – 3%). title: Sell GlaxoSmithKline; target of Rs 2450: Axis Securities  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Axis Securities's research report on GlaxoSmithKline GSK Pharma’s (GSK) Q3FY16 adjusted PAT declined 9% YoY/20% QoQ to Rs 832 mn(29% lower than our estimate). While revenue increased 13% YoY to Rs 7.3 bn (aided by 4% growth due to vaccine asset sale agreement with Novartis India), EBITDA margin adjusted for one-off expenses was reported at 14%. Augmentin volumes declined 10% YoY during the quarter. We note GSK’s secondary growth volume (+5% YoY) / value (+13% YoY) has improved during Q3FY16. We reduce FY16/17 EPS by 15%/2% to factor in weak 9MFY16. While we expect revenue growth and operating leverage to improve FY17 onwards, at CMP, we believe the stock is expensive (45x FY17E EPS).We maintainSELL with revised TP of Rs 2,450 (34x FY17E EPS of Rs72) vs. Rs 2,500 earlier. description: Shares of Motherson Sumi Systems gained 3.7 percent intraday Thursday as a media report suggested that the company is eyeing control over Luxemburg-based auto parts supplier owned by billionaire investor Wilbur Ross.
title: Motherson Sumi may buy Wilbur Ross's company, stock up 4%  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Shares of Motherson Sumi Systems gained 3.7 percent intraday Thursday as a media report suggested that the company is eyeing control over Luxemburg-based auto parts supplier owned by billionaire investor Wilbur Ross. "The flagship company of the USD 6.9 billion Samvardhana Motherson Group is in advance negotiations with billionaire investor Wilbur Ross to buy one of his portfolio companies International Automotive Components (IAC) Group for USD 750-800 million as the restructuring guru seeks to cash out of the low margins business following aborted attempts of an IPO," a report said quoting unnamed sources. Luxemburg headquartered IAC last year generated almost USD 6 billion in annual revenue by selling instrument panels, cockpits, doors and trim, headliners and other exterior components from its 85 manufacturing facilities spread across 20 countries. At 11:15 hours IST, the scrip of Motherson Sumi Systems was quoting at Rs 225, up Rs 1.80, or 0.81 percent on the BSE.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: SPA research is bullish on Motherson Sumi Systems and has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 378 in its research report dated feburary 17, 2016
title: Buy Motherson Sumi Systems Ltd; target of Rs 378:SPA Research  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}SPA research report on Motherson Sumi Systems Motherson reported mixed set of results with topline coming in at INR 98.6 bn (SPAe: INR 100.5 bn) and PAT at INR 3.1 bn (SPAe: INR 3.4 bn). PAT was below estimate due to lower topline growth, less than anticipated decline in raw material costs and certain one-off expense items. SMP/SMR reported revenue growth of 19.5%/14.3% YoY to Euro 690 mn/369 mn but 6.7% YoY depreciation of Euro against INR arrested the robust growth to only 11.0%/6.3% in rupee terms. The current order book stands at Euro 14 bn (INR 1066 bn). We maintain our BUY rating with a target price of INR 378 based on 12xFY17E EV/EBITDA.ValuationThe demand outlook continues to be strong across US, Europe and India. In MSSL's next phase of growth, North America is likely to be the highest incremental revenue contributor, followed by Europe. With improvement in overall business through ramp up of new plants and increase in utilization levels, we expect MSSL's consolidated revenues & profits to report CAGR of ~14.7% &~30.7% respectively between FY15- 17E. Motherson might be slightly affected from the VW issue in the near term but we do not expect any major impact in the long term as OEMs tend to recover from the hit of recall and MSSL too is targeting to increase its market share across OEMs (thereby reducing its dependence on any single OEM) worldwide led by highly competitive andexpanding product portfolio. We maintain our BUY rating with atarget price of INR 378 based on 12xFY17E EV/EBITDA. description: Mayuresh Joshi of Angel Broking is of the view that one may prefer Larsen and Toubro for long term.
title: Prefer L&T for long term: Mayuresh Joshi  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Mayuresh Joshi of Angel Broking told CNBC-TV18, "Clearly the doubt still persists in terms of how the energy and crude prices are moving at this point of time and execution again has been a sort of a deterrent for the Larsen and Toubro (L&T) from a medium-term perspective. However, having said that, the order book is quite robust, close to Rs 2,56,000 crore odd. So, that gives decent revenue visibility. You are talking about the networking capital cycle actually getting peaked off around 24-25 percent mark.""I think the negatives that the stock carries along with the entire sector is the kind of order flows that one really expects to be very tepid over the next few quarters, execution again is going to be extremely key. Clearly, if you are talking about a slowdown happening, the hydrocarbons business might have some amount of issues but it has been strongly resilient over the last few quarters," he said."So, what L&T has apart from its standalone engineering and hydrocarbons division is its IT business as well. So, any listing there off over the next few quarters, what it does with its real estate arm, the SOTP valuation also taking into account, the finance arm that L&T has got in terms of L&T Finance Holdings , clearly I think you are talking about a company which is in the right scheme of things for the Indian economy." "We are not seeing the right moves in terms of the credit cycle and that is why the tepidness probably in a lot of these stocks, it might for all eventuality along with the markets correct another 10-12 percent from the current level but in my opinion that gives a better entry point for the investor. You should have a longer time horizon of a year, year and a half to say the least."$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Parag Thakkar of HDFC Securities is of the view that one can accumulate L&T on dips and feels that Tata Motors looks interesting.
title: Accumulate L&T on dips, Tata Motors looks interesting: Parag Thakkar  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Parag Thakkar of HDFC Securities told CNBC-TV18, "From a longer term perspective, so many stocks might look good at these levels because valuations are very compelling but Larsen and Toubro (L&T) as we all know has its own issue. One is size, on a Rs 80,000 crore topline to grow at 15 percent is very difficult in this kind of scenario. When capex cycle is down globally, you have no capex in oil and gas, even on the India side only roads and power transmission seems to be firing otherwise other segments are down.""They have that asset ownership business, BOT business where something like Hyderabad Metro is there where they have to fund it. There will be a huge leverage taken. So, those kind of issues remain in L&T. All said and done, from a longer term perspective, it is a best proxy play for infrastructure in India. So, definitely at these valuations, one can look to buy on dips very gradually and that is my advice for most of the largecap beaten down stocks," he said. "One interesting thing in this market is that all very large businesses have become very small market cap companies; that is very interesting. Tata Motors with a topline of Rs 2,75,000 crore and EBITDA of Rs 40,000 crore is trading at EV of around Rs 1,30,000 crore. So, those are very interesting opportunities.So, those kind of buying opportunities one should gradually buy because you never know, gradually on every dip one should accumulate."$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Emkay is bullish on Cummins has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 1024 in its research report dated February 3, 2016.
title: Buy Cummins; target of Rs 1024: Emkay  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Emkay's research report on Cummins Cummins Q3FY16 operational performance was marginally below our expectations (a) 5.9% YoY increase in revenues and (b) 260bps YoY decline in EBITDAM. description: EIS is bearish on Bayer CropScience has recommended Sell rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 2302 in its research report dated February 3, 2016.

content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}EIS's research report on Bayer CropScience Bayer CropScience (BCS) posted a decline of 9% in Sales to Rs6,222 mn and 10% in total revenue to Rs 6,424 bn during Q3FY16. Growth was impacted on account of poor monsoon across the country.BCS posted disappointing performance for Q3FY16 on back of drought condition at country level. description: Prabhudas Lilladher is bullish on Britannia has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 3200 in its research report dated February 11, 2016.
title: Buy Britannia; target of Rs 3200: Prabhudas Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Britannia We are cutting BRIT’s FY16‐18 EPS estimates by 1.5‐5.4% due to tepid demand and higher tax rate. BRIT continues to grow ahead of the market led by innovations and distribution gains in rural India and Hindi heartland. The company is operating at all‐time high profit margins led by double‐digit volume growth, cost efficiencies and Premiumisation; however, expansion of incremental margin looks difficult. BRIT is looking at 2.5‐3% price increase as sugar prices are up 38% and Wheat 7% from the lows. We estimate 17.5% PAT CAGR over FY16‐18 post 52% PAT growth in FY16. Retain ‘BUY’, given 52% ROE and ROCE and 40% dividend payout. description: First call research is bullish on Solar Industries India Ltd and has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 3600 in its research report dated feburary 10, 2016.
title: Buy Solar industries;target of Rs 3600: First call research  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Firstcall research report on Solar industries India ltd Solar Industries India Ltd (SIIL) founded in 1995, is one of the largest comprehensive explosives & initiating devices manufacturing company in India.The company’s Net Sales rose by 20.31% y-o-y of Rs.3848.21 million for the 3rd quarter of the FY16 as against Rs. 3198.49 million for the prior period of Lastyear.In Q3 FY16, Net profit of the company registered a growth of 16.40% y-o-y to Rs. 411.69 million from Rs.353.68 million in Q3 FY15. Earning before Interest, Tax and Dep was at Rs. 788.54 million for the 3rd quarter of FY16 as against Rs.611.05 million in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. Profit before tax (PBT) at Rs. 661.90 million in Q3 FY16 compared to Rs. 467.35 million in Q3 FY15,registered a growth of 41.63%. EPS of the company stood at Rs. 22.75 in December quarter against Rs. 19.54 in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. In Q3 FY15, Export & Overseas Turnover registered a growth of 64.38% y-o-y of Rs. 1264.40 million as compared to 769.20 million in Q3 FY14. For nine months end of FY16, company registered a growth of 15.09% in Net sales to Rs. 11074.76 million from Rs. 9622.59 million for nine months end of FY15. Net Profit for the 9m ended of FY16 was at Rs. 1179.18 million, growth of 9.89% compared with Rs. 1073.03 million for the 9m ended of FY15.Net Sales and PAT of the company are expected to grow at a CAGR of 11% and 14% over 2014 to 2017E.The company’s domestic market has registered a strong demand indicating growth in coal mining activities. As also most of its overseas subsidiaries reflected strong growth despite of challenges from mining slowdown. The Government has set an excavation target of 1.35 billion tones of Coal by FY202, to meet the increased demand. The company decided to start bulk operations in South Africa, acquired Land & likely to commence construction work in Feb 16, this year and operation from in next financial year. Hence We recommend ‘BUY’ in this particular scrip with a target price of Rs.3600.00 for Medium to Long terminvestment.  For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.  $("

description: Axis Securities is bullish on REC has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 200 in its research report dated February 11, 2016.
title: Buy REC; target of Rs 200: Axis Securities  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Axis Securities's research report on REC Rural Electrification Corporation(REC) disappointed in Q3FY16 by reporting below expected PAT at Rs 13.7 bn (down 1% YoY) on decrease in NIM, de-growth in sanctions, moderating disbursements and a sharp deterioration in asset quality. With 15% of loans extended to the private power segment, where asset quality continues to be a concern, and increase in provisions for its restructured book to 5% by FY18, we expect provisions to remain elevated going forward. Though disbursement growth (23% YoY) is been moderating, loan growth remains stable at 20% YoY on lower repayments (average maturity period of outstanding loans is ~5.7 years). We expect advances CAGR of 15% from FY15-18 and 100 bps decline in margin over FY18 on probable impact of implementation of UDAY scheme.REC is giving higher interim dividends (Rs 12 per share in FY16) and also likely to buy stake in government entities (as per media reports). This, we believe, will not only impact the leveraging ability but also return ratios. Though the quantum as well as timelines of loans, which would get converted into low yielding state bonds (UDAY scheme), is uncertain, we build in partial impact in our earnings for the same. Maintain BUY with TP of Rs 200 (0.7x FY17E ABV; upside of 16%) on the back drop of favorable valuation (0.7x FY16E ABV of Rs 251 and 0.6x FY17E ABV of Rs 268). description: Ashwani Gujral of ashwanigujral.com recommends selling HDIL, SKS Microfinance and Union Bank.
title: Sell HDIL, SKS Microfinance, Union Bank: Ashwani Gujral  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Ashwani Gujral of ashwanigujral.com told CNBC-TV18, " HDIL is clearly collapsing, so that is a sell with a stop loss of about Rs 62 and we should look for targets now closer to Rs 54. Basically, with this kind of momentum everything that went up 6-8 percent and real estate index was the third best performer up about 7 percent, so all those gains will get taken away. So, any real estate stock which is in the F&O, I think should do fairly badly.""Interestingly SKS Microfinance hasn't fallen a whole lot. It has infact outperformed. Now all of these outperformers are coming under pressure. SKS Micro is a sell with a stop loss of Rs 501 with a target of Rs 480," he said." Union Bank will also give up all of its gains from yesterday. So, that is a sell with a stop loss of Rs 116 with target of Rs 104.""Everything is going down.However F&O stocks have their own issues with short positions etc. I think Jet Airways can go towards Rs 430-440 where it had significant tops earlier on. So, support is at lower levels around Rs 430-440 but as we have seen people got skewed with BPCL , HPCL and aviation that now when these stocks are going to come down they will also come down in a heap."$("

description: Axis Securities is bullish on Prestige Estate has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 218 in its research report dated February 11, 2016.
title: Buy Prestige Estate;target of Rs 218: Axis Securities  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Axis Securities's research report on Prestige Estate Amidst weak demand and thereby no major new launches, Prestige Estates Projects Ltd (PEPL) reported muted sales of 0.9 msf totaling ~Rs 5.1 bnin Q3 (down 32% YoY and 15% QoQ).Having achieved mere 33% of its full year sales guidance in 9MFY16, the management lowered its guidance to Rs 30 bn (vs.Rs 57.5 bn earlier).Nevertheless, PEPL is on track to achieve its original collection guidance (78% achieved) and exit rentals (already achieved). Consolidated net debt increased by Rs 13.5 bn to Rs 49.7 bn – highest ever (net D/E of 1.1x vs. 0.8x in Q2), driven by acquisition (Rs 6 bn) and consolidation (Rs 5 bn) of Exora Business Park.With Rs 32bn of net cash flows from near ready inventory, management expects debt to peak out (max D:E of 1-1.25x) and decrease post few quarters. description: Prabhudas Lilladher is bullish on Atul Auto has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 537 in its research report dated February 11, 2016.
title: Buy Atul Auto; target of Rs 537: Prabhudas Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Atul Auto While volume growth during Q3 remained in mid‐single digits for the fourth successive quarter, lower commodity price and higher realisations led by a better product mix boosted Atul Auto’s (AAL’s) EBITDA margin to a new peak of 16.6%. This led to robust 41.2% YoY growth in Q3FY16 profit for AAL to Rs160m. Growth prospects appear healthy for AAL over the long‐term, as the company continues to launch new products and enters more markets. H2FY16 should also witness higher volumes from the petrol product launch. While the company is small in size currently, its presence in a niche segment with low competition ensures high growth. AAL enjoys a debt‐free status, with adequate free cash flow generation to part‐finance its capex through internal accruals. We maintain ‘Accumulate’ with a price target of Rs537. AAL trades at PE of 22.3x FY16e and 17.9x FY17e EPS. At our price target, the stock would trade at a PE of 20x FY17e and an EV/EBITDA of 13.2x FY17e (currently at 11.8x). description: EIS is bullish on UPL has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 524 in its research report dated January 29, 2016.
title: Buy UPL; target of Rs 524: EIS  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}EIS's research report on UPL UPL posted flat revenue in Q3FY16, mainly on account of adverse currency impact of -13%. Volume growth stood at healthy rate of 11%. Geographically North America and Latin America contributed highest to growth with 12% & 14% respectively. India/EU/RoW region declined by 17%/9%/8%.UPL’s Q3FY15 revenue were in line with our estimates. UPL is a leading global generic player in the agrochemical Industry (ranks among the Top-5 post patent agrochemical manufacturers in the world). We expect UPL sales to register CAGR of 10% over FY2015-17E, with EBITDA margins expansion, driven by operating leverage, to 19.5%. Adj PAT is likely to show a CAGR of 22% during over mentioned period. Over past 4 quarters, UPL has seen strong revival in volume growth, with improving EBITDA margin. With RoCE/RoE of 23%/20% in FY16 & FY17, at current valuation of 14x & 12x expected earnings of FY16 and FY17 respectively, stock of the company offers upside of 20% from here on, hence we rate stock Accumulate with TP of Rs524. description: Prabhudas Lilladher is bullish on Ramco Cements has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 490 in its research report dated Februrary 9, 2016.
title: Buy Ramco Cements; target of Rs 490: Prabhudas Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Ramco Cements The Ramco Cements (TRCL) reported Q3FY16 earnings way ahead of our expectation on the back of beat across the fronts. Demand in the region continued to remain sluggish due to subdued demand across sectors and delay in recovery expected on account of formation of new states. We expect recovery to kickstart in couple of quarters on the back of enhanced focus of state governments on infra spending, stabilisation of newly formed states, new capital development in Amaravati and revival in small scale housing demand sponsored under various state government schemes. In this backdrop, we like TRCL as the best play on recovery in the South underpinned by highly competitive operations. We reiterate “BUY” with TP of Rs490 (earlier TP: Rs447), an EV/EBITDA of 12xFY17.We revise upward our EBITDA estimate for FY16/FY17 by 11%/7% on the back of steep cut in costs. EPS estimate is revised upward by 12%/7% at Rs19.3/Rs23.7 helped by lower interest cost (due to lower interest rate) and higher EBITDA. description: KRChoksey is bullish on Sterlite Techno has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 168 in its research report dated January 29, 2016.
title: Buy Sterlite Techno; target of Rs 168: KRChoksey  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}KRChoksey's research report on Sterlite Techno In the telecom segment, SOTL exhibited revenue growth of 20.39% YoY at INR 4,960 Mn compared to INR 4,120 Mn on account of volume growth in optical fibre at 5.4 Mn kms compared to 4.6 Mn kms on YoY basis. However, Optic Fibre Cable volumes came lower at 1.2 Mn kms against 2.2 mn Kms last year. The EBITDA came in at INR 1,100 Mn against INR 880 Mn, growth of 25% YoY basis. The EBITDA margin came at 22.18% vis-à-vis 21.36% in the same quarter of previous year. The PAT stood at INR 420 Mn with margin of 8.47%. The Revenue from NFS order will be booked in Q1FY17 due to unexecuted service part of the contract and documentation process.We are expecting company to deliver healthy growth on the back of various govt initiatives like smart cities, Digital India and Defense orders; in addition to capex from telecom players. Aslo, SOTL is moving up in value chain from manufacturer to service provider with acquisition of Elitecore, which will upgrade company to complete solution provider. The proposed demerger will hive off INR 22 from the company. Sterlite Technologies has close to 35% market share in fibre optical space, and expect company to deliver revenue and EBIDTA growth about FY15-18 CAGR of 38% and 31% respectively and PAT with pre-tax RoCE of ~25-26% and RoE of ~30-31 % by FY18. We expect company to do an EPS of INR 8.2 for FY18E. We are valuing company to get 18x valuations and arrived at price target of INR 146 (excl INR 22 of Power division). The CMP is INR 83, where INR 22 will be received from the Power transmission business in next 3-4 months due to demerger which will reduce cost to INR 61 respectively and gives an upside of 102 % from current levels. description: KRChoksey is bullish on ICICI Bank has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 314 in its research report dated January 29, 2016.
title: Buy ICICI Bank; target of Rs 314: KRChoksey  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}KRChoksey's research report on ICICI Bank Q3FY15 earnings for ICICI Bank came as a huge disappointment with bank reporting highest NPAs in past five years (jumped 33% q/q, 62% y/y), three-fold spike in provisioning and tepid profitability. Other income traction boosted by Pru Life stake sale (one-off gains) and contained operating costs stood as savings grace. Steel sector issues and impact of RBI’s fresh guidelines signal more pain for ICICI Bank in the forthcoming quarters. Moreover, lack of clarity on stressed assets ensure weakness in ICICI Bank stock ahead.It seems a bumpy ride for ICICI Bank ahead especially in the light of the new RBI directive and the bank’s meaningful exposure to the leveraged corporate and troubled sectors of the economy. While no complaints on loan book growth that was primarily driven by retail loan traction so also robust non-interest income that proved as the sole savings grace for the bank during the quarter, the slippages and credit costs are expected to stand higher for the forthcoming quarter. That calls for imminent earnings pressure ahead for ICICI Bank. For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. description: KRChoksey is bullish on Guj State Petro has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 151 in its research report dated Februrary 9, 2016.
title: Buy Guj State Petro; target of Rs 151: KRChoksey  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}KRChoksey's research report on Guj State Petro Gujarat State Petronet Ltd. reported revenue of INR. 2481 mn down 1.9% QoQ and up 2.0% Y-o-Y due to lower transmission volume. EBITDA was also down 6.7% QoQ at INR 2092 mn due to higher operation and maintenance expenses. Profit stood at INR. 1235 mn (boosted by higher other income) up 13.8% on QoQ and 39.1% on Y-o-Y basis. Transmission volumes stood at 23.1 mmscmd which was down 5.1% QoQ and up 0.7% YoY. Implied tariff was higher 0.9% on a QoQ and down 6.2% on a YoY basis to INR 1,080/mscm.We remain positive on the stock considering the following trigger points. 1- ONGC to enhance domestic production by 10‐15mmscmd over 1‐3 years. 2- CBM production is poised to grow by 6‐8mmscmd over 2‐3 years. 3- Commissioning of Mundra terminal by FY18. We model transmission tariff at INR 1215, 1230 and 1267 mscm and volumes at 25.8, 27.5 and 29.3 mmscmd for FY16/17/18. We assign ‘ACCUMULATE’ rating on the stock with the target price of INR 151/share based on the mix of EV/EBITDA, P/E and DCF methodology. Currently Stock trades at 14.3x FY17E EPS of INR 9.5. description: ICICIDirect is bullish on Arvind and has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 370 in its research report dated February 9, 2016.
title: Buy Arvind; target of Rs 370: ICICIDirect  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}ICICIDirect's research report on Arvind Arvind’s Q3FY16 results were in line with our expectations. Consolidated revenues grew 4% YoY to | 2158 crore (I-direct estimate: | 2172 crore). Absence of real estate revenues in the current quarter moderated the earnings momentum Brand & retail continued its growth momentum with growth of 12% YoY to | 737 crore. Revenues from ‘Power’ brands grew 15% YoY to | 415 crore. The growth was moderated by intentional ramp down in its Mega mart business, which de-grew 24% YoY to | 136 crore Textile business remained flattish in the quarter at | 1290 crore. Majority of the textile business was driven by growth in garments, which grew 8% to | 201 crore. Denim volumes were hit by a price hike coupled with a change in the product mix. Wovens and voiles grew 4.8% and 12% respectively. EBITDA for the quarter de-grew 2.3% YoY to | 281 crore (I-direct estimate: | 277 crore). Following this, margins sequentially declined 80 bps QoQ (up 60 bps YoY) to 13.1%. Higher traded goods coupled with increase in employee expenses impacted margins Benefit from lower interest expense was completely offset by higher depreciation and tax expense. Subsequently, PAT de-grew 5% YoY (up 13.5% QoQ) to | 103 crore (I-direct estimate | 102 crore) Following the expansion in Ethiopia, the company would double its shirt manufacturing capacity. Increased contribution from garmenting to standalone revenues would perk up higher margins. The dual advantage of manufacturing and retail presence makes Arvind the most preferred “Make & Distribute in India” partner for its associated brands. We continue to maintain our growth estimates for Arvind. We maintain BUY recommendation with a target price of | 370. description: KRChoksey is bullish on Minda Industries Ind has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 985 in its research report dated February 4, 2016.
title: Buy Minda Industries; target of Rs 985: KRChoksey  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}KRChoksey's research report on Minda Industries In Q3FY16, Minda Industries Ltd (MIL) reported net sales of INR 6,257mn which is line of our estimates of INR 6189mn, increased by 12.7% y-o-y and decreased by 4.0% q-o-q. EBIDTA stood at INR 589 Mn(our estimates of INR 564mn) and EBIDTA margins of 9.4 % respectively. In Q3FY16, growth in EBITDA is about 45.2% y-o-y and de-growth of 6.8% q-o-q. Adjusted PAT stood at INR 292Mn which is higher than our estimates of INR 271mn. PAT saw a growth of 123.4% y-o-y and 10.5% q-o-q for Q3FY16 respectively.MIL has market leader in switch gear segment. We believe MIL has potential for growth because of its better capacity utilization, tie up with global brands, innovative portfolio and large order inflow. The stock is currently trading 10.8x its FY 18E EPS of INR 82.1 respectively. We are valuing company 12x its FY18e EPS of INR 82.1 and arrived at a target price of INR 985 and recommend “accumulate” rating on the stock with a potential upside of 11.17% from current levels. description: Motilal Oswal is bullish on Berger Paints has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 325 in its research report dated February 9, 2016.
title: Buy Berger Paints; target of Rs 325: Motilal Oswal  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Motilal Oswal's research report on Berger Paints The company has not reported consolidated earnings for the first time, reportedly due to confusion in the company on SEBI's guidelines. Standalone earnings are above estimates aided by continued gross margin gains. Revenue growth was restricted to 10% while the company has not cut prices since March 2015 when prices were adjusted by 2.2%. Berger, along with Asian Paints, continues to gain market-share in the industry that has seen healthy growth last quarter on account of concentration of festive season into this quarter. Usually, the festive and the post monsoon painting season is spread over 2Q and 3Q. Standalone EBITDA margins 300bps to 29% as gross margins have improved sharply. RM cost has decline 380bps YoY This has helped the company post a 38% growth in reported standalone profits. EXPRESS PAINTING - The painting service from Berger Paints is witnessing good demand and as the company trains more painters the service is expected to expand. Service cost to consumers is at par with industry unlike Asian Paints. However, paints being sold through this channel are of premium range. Berger Nippon JV - JV will address 4W (cars & UVs) and 3W and this JV will open up a new business stream. Berger will bring its relationships while Nippon will bring the technology. We have rolled over or TP to FY18 earnings and now expect INR. 325 (40xFY18E EPS) in the next 12-18 months. For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. description: Prabhudas Lilladher is bullish on Dabur has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 292 in its research report dated January 28, 2016.
title: Buy Dabur; target of Rs 292: Prabhudas Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Dabur Dabur has reported 2.5% decline in standalone volumes led by sales decline in Foods (Supply Disruption in Nepal), Honey/ Chyawanprash (late winters and Patanjali’s competition) and Digestives (unorganised competition). Lower input costs and 56% higher other income enabled 12.6% PAT growth. Dabur is looking at sustaining innovations to compete with Patanjali but expects market for herbal products to expand providing enough room for growth. Dabur is looking at base case volume growth of 5%, however monsoons and rural stimulus can accelerate it significantly. IBD growth will be led by Namaste, GCC remains a little uncertain due to political and currency related challenges. We are Cutting FY17 and FY18 EPS estimates by 6.7‐8.5% to factor in the impact of lower sales growth and competition and arrive at 13.5% PAT CAGR over FY16‐18. Maintain Buy For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. description: Rajat Bose of rajatkbose.com recommends going long in Jet Airways and feels that Asian Paints may test Rs 908.
title: Go long in Jet Airways, Asian Paints may test Rs 908: Rajat Bose  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Rajat Bose of rajatkbose.com told CNBC-TV18, " Asian Paints is my old favourite. If at all there were to be any kind of an upswing, Asian Paints could be one and I am waiting for it to actually test Rs 908 once again. So, Rs 908 remains a target and Rs 873 is the stop loss. If there were to be any recovery in the market, Asian Paints could be the one that would lead the rally." "Unless Jet Airways falls below Rs 550 kind of levels it is unlikely to show much weakness now and it could actually spring a surprise and move up. The upside target would be Rs 626 to about Rs 639 because Jet is a momentum play. When it gets going it can actually move up pretty sharp. So, put a stop loss below Rs 554 and trade long," he said.$("

description: Larsen & Toubro is bullish on Prabhudas Lilladhar and has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs Rs 1,407 in its research report dated January 29, 2016.
title: Buy Larsen & Toubro; target of Rs 1,407: Prabhudas Lilladhar  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladhar Research report on Larsen L&T reported consolidated PAT of Rs10.4bn for Q3FY16 in line with our estimates,led by lower interest cost and higher other income. However, the operating performance was weak as challenges continued to persist in E&C segment both on execution and profitability front. Increased order inflow for the quarter was a surprise (up 11% YoY to Rs385bn). L&T is expecting order flow to be flat YoY in FY16 against previous guidance of 5‐7% growth. L&T maintained its sales guidance at 10‐15% growth for FY16. It highlighted that domestic ordering continues to be dominated by public spending and Private sector capex is yet to pick up. Middle East continues to witness tendering activity for basic infrastructure even in the face of oil price drop. Working capital remained stable at 23.6% of sales in Q3FY16 (V/s 24% sales in Q2FY16). We have cut our earnings estimate by ~10% for FY16 & FY17 to factor in weak margin and revised out TP downward to Rs 1407 (Previous Rs1721). We Maintain ‘BUY’, given the potential the company has once the turnaround sets in.For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.$("

description: Prabhudas Lilladher is bullish on Jubilant Life has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 578 in its research report dated Februrary 9, 2016.
title: Buy Jubilant Life; target of Rs 578: Prabhudas Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Jubilant Life Jubilant’s net sales declined by 5% YoY to Rs13.4bn while EBITDA grew by Rs3.1bn in Q3FY16. The company’s overall financial performance except LSI sales were in line with our estimates as Jubilant has been benefitting from ramp up in CMO, volume growth in US generics (through new launches), price rise in Specialty intermediates and better realisations in Nutritional products. LSI revenues were impacted due to lower price of pyridines (due to pass on benefits of lower price of crude oil derivatives) and lower demand of pyridines and life science chemicals (LSC) from global agro‐chemical customers. The Pharma division sales grew by 4% YoY, while LSI’s business declined by 12% as lower solvent prices (derivatives of Crude oil) drove down both input prices as well as end products. Overall, Jubilant maintained sequential EBITDA margin of Pharma at 30% while it reduced by 100bps to 15.5% in LSI in Q3FY16. With growing utilisation of CMO plants and flexibility in PPES business, we expect Jubilant’s sales growth to get further boost in FY17E and FY18E. The full benefit of CMO, however, will be realised in 2‐3 years as guided by management. Lower crude and ethanol prices to maintain 15‐16% LSI margin in FY16E‐18E with Pharma to maintain EBITDA margin at 30% on higher Radiopharma sales. We maintain ‘BUY’ and retain TP at Rs578. For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. description: KRChoksey is bullish on Granules India has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 160 in its research report dated January 29, 2016.
title: Buy Granules India; target of Rs 160: KRChoksey  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}KRChoksey's research report on Granules India Net sales for the quarter grew by a moderate 8% YoY to INR 3,449mn below our estimates. Auctus Pharma contributed around INR 300mn to sales with a small profit of INR 2mn at PBT level. EBIDTA grew by a healthy 24% YoY to INR 677mn & EBITDA margins stood at 19.6% expanding by 260bps mainly due to operational efficiency in base business and superior product mix. PAT grew by 15% YoY to INR 272mn on account of a higher tax rate at 33%. The Board of directors declared third interim dividend of 15p/share.Granules India has achieved a whopping 28% CAGR in revenues & 36% CAGR in earnings over the past 10 years. We expect a healthy earnings momentum to kick-start on account of Granules moving up the value chain towards high margin business, improved capacity utilization & additional product offerings from Auctus Pharma. We expect revenue and earnings CAGR of around 17% and 28% respectively over FY15-18E. Currently the stock is trading at 15x of FY17E & 12x of FY18E EPS. We upgrade our rating to ‘BUY’ from ‘ACCUMULATE’ with the target price of INR 160 at 17xFY18E. description: Prabhudas Lilladher is bullish on GlaxoSmith Con has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 6940 in its research report dated Februrary 9, 2016.
title: Buy GlaxoSmith Con; target of Rs 6940: Prabhudas Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on GlaxoSmith Con We are increasing FY16 and FY17 EPS estimates by 2.4‐5.7% factoring in benefits of price increase and Novartis’ OTC business. GSK continues to gain share in MFD segment due to stronghold of Horlicks and Boost. However, 11% price increase in the past six months and likely entry of ‘Patanjali’ remains a concern. Although SMP prices are down 18% YoY and remain benign, gradually increasing barley, sugar and wheat prices will cap further increase in gross margins, in our view. We expect GSK to sustain leadership led by strong brands, innovations and rising distribution reach; expect 12% PAT CAGR over FY16‐18 due to peak margins in FY16. We remain positive given that GSK has 1) Valuations (28.2xDec17EPS) at a discount to coverage universe 2) strong leadership in MFD segment 3) 22% PAT CAGR in past 10 years and 4) likely upside from Novartis OTC business. Retain Buy For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. description: Prabhudas Lilladher is bullish on Cummins has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 1030 in its research report dated February 3, 2016.
title: Buy Cummins; target of Rs 1030: Prabhudas Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Cummins Cummins (KKC) reported PAT of Rs1.78bn in Q3FY16j below our estimate due to weak exports revenue and one‐time provision for inventory write‐down. KKC commented that the economy is showing signs of revival mainly in segments like Infrastructure, Mining, Railways, Defence etc driven by government spending. Outlook on exports remains weak; however, KKC expects to gain market share in export for LHP products which should support growth. The company expects the domestic business to grow 10‐15% and exports to grow by 0‐5% for FY16 and expects similar trends for FY17. We remain positive on KKC’s potential in the domestic market, driven by structural factors like revival in Infrastructure/Industrial demand, unreliable quality of power in India and lack of credible options for power back‐up and medium‐to‐long term potential of exports. Low capacity utilization of 65% also leaves an upside surprise on margin once volumes improve The stock is trading at 27.5x FY17E earnings. We have cut our earnings by ~10% for FY17& FY18 to factor in weak export outlook and increased tax rate. We remain positive on KKC’s medium/long term potential in the domestic market, driven by structural factors like revival in Infrastructure/Industrial demand, unreliable quality of power in India, lack of creditable options for power back‐up and strong export potential. Low capacity utilization of ~65% also leaves upside surprise on margins once volumes improve. Maintain “BUY” For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.$("

description: The Rs 451-crore IPO received bids for 1.83 crore shares against the total issue size of over 1 crore shares, data available with the NSE till 1300 hrs showed.
title: Quick Heal IPO oversubscribed  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}The initial public offer (IPO) of software provider Quick Heal Technologies has been oversubscribed 1.81 times till afternoon on the last day of the offer today. The Rs 451-crore IPO received bids for 1.83 crore shares against the total issue size of over 1 crore shares, data available with the NSE till 1300 hrs showed. Quick Heal has already raised Rs 133.9 crore through issue of shares to 10 anchor investors. The company has fixed the price band at Rs 311-321 for its IPO. The IPO, which would close today, consists of fresh issue of Rs 250 crore and an offer for sale of about 62.70 lakh equity shares by promoters Kailash Sahebrao Katkar and Sanjay Sahebrao Katkar, as well as Sequoia Capital India Investment Holdings III. ICICI Securities, Jefferies India and JPMorgan India are the book running lead managers while Link Intime India is the registrar to the public issue. While the proceeds from the offer of sale would not go to Quick Heal Technologies, the Rs 250-crore funds raised from fresh issue of equity shares would be used by the company for advertising and sales promotion and capital expenditure for research and development. The proceeds would also be invested to purchase, develop and renovate its office premises in Kolkata, Pune and New Delhi, as well as general corporate needs. The company is a provider of security software products and solutions in India. Quick Heal's equity shares are proposed to be listed on BSE and NSE. $("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Pankaj Jain of SW Capital is of the view that one may stay invested in Housing Development and Infrastructure (HDIL).

content:

So as of now, don’t worry about what is happening in the market, let the storm pass by but I think HDIL, at current valuations, is one of the stocks you should stand by," he added.$("

description: Prabhudas Lilladher is bullish on ABB has recommended accumulate rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 1383 in its research report dated February 4, 2016.
title: Accumulate ABB; target of Rs 1383: Prabhudas Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on ABB ABB reported sales at Rs24.2bn (PLe: Rs23.9bn), up 8.3% YoY. Better value offering coupled with extensive customer outreach in new markets remained the key drivers for improved revenue growth. Sales of Power Products, Automation Products and Process Automation increased 18%, 9% and 13% respectively, while sales of Power Systems declined by 19% YoY. EBITDA was up 46.2% YoY at Rs2.6bn (PLe: Rs1.9bn), EBITDA margin came in at 10.9%, up 290bps YoY (PLe: 8.3%). Efforts towards increased localization coupled with strong focus on cost savings and project execution helped improve profitability. Adj. PAT was up 53.8% YoY at Rs1.2bn (PLe: Rs909m). ABB’s management believes it has consolidated its position over the last few years and is ready to benefit from market upturn as and when it happens. The company continues to focus on introduction of new products and tailor the technology to meet Indian requirement. We expect stock to deliver 36% earnings CAGR over CY15‐17E. Maintain Accumulate. description: Prabhudas Lilladher is bullish on Hexaware Tech has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 300 in its research report dated February 4, 2016.
title: Buy Hexaware Tech; target of Rs 300: Prabhudas Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Hexaware Tech Hexaware Technologies (HEXW) reported revenue miss due to seasonality, furloughs and impact of Chennai floods (~45% of employees based out of Chennai). Despite a weak Q4, HEXW reported CY15 CC revenue growth of 17.6% YoY, much ahead of most of the peers. Company won new business from new clients worth US$120m in CY15, which will be incremental tailwind for CY16 growth. HEXW has invested in sales and marketing engine in CY15 to build base for future growth. This led to margin drop in CY15, which we believe, will be partly recovered in CY16. Management has guided for CY16 revenue growth to be ahead of NASSCOM guidance of 10‐12%. Industry leading revenue growth, reasonable valuations (14.3x/12.7x CY16/17 EPS) and attractive dividend yield (~4%) make HEXW a compelling ‘BUY’. HEXW is trading at a discount to some of its peers, despite having similar or better growth profile. We expect multiple expansion for HEXW. description: Sharmila Joshi of sharmilajoshi.com suggests selling SpiceJet.
title: Exit SpiceJet, says Sharmila Joshi  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Sharmila Joshi of sharmilajoshi.com told CNBC-TV18, "Aviation is not a sector that I like too much. As far as aviation as a space is concerned, the sector has outperformed from September-October when little else has moved and which is why we are seeing a lot of cuts and a lot of selling coming in stocks like these because typically, when such a sell-off happens, traders do tend to lighten up.""As far as financials go, they are in support of aviation because even going forward we are not expecting a jump in aviation turbine fuel (ATF) prices. So to that extent, earnings will stay okay but at some point in time, you cannot expect them to sustain the margins they have had because some kind of pass through will have to come going ahead. So for me, SpiceJet  is just an exit and you should just get into some other sector and then look at market with a slightly longer-term perspective," she added.$("

description: Prabhudas Lilladher is bullish on KEC Intl has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 150 in its research report dated February 4, 2016.
title: Buy KEC Intl; target of Rs 150: Prabhudas Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on KEC Intl KEC International (KEC) reported Adjusted Net Profit of Rs372 mn, in line with our estimate. While sales were impacted by soft commodity prices and forex translation, margin continued to be healthy at 7.8%. Order inflow for 9MFY16 stood at Rs 68bn up 26% YoY. Outlook on order inflows continues to be healthy due to strong bid pipeline, especially in domestic markets. Apart from T&D it is seeing healthy traction in solar and railway segments and believes solar/railways/substation could be important growth drives for coming going ahead. KEC is already L1 in orders worth Rs30bn. KEC has guided for sales growth of up to 5% for FY16 and 10% for FY17 (at current commodity prices). We believe that a strong order book, improving margin profile and healthy outlook in T&D and emerging segment like railway and solar will help KEC deliver 27% earnings CAGR over FY16‐18E. We maintain ‘Accumulate’ on the stock. The stock is trading at 11.9x of FY17E earnings. We believe that a strong order book and improving margin profile will help KEC deliver 27% earnings CAGR over FY16‐18E. We maintain ‘Accumulate’ on the stock For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. description: Motilal Oswal is bullish on Suprajit Eng has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 705 in its research report dated Februrary 10, 2016.
title: Buy Aarti Drugs; target of Rs 705: Motilal Oswal  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Motilal Oswal's research report on Aarti Drugs Revenues at INR 265cr, +2% YoY were 3% lower than our estimate of INR 273cr. Although the company increased its capacity specifically in metformin, during the current quarter, it did not have any impact on revenue as most of it is exported to nations in Africa and Middle East which have witnessed a demand slowdown due to decline in crude oil prices. Thus exports for the company witnessed a double digit decline. Slowdown is particularly observed in case of governments of many of these nations who are curbing imports and depleting their inventories. However domestic revenues which form 60% of the overall topline, recorded double digit growth. EBITDA at INR 43.1cr is lower by 1% YoY and is 6% below our estimate of INR 45.8cr. EBITDA margins at 16.3% were 60bp lower YoY. PAT at INR 17.0cr declined 23% YoY which is 10% below our estimate of INR 18.9cr. Higher tax rate of 25% in the current quarter against 16% in 3QFY15 impacted PAT growth. PBT growth stood at -13%. The company is likely to witness gradual improvement in topline growth from 4QFY16 onwards when it starts the sale of high value products initially in the anti-diarrheal and anti-diabetic segment viz. metformin and later in anti-biotics. We believe FY17E topline growth will recover to 15% which should translate into 22% growth in profits on the back of higher operating leverage. Aarti Drugs is a high quality proxy play on the pharma industry. The company is climbing higher in the API value chain by selectively expanding into those APIs which are being currently imported and are of higher value. Based on the below expected performance in 3QFY16, we reduce our earnings estimates for the company by 11%/ 17% for FY16/17E. Despite this we expect the company to grow its profits at 20% CAGR over FY16-18E. We value Aarti Drugs at 18x Sep 2017E EPS which is a 20% discount to the mean multiple commanded by formulation companies and maintain our BUY rating on the stock with a target price of INR 705/share (earlier INR 800) For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. description: JK Jain, Derivative Analyst at Karvy Stock Broking recommends selling Century Textiles and Industries and advises buying GAIL India.

description: The shares will be listed on the SME platforms of the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and National Stock Exchange (NSE).
title: Seven SMEs file draft papers in 2016 to launch IPOs  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}To tap the upbeat investor sentiments, as many as seven small and medium enterprises ( SME s) have filed draft papers to float their initial public offerings this year. The shares will be listed on the SME platforms of the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and National Stock Exchange (NSE). Since the beginning of 2016, seven companies have filed draft documents to collectively mop up about Rs 34 crore through their IPOs, according to an analysis. Four firms - Sysco Industries, Kranti Industries, Raghav Ramming Mass and AGI Hospitalities - filed papers to launch their IPOs on BSE's SME platform, while Globe International Carriers, HEC Infra Projects and Artemis Electricals plan to list on NSE Emerge. These companies are from sectors such as logistics services, automotive components, infrastructure and hospitality, among others. According to market experts, increasing number of firms coming on SME exchanges send positive signals and lend a lot of confidence to SME capital markets. "Listing will help them enter capital markets and finally to graduate on to mainboard," Hem Securities Director Gaurav Jain said. "We are looking forward to a number of IPOs from different cities in the next 6-8 months, which will join the club of listed companies. It will send a positive signal to other SME s which are keen to tap the capital markets," he added. In 2015, 43 companies were listed to garner about Rs 327 crore from SME platforms. BSE and the National Stock Exchange (NSE) had launched SME platforms in March 2012, becoming the only two bourses to offer such a segment in the country. Since then, several companies have got listed on them and some have even shifted to the mainboard. The platform provides opportunity to SME entrepreneur s to raise equity capital for growth and expansion. It also provides immense opportunity for investors to identify and invest in good SME s at an early stage.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

title: Accumulate Pidilite Ind; target of Rs 585: Prabhudas Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Pidilite Ind PIDI reported 50.2% Adj. PAT growth on 700bps expansion in EBITDA, volume growth improved to 10% (1% in Q2) as impact of late Diwali, festival and marriage season and impact of tactical pricing boosted volumes. Gross margins expanded by 780bps due to gains from decline in prices of VAM and other crude‐linked inputs. Near‐term margin outlook looks strong, given further softening of crude prices. We value the stock on SOTP (32xDec17 Standalone EPS) and arrive at price target of Rs585. We expect premium valuations to sustain, given strong brands and long‐term growth potential. Retain ‘Accumulate’. description: Motilal Oswal is bullish on Ramco Cements has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 450 in its research report dated Februrary 9, 2016.
title: Buy Ramco Cements; target of Rs 450: Motilal Oswal  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Motilal Oswal's research report on Ramco Cements Ramco Cement’s (TRCL) 3QFY16’s volume de-growth reduced from double digit level of previous 5 quarters to 5.4%YoY (-5% QoQ) to 1.63mt led by broader stabilization in south market and base effect. Realizations were resilient at 0.5% QoQ. With marginal contribution from wind power business, revenue stood at INR8.1b (3.3%YoY, -7% QoQ).TRCL offers strong play on southern recovery due to (a) superior brand, (b) edge over cost efficiencies, and (c) visibility of deleveraging (stared in FY16). Our assumption of 6% volume and 4% price CAGR to drive 15%/22% EBITDA/PAT CAGR for TRCL in FY16-18. We upgrade FY16- 18 EBITDA by 6-12% to factor in better price, volume and cost. The stock trades at 9.3x/7.2x FY17E/18E EV/EBITDA, and EV/ton of USD97. We maintain Buy with a TP of INR450, an upside of 20% (valuing cement business at 8.5x FY18E EBITDA, EV/ton of USD105). description: Motilal Oswal has recommended neutral rating on Power Finance with a target price of Rs 186 in its research report dated Feruary 9, 2016.
title: Motilal Oswal: neutral on Power Finance; target of Rs 186   - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Motilal Oswal's research report on Power Finance Power Finance Corporation’s 3QFY16 reported PAT grew 3% YoY to INR15.82b (13% miss) led by higher provisions and margins contractions. Abs. NPLs spiked 57% QoQ led to increase in provisions to INR4.8b (est. of INR 2.8b). Uptick in NPLs also led to interest reversal resulting 30bp QoQ decline in NIMs to 4.98%.  Loan growth continues to slowdown (15.6% in 3QFY15 to 14.7% in FY15 to 11.6% in 3QFY16) to INR2.23t as overall demand remains subdued. Loans to SEBs (+17% YoY) continue to be a key driver of growth as the transitional finance continued. Share of private sector in the overall loan mix declined by 30/100bp QoQ/YoY to 15.7%. Under the UDAY scheme for financially distressed discoms, state governments would take over 75% of discom debt and remaining 25% of the debt would be guaranteed by the state government. While this would mitigate some asset quality concerns, but this would negatively impact earnings, as its yields would decline to ~10% from existing 12%. Further its spread/NIM would also decline 90bp/100bp to 2.4%/3.5% respectively. ROAs are likely to decline to ~2% and with ROEs at ~14% (down from 18%+ currently). While the stock trades at cheap valuation of 0.6x FY17 P/B, we are cutting our FY16/17 estimates by 11/20% to factor in lower yields and higher credit cost, we downgrade the stock to Neutral with a TP of INR186 (0.6x FY17BV).
