description: Motilal Oswal is bullish on PTC India has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 80 in its research report dated Februrary 9, 2016.
title: Buy PTC India; target of Rs 80: Motilal Oswal  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Motilal Oswal's research report on PTC India During 3QFY16, PTC India reported revenues stood at INR29.4b (up 4% YoY), vs estimate INR36.4b. Lower than estimate revenue was owing to lower realisation while volumes were 3% ahead of estimate. Reported EBIDTA stood at INR545m (up 19% YoY), though post inclusion of rebate and surcharge income of INR126m. Thus, adjusted for the same, EBIDTA stood at INR419m, below estimate of INR446m. This was led by higher operating expenditure rather than lower trading margin. Reported PAT stood at INR453m, tad higher than estimate of INR424m owing to rebate/surcharge and marginally lower tax rate. We expect PTC to report consolidated net profit of INR3.4b in FY16E (up 8% YoY) and INR3.7b in FY17E (up 10% YoY). PTC trades at 5.2x PER and 0.7x P/B on FY17E basis. Our SOTP based TP is INR80/sh, valuing trading income at 8x FY18E, PTC Financial services at market valuation less 25% HOLDCO discount and other investment at book value. Buy. description: Khambatta Securities is bullish on ICICI Bank has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 284 in its research report dated January 29, 2016.
title: Buy ICICI Bank; target of Rs 284: Khambatta Securities  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Khambatta Securities's research report on ICICI Bank ICICI Bank‟s reported highly disappointing 3Q FY16 financial results. Higher provisioning for deteriorating asset quality dented the net profit during the quarter; however, net interest income (NII) was in-line with our expectation. During the quarter, bank reported 13.3% y-o-y growth in NII to Rs 54.53 bn against our estimate of Rs 55.01 bn, aided by healthy growth in advances and robust net interest margin (NIM). Advances grew by 15.8% y-o-y while NIM improved by 7 bps y-o-y to 3.53%. In 3Q FY16, bank reported 4.5% y-o-y growth in net profit to Rs 30.18 bn on account of healthy non-interest income. Higher non-interest income protected the operating results. During the quarter, non-interest income grew by 36.4% y-o-y and 40.2% q-o-q to Rs 42.17 bn on back of Rs 12.43 bn profit on sale of 4.0% shareholding in ICICI Prudential Life Insurance Company. Adjusting the profit of Rs 12.43 bn of ICICI prudential, bank reported 4% y-o-y decline in non-interest income to Rs 29.74 bn. During the quarter, fee income reported 7.2% y-o-y growth to Rs 22.62 bn.Considering the pressure on asset quality and net profit, we have revised our target price from Rs 370/share to Rs 284/share, implying “Strong Buy”. At CMP of 230, stock is available at 1.76x FY16E standalone adjusted book value (ABV) of Rs 130 and 1.59x FY17E standalone ABV of Rs 145. Adjusting the subsidiary companies‟ valuation of Rs 66/share, ICICI bank‟s stock is available at 1.25x FY16E ABV of Rs 130 and 1.13x FY17E standalone ABV of Rs 145. Our valuation is based on sum-of-the-parts methodology. The valuation of ICICI Bank standalone is Rs 217/share based on 1.50x FY17E standalone ABV of Rs 145 (Earlier we have valued 303 based on 1.80x FY17E ABV of Rs 169/share) and the valuation of subsidiaries is Rs 67/share (after offering 30% discount). Consequently we arrive at target price of Rs 284/share per share, representing ~ 23% upside. At CMP of Rs 230, we continue with “Strong Buy”. description: Prabhudas Lilladher is bullish on Shree Cement Ind has recommended accumulate rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 12000 in its research report dated February 3, 2016.
title: Accumulate Shree Cement; target of Rs 12000: P.Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Shree Cement Shree Cement (SRCM) reported Q2FY16 earnings marginally below our expectation on account of lower‐than‐expected realisations. However, company positively surprised us with steeper than expected reduction in costs. This resulted in flat EBITDA/t QoQ despite 6%/Rs230 fall in realisations. We reiterate our positive outlook on SRCM, given its highly efficient operations, quality management and strong growth potential. We maintain ‘Accumulate’ with PT of Rs12,000. We expect SRCM’s EBITDA to grow at CAGR of ~36% in FY15‐FY18 on the back of strong volume growth and bottomed‐out margins. Sizeable capacity base of 27m tonnes, strong balance sheet and quality operations would sustain premium valuations for the stock. Company has multiple options to augment the capacity through brown field expansion in East by 2m tonnes and setting up a green field plant of 4m tonnes in Karnataka (land already acquired). Plant in Karnataka would make SRCM a Pan‐India player with entry in South and Maharashtra. description: Axis securities is bullish on Thermax has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 1050 in its research report dated February 2, 2016.
title: Buy Thermax; target of Rs 1050: Axis securities  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Axis securities's research report on Thermax Thermax' (TMX) Q3FY16 revenue, EBITDA and PAT declined by 9%, 25% and 11% YoY, broadly in line with our expectations. Order inflow at Rs 8.7 bn (down 29%)continued to be weak due to absence of any large orders on subdued market conditions. FY16 outlook: Management expects FY16 sales to decline 5%, but EBITDA margin is expected to remain in double digit due to cost rationalization and value engineering. Management also indicated about certain large orders wherein it is the lowest bidder which will be booked in Q4 post receipt of advance (our channel checks indicate it to be ~Rs 15 bn). Based on this, FY16 order inflow would be flat-to-marginally higher YoY, despite 14% drop in 9MFY16 order inflows to ~Rs 26 bn.We lower FY16E EPS to Rs28 (vs. 31 earlier) and FY17E EPS to Rs 35 (vs. 37 earlier) due to lower order inflow estimate for FY16. However, we raise our target PE to 30xFY17E vs. 25x earlier due to potential benefit from new emission norms for power plants and refineries. Our revised TP stands at Rs 1,050 vs. Rs 922 earlier. We introduce FY18 EPS of Rs 42. description: Prabhudas Lilladher is bullish on Bharat Forge has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 990 in its research report dated Februrary 9, 2016.
title: Buy Bharat Forge; target of Rs 990: Prabhudas Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Bharat Forge With export sales recording a second successive quarter of YoY decline, BHFC’s revenues declined 12.2% YoY and 5.8% QoQ. But with a favourable product mix, cost control measures and low commodity prices, EBITDA margin was robust at 30.2% (higher 140bps QoQ and flat YoY). Standalone adjusted profit in Q3FY16 was as expected at Rs1.7bn, a decline of 13.9% YoY. Medium‐term and long‐term outlook for BHFC remains healthy and its strategy for Aerospace, Defence and Auto transmission parts provides reason for optimism. In the near‐term, benefits for India CV recovery and increase in sales of the PV segment would be balanced by Oil & Gas sector slowdown and sluggish North American truck demand. H2FY16 is likely to be subdued for BHFC, with a better performance outlook from FY17 onwards. We lower our estimates to factor in the lower‐than‐expected revenue growth and weaker subsidiary performance by 7.2%/8.5% for FY16/17e. At the current market price, the stock is trading at 23.8x FY16e EPS and 19.5x FY17e. We maintain “BUY” with a price target of Rs990. description: Emkay is bullish on DCM Shriram and has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 131 in its research report dated February 3, 2016.
title: Buy DCM Shriram; target of Rs 131: Emkay  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Emkay's research report on DCM Shriram Consolidated revenues at Rs 12.5bn (+6% yoy) came below our est of Rs 12.9bn on the back of lower than est sales in sugar business EBIT margin improved 210bps yoy to 5.3% however were lower than est 7.9% due to lower than est margins in agri business While weakness sugar business led to EBIT loss of Rs 19mn, higher realizations in chloralkali led to 780bps EBIT margin expansion in chemical business. PBT stood at Rs624mn registering a growth of 119% yoy Improvement in sugar realizations and increased sales in agri business if monsoon is normal remain key trigger for the stock. description: Motilal Oswal is bullish on GlaxoSmith Con has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 7000 in its research report dated Februrary 10, 2016.
title: Buy GlaxoSmith Con; target of Rs 7000: Motilal Oswal  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Motilal Oswal's research report on GlaxoSmith Con GSK Consumer's (SKB) posted flattish net sales growth to INR9.9b impacted by phasing out of excise duty (up 530bps YoY). Net sales including other operating income was up 1.7% YoY to INR10.3b (est. INR10.5b). Business auxiliary income saw 12% growth in 3QFY16 (impacted by stock pipeline correction across brands). EBITDA grew 50.9% YoY to INR1.6b (est. INR1.4b), while adjusted PAT was up 36.8% YoY to INR1.32b (est. INR1.25b). We believe demand trends to have bottomed out and benign input costs (SMP and milk prices softening) to further drive profitability. We largely retain our estimates with underlying domestic story in malted foods being intact in our view (GSK has initiated several marketing/network optimization initiatives to drive the incipient volume growth). GSK trades at 17% discount to the sector average P/E of 36x, which seems unwarranted in our view, Maintain Buy with target price of INR7,000. Sharp hike in input costs is a key near term risk. description: GEOJIT BNP PARIBAS has recommended hold rating on Supreme Industries with a target price of Rs 768 in its research report dated January 29, 2016.
title: Hold Supreme Ind; target of Rs 768: GEOJIT BNP PARIBAS  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}GEOJIT BNP PARIBAS's research report on Supreme Ind Supreme Industries Ltd (SIL) is India’s leading player in plastic products, offering wide range of products, including Plastic Piping system, Packaging products, Industrial and Consumer products. In Q2FY16, SIL PAT grew by 133% YoY to Rs82cr.  Revenue declined by 6% YoY, owing to de-growth in Industrial segment by -21% YoY and lower commodity prices impacting realisation. EBITDA margins improved by 340bps YoY to 15.5% led by lower Raw Material cost. During the quarter volume growth was tepid at 5% YoY. But we expect pickup in volume to 9% for FY17E. Debt has reduced to Rs272cr from Rs656cr YoY. We value SIL at P/E of 21x on FY18E and increase the target price from Rs704 to Rs768, with a HOLD rating.At CMP, SIL is trading at average 1yr fwd P/E of 22x. We believe that going forward volume growth is expected to pick up in plastic piping and packaging segment. Higher contribution from value added products and lower cost will help in expansion of EBITDA margins. SIL‟s new products (LPG cylinders & fire sprinklers), is likely provide higher revenue trajectory going ahead. We value SIL at 21x on FY18E with a target price of Rs768 and we have a „HOLD‟ rating. For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. description: Amit Gupta of ICICIdirect recommends buying Titan Company on dips and feels that ITC may test Rs 300.
title: Buy Titan Company on dips, ITC may hit Rs 300: Amit Gupta  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Amit Gupta of ICICIdirect told CNBC-TV18, "In Nifty we are expecting more fall to happen after day before yesterday’s short formation and I think ITC and HDFC Bank are the two stocks among the heavy weights may fall which can drag the market lower. In ITC 325 three future blocks have happened with very substantial positions on the short side. The stock did not take out that level in this particular upmove and then it has started coming down; 320 Call have been started getting written in the market, so either you sell 320 Call option or you short futures. Possibly Rs 300 is likely to come in ITC." "HDFC Bank from the private banking space was an outperformer but we have seen clearly the signs of tiring out because you can’t keep that much of divergence from the lower band of the stocks. So, Rs 1,050 was very crucial because twice we had seen very high volume activity there in the stock. It has come below that level finally, so I think it is moving towards Rs 980-1,000 levels. This may be one of the dragger among that space," he said. "From the consumer discretionary space, possibly I will look at Titan Company because around 58 percent of short closer we have seen. It is very contrary to the market because if you look at other flows, Nifty is down but this stock is almost 15-20 percent higher. So, it is definitely defying the trend and it is possible that the stock will continue to move up. In the last one week also this closer of positions has been seen. After the results, at Rs 335-345 good delivering buying is seen. It is a good stock to buy on declines for target of around Rs 380-390."$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Prabhudas Lilladher is bullish on Bharat Elec Ind has recommended accumulate rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 1353 in its research report dated January 28, 2016.
title: Accumulate Bharat Elec; target of Rs 1353: Prabhudas Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Bharat Elec Bharat Electronics (BEL) revenues disappointed while margins surprised on the positive side. BEL reported sales of Rs15.2bn, down 5.7% YoY (PLe: Rs18.5bn). The weak execution was due to a combination of delayed vendor dispatches as well as inventory increases due to delay in pick up by few clients. Major projects supplied during the quarter include Akash Missile System( Airforce, Army), Fire control System, 3D Tactical Control Radar, Low Level Light Weight radar, Gigabit Ethernet based Ship Data Network, L band Radar for exports. BEL reported EBITDA of Rs2.9bn, up 5.2% YoY (PLe: Rs2.8bn) and margins improved by 200bps to 19.3% due to better mix. Other income was up 19% YoY to Rs1.4bn and Adj. PAT was up 8.8% YoY to Rs2.9bn (PLe: Rs2.5bn). The stock is trading at 21.3x FY17E earnings. We believe BEL will be the prime beneficiary of government focus on modernization of current fleet and procurement of new capital equipments. Increased focus on R&D, move towards being system integrator and increased focus outsourcing are steps in right direction to increase long term sustainability of business. We continue to believe BEL offers good investment opportunities to investors who want to invest in the Indian Defence sector with a long‐term view. We expect stock to deliver earnings CAGR of 12% over FY14‐17E. Maintain ‘Accumulate’. description: Motilal Oswal is bullish on Gujarat Pipavav has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 198 in its research report dated January 28, 2016.
title: Buy Gujarat Pipavav; target of Rs 198: Motilal Oswal  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Motilal Oswal's research report on Gujarat Pipavav GPPV’s 3QFY16 revenue declined 10% YoY to INR1.7b (lower than the estimate of INR1.8b), driven by lower port volumes—mainly on the bulk front. However, EBIDTA for the quarter was flat YoY at INR1b— in line with our estimate. Better container volume (de-growth muted v/s expectation) and lower bulk (lower gross margin) led to better cost absorption and better EBIDTA margin. EBIDTA margin was 61% v/s estimate of 57.3%. Higher depreciation and tax, as also lower other income, impacted PAT. Reported PAT was INR533, down 40% YoY and lower than the estimate of INR639m. We cut our earnings ~10% for FY16/17 to factor depreciation, other income and tax. We now expect GPPV to report earnings of INR2.3b in FY16 (down 38% YoY) and INR2.7b in FY17 (up 24% YoY). The stock trades at PER of 28x and P/B of 3.3x on FY17E basis. We cut TP to INR198/sh from the earlier INR206/sh. While near-term headwinds persist on demand front, sizable growth options, good quality management and high FCF/ dividend possibility are the key positives. description: Prabhudas Lilladher is bullish on Maruti Suzuki has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 4844 in its research report dated January 28, 2016.
title: Buy Maruti Suzuki; target of Rs 4844: Prabhudas Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Maruti Suzuki Maruti Suzuki’s (MSIL’s) performance in Q3FY16 was weak due to lower‐thanexpected EBITDA margins, coupled with lower non‐operating income and higherthan‐ expected depreciation provision. While MSIL’s sales growth at 19.9% YoY to Rs150.8bn was on expected lines, EBITDA margin at 14.4% was impacted by a combination of provision for bonus with retrospective effect from April 2014, higher sales promotion and marketing expenses, adverse fixed cost incidence due to decretion of inventory and higher maintenance cost for the Gurgaon plant. Resultantly, EBITDA was Rs21.7bn, which was lower than expectation of Rs23.8bn, while reported profit was Rs10.2bn, which though higher 27.1% YoY, was lower than expected. We lower our EPS estimate by 8.5% for FY16e and 7.1% for FY17e to factor in the tepid Q3FY16 performance. We expect revenue CAGR of 18% over FY15‐18e, with an adjusted profit CAGR of 28.8% and EBITDA margin expansion of 280bps to 15.8%. The stock is currently trading at 18.6x FY17e EPS. Our revised target price is Rs4,844 based upon 22xFY17e (previously Rs4,977). At our price target, MSIL would trade at a cash PE 15x FY17e (currently trades at 12.7x). We maintain ‘BUY’. For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. description: Motilal Oswal is bullish on Aarti Ind has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 630 in its research report dated February 9, 2016.
title: Buy Aarti Ind; target of Rs 630: Motilal Oswal  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Motilal Oswal's research report on Aarti Ind Revenues were lower by 2.1% YoY . Average benzene price was Rs 44/kg in Q3 FY16 v/s Rs 51.5/kg in Q2 FY16 and Rs 53/kg in Q1 FY16. In Q3 FY 16, the volume growth in this segment was ~10-12% YoY vs 7-8% in Q2 FY 16. EBIT for the segment increased ~32% YoY owing to better product mix. Owing to declining benzene prices, there was an inventory markdown loss of INR 5cr in this quarter. The expansion in the NCB, toulene, and ethylene based chemistry is in process and commercial production is likely to start by 1QFY17. The company is confident of acheiving 15-20% volume growth & margin expansion in the next 2-3 yrs as these fresh capacities are commissioned. The company has incurred a capital expenditure of INR 250cr in the 1st nine months of FY 16. Aarti Industries is a high quality proxy play on rising demand for specialty chemicals in India (15% CAGR FY15- FY20E) and eastward migration of global chemical manufacturing (Asia to have 70% production share by 2030). EBIT/Ton to improve in Speciality Chemicals segments on benefits of operating leverage and better product mix. AIL is setting up capacities for different chemistries which gives us visibility of volume growth for the next three years. We expect profits growth at 21% CAGR over FY15-17E and improve its ROCE from 17% in FY15 to 19% in FY17E. We believe Aarti Industries is available at attractive valuations of 8.3x FY17E EBITDA. Our SOTP based price target for Aarti Industries is at INR 630 providing for an upside of 28% For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. description: Prabhudas Lilladher is bullish on Sadbhav Engg has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 340 in its research report dated February 9, 2016.
title: Buy Sadbhav Engg; target of Rs 340: Prabhudas Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Sadbhav Engg Sadbhav Engineering (SEL) reported revenues of Rs7.5bn (PLe: Rs8.2bn), up 4% YoY. Revenues from Roads were up 25%, while Irrigation and Mining segment were down 27 and 34% YoY respectively. EBITDA was up 0.6% YoY to Rs739m, though EBITDA margins dipped 40bps YoY to 9.8% (PLe: 10.8%) due to increase in other expense (VAT payment on Mysore Bellary project), Adj. PAT was down 31% YoY to Rs260m (PLe: Rs382m). SEL is focusing on completing current order book from irrigation segment as it want to concentrate on larger ticket size orders going ahead. SEL believes new EPC projects won in FY16 will drive growth in FY17.The stock is trading at core PE of 16x FY17E earnings. We have cut our earnings by ~20% for FY16 and FY17 to factor in weak execution in current quarter and delay in getting new orders. We continue to believe the healthy and improving outlook across segments augur well for future growth. Limited commitment on the current BOT portfolio and well‐funded balance sheet makes it well‐placed to benefit from improved ordering in the Road sector. title: Buy Power Grid; target of Rs 160: Prabhudas Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Power Grid Power Grid Corporation of India (PWG) reported sales growth of 24% YoY to Rs54bn (PLe: Rs52bn). description: Prabhudas Lilladher is bullish on ICICI Bank has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 300 in its research report dated January 28, 2016.
title: Buy ICICI Bank; target of Rs 300: Prabhudas Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on ICICI Bank ICICI Bank (ICICIBC) reported dismal performance with sharp deterioration in asset quality led by fresh slippages of Rs65.4bn. Credit cost increased sharply to 269bp (annualized) however as the bank ploughed the stake sale gains in life insurance business into provisions, the damage to coverage ratio was limited to 422bp. Bank suggested that soft commodity prices (particularly steel) and continued weak economic environment has resulted in such high NPL accretion. On operational front NII stood inline with our estimates (13% YoY growth) while fee income maintains tepid trend line growth of 6% YoY. We fine‐tune our earnings and lower our PT to Rs300 (from Rs360) based on 1.7x Sep‐2017E ABV. We maintain BUY. description: Motilal Oswal has recommended neutral rating on Vedanta with a target price of Rs 68 in its research report dated January 28, 2016.
title: Motilal Oswal: neutral on Vedanta; target of Rs 68   - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Motilal Oswal's research report on Vedanta Vedanta’s (VEDL) 3QFY16 EBITDA declined 20% QoQ (49% YoY) to INR29.1b (adj. for INR2b one-time benefit in copper business), 6% miss. The beat at zinc India and aluminum was partly offset by weaker oil, zinc international and power. Adj. loss after tax of INR1.8b was on expected lines. Net attributable debt was up INR28b. VEDL is taking great efforts to reduce cost and preserve cash to tide over the cyclical downturn. Indian zinc and copper businesses are still strong, while merchant power, iron ore, oil and international zinc businesses are stressed. Although VEDL has high-quality operating assets, the capital structure is highly inefficient—with huge cash flow and liability mismatch (Exhibit 5). The announced merger with Cairn India is critical to maintain liquidity. However, the divergence in stock performance has put the merger at risk. Further, the hope of minority buyout in HZL too has faded with recent Supreme Court advice to Govt. of India against further divestment.  Despite a sharp correction in stock price, the risk to equity value still remains high owing to high leverage. Maintain Neutral with a target price of INR68. For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. description: Aditya Agarwal of Way2Wealth Securities is of the view that one can short HDFC, TVS Motor and Tata Steel.
title: Short HDFC, TVS Motor, Tata Steel: Aditya Agarwal  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Aditya Agarwal of Way2Wealth Securities told CNBC-TV18, " HDFC has given a negative break on crucial support of Rs 1,190-1,200 levels last month and thereafter it consolidated in that range, but now in the last three trading sessions, we have seen some renewed selling pressure in the stock. In this last few trading sessions, we have seen a lot of short positions getting built up in HDFC.""The overall trend for HDFC still remains weak and we are expecting the stock to test Rs 1,120-1,100 levels in the short-term. So, any pullback towards Rs 1,145-1,148, it can be used to initiate short positions keeping a stop loss of Rs 1,160. Target will be Rs 1,120-1,100," he added." TVS Motor is languishing in a range of Rs 260-295 for the last couple of weeks. Now, the stock is adding short positions. Today, it has added almost 3 percent of shares in open interest which is again on the short side. So, overall, we are expecting that this stock will again continue to trade with a negative biasness and again come to the lower end of this range which is around Rs 268-265 levels. So, at current level, one can go short keeping a stop loss of Rs 288 and target of Rs 268.""We are seeing some short positions getting built up in Tata Steel . So, we expecting the selling pressure may continue and the stock may come towards Rs 215 levels. So, at current level, one may go short keeping a stop loss of Rs 237 and target of Rs 215."" Sun Pharma is one stock which is seeing a lot of buying interest at lower levels. Today, the stock has added almost 4 percent shares in open interest, in yesterday’s session also, we saw some long positions getting built up at lower levels. So, we are expecting that Sun Pharma would test Rs 890-895 levels in the short-term. We are recommending to buy a Call option-860 Call option at current level with a target of Rs 44 and stop loss will be Rs 18."$("

description: Motilal Oswal has recommended neutral rating on Ipca Labs with a target price of Rs 680 in its research report dated February 8, 2016.
title: Motilal Oswal: neutral on Ipca Labs; target of Rs 680  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Motilal Oswal's research report on Ipca Labs IPCA’s 3Q PAT at INR232m (54%YoY decline) was significantly below expectations due to sharp revenue disappointment (@INR6.8b, 13% miss) and inventory write of INR240m. EBITDA also declined 26%YoY (22% miss), driven by negative operating leverage and inventory write offs in 3Q. Post 3Q miss, we cut our FY17/18E EPS est. by 14/12% respectively mainly on delay in US FDA resolution and slower ramp up in Institutional business. At CMP, stock trades at 25x/16x FY17E/18E EPS, at a discount to 3 year average P/E. We believe that an earnings rebound (26% EPS CAGR) is largely factored in. However, early resolution of the USFDA-banned facilities could provide further trigger to our estimates. Retain Neutral on IPCA with target price of INR680 (17x FY18E, 20% discount to mid-cap peers). description: Motilal Oswal is bullish on SKS Microfinance has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 619 in its research report dated January 28, 2016.
title: Buy SKS Microfinance; target of Rs 619: Motilal Oswal  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Motilal Oswal's research report on SKS Microfinance SKSM 3QFY16 PAT was up 94% YoY to INR795m (in line with est.), driven by strong operating performance. Stellar AUM growth of 93% YoY, stable asset quality, increase in average incremental ticket size to above INR15,000 improving operating leverage and marginal cost of funds at sub 10% were the key highlights for the quarter. AUM during the quarter grew at a scorching pace of 93% YoY and 13% QoQ, driven by customer additions and traction in long-term loans. Ticket size increase was also led by RBI’s regulation allowing MFIs to lend higher amount to existing borrowers. Long-tenure loans (typically of two years) now constitute 32% of the total loan book v/s ~28% in the last quarter. Disbursements during the quarter were at INR29.8b (up 93% YoY and 12% QoQ). Large unmet demand, low competitive intensity, supportive regulations, strong balance sheet and best-in-class operating metrics have put SKSM on a high growth path. SKSM currently trades at 3.8x FY17E and 3.0x FY18E BV. While the valuations appear high, we believe they are justified—given the high medium-term growth visibility, strong profitability and superior asset quality. Current valuations should sustain and could improve, given the strong profitability (42% PAT CAGR over FY15-18), healthy asset quality and capitalization. We increase our FY17/FY18 estimates marginally by 1.4%/2.6% to account for higher growth. Maintain Buy with a target price of INR619 (3.5x FY18E BV). description: Prabhudas Lilladherl is bullish on Bajaj Auto has recommended accumulate rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 2525 in its research report dated February 4, 2016.
title: Accumulate Bajaj Auto; target of Rs 2525: P.Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Bajaj Auto Bajaj Auto’s (BJAUT’s) Q3FY16 performance was healthy despite lower export volumes, both QoQ and YoY. Led by higher realisations and improved gross margins, adjusted EBITDA margin was higher 90bps YoY at 21.2%; EBITDA margin was the second‐highest in the past nine quarters. Higher‐than‐expected nonoperating income led to adjusted profit being better than expectations at Rs8.6bn, a growth of 7.1% YoY. We have lowered our volume estimates by 4.7%/7% for FY16e/17e and profit estimate at 2.7%/5.1%, respectively. At the current market price, the stock is trading at 18.5x FY16E and 16.3x FY17E. We value the stock at 18x FY17 core earnings (Rs2073) and Rs452 as value of cash and investments and arrive at a target price of Rs2,525 share and maintain ‘Accumulate’ on the stock. description: Kunal Bothra, Head of Advisory at LKP Securities recommends buying Amara Raja Batteries, Godrej Industries and Manappuram Finance and advises selling OBC.
title: Buy Amara Raja Batteries, Godrej Industries, Manappuram Finance; sell OBC: Kunal Bothra  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Kunal Bothra, Head of Advisory at LKP Securities told CNBC-TV18, "The four stocks which I am recommednign, three on the buy side and a solitary sell. The first one is a buy on Amara Raja Batteries . The stock is forming a congestion zone around this Rs 865-880 odd band. I believe if it breaks Rs 870-880 range, over the next couple of hours, I expect a breakout to happen. I am looking at Rs 930 as a target. This stock is also poised to break the 200-day moving averages well, so I think it is a good chart to really look at from the long side, keep stop loss at Rs 840 on the trade." "One can buy Godrej Industries . This is more of a contrarian trade. I think the stock has been taking good support around the Rs 335-340 band and today also, you are seeing some bit of mild recovery happening from the lows of the day. Expect a contrarian approach on the stock. The level of Rs 350 is the target which I am looking at on Godrej Industries with a stop loss at Rs 332," he said."The third stocks is a buy on Manappuram Finance . It is trying to break the upper end of the resistance of around Rs 29.80-30 and I expect a swift move happening. The stock is already trading at the upper end of the bolinger band so, if any move happens above Rs 30 or probably a closing above Rs 30, I expect the momentum to catch up in the stock. I would look at a target of Rs 33, keep stop loss of Rs 28.50.""I have a sell on Oriental Bank of Commerce . The stock has given us fresh breakdown on the daily charts. I expect a continuation in terms of downtrend from the short-term perspective. I would look at a target of Rs 94, keep stop loss at Rs 100."$("

description: Axis securities has recommended hold rating on Zydus Wellness Tech with a target price of Rs 780 in its research report dated February 8, 2016.
title: Hold Zydus Wellness; target of Rs 780: Axis securities  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Axis securities's research report on Zydus Wellness Zydus’ Q3 net sales at Rs1.1 bn was up 3% on a like-to-like basis (Q3’15 had Rs 223 mn additional excise duty credit from prior periods), below our estimate of 6%. The company cited a challenging demand environment and weakness in the face-wash category as the reasons for subdued growth. Gross margin was up 290 bps YoY on like-to-like basis, driven by favorable input prices. EBITDA margin at 21.7% was up 40 bps YoY. PAT at Rs 273 mn was below our estimate of Rs 355 mn. Distribution overhaul benefits have been talked of for several quarters now, but sales have not followed through (10 consecutive quarters of subdued growth). We cut our FY16/17 sales growth to 2%/10%(8%/14% earlier) and EBITDA margin to 23%/24% (24/24.5% earlier). Maintain HOLD with revised TP of Rs 780 (Rs 920 earlier). description: Axis securities has recommended hold rating on Hexaware Tech with a target price of Rs 252 in its research report dated February 8, 2016.
title: Hold Hexaware Tech; target of Rs 252: Axis securities  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Axis securities's research report on Hexaware Tech Hexaware’s Q4CY15 performance was lower than our estimates. Revenue growth and margin were largely impacted due to furloughs, calendar effect (lower working days), and Chennai floods. Outlook and strategy: Management is targeting to grow higher than industry (NASSCOM: 10-12%) in CY16 (Q1 and Q4 are seasonally soft quarters). Confidence stems from strong deal wins (total contract value: USD 120 mn) in CY15 which lends revenue visibility. However, margin will be similar to CY15 (EBITDA: ~17%). Hexaware’s strategy, "Shrink IT, Grow Digital" is targeted at large clients and has seen early signs of success around IMS, BPO and Testing in its recent wins. Management indicated effort savings of 30-50% in IMS and BPO can be achieved.We expect USD revenue CAGR of 13% overCY15-17E. Our EPS for CY16E/17E stands at Rs 15.7/ 18.2. Our target price of Rs 252 (16x CY16E) implies 7% upside from CMP of Rs. 235; hence we reduce our rating to HOLD (BUY earlier). The stock trades at 15x/13x CY16E/CY17E EPS. description: Motilal Oswal has recommended neutral rating on Divis Labs with a target price of Rs 1180 in its research report dated February 8, 2016.
title: Motilal Oswal: neutral on Divis Labs; target of Rs 1180   - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Motilal Oswal's research report on Divis Labs In 3Q, DIVI’s revenue grew 8% YoY (14% miss) to INR8.5b, impacted by holiday season and deferment of revenues to 4QFY16. EBITDA grew 13% YoY (14% miss) to INR3.2b and margin expanded 170bp YoY to 37.7%, led by currency benefits and better product mix. PAT grew 12% YoY to INR2.5b, aided by INR30m forex gain and lower than expected depreciation. DIVI trades at 27x FY16E, 23x FY17E and 18x FY18E (P/E), at par with historical average. Large capex addition and growing contribution of API generics are likely put margins under check. However, strong balance sheet (net cash) and high return ratios (RoE at ~29%) provide valuation cushion. We retain our Neutral stance and estimates. Our target price is INR1,180 (20x FY18E; in line with historical average), implying 11% upside. description: Religare has come out with its report on Automobile sector. According to the research firm, In all, we think 4Ws will be driven by new products in 2016.
title: Auto Expo’16: It’s raining UVs: Religare  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Religares research report on Automobile sectorThe 13th Auto Expo being held in Greater Noida (5-9 Feb) seems to have set the stage for combat in relatively niche 4W segments, especially compact sedans and SUVs. MSIL was the showstopper with its Vitarra Brezza and new concept Ignis, whereas Honda and TTMT also showcased some promising products. While the expo was largely a non-event for 2Ws, HMSI, TVS and UM did come up with new launches, and HMCL with more refreshes. In all, we think 4Ws will be driven by new products in 2016, with more novel, energy-efficient, and competitively-priced models on offer. The stage is also set for a 2W recovery in FY17, with a low base and multiple triggers ahead. For 2W players, the expo was a non-event with only refreshes of products, particularly for HMSI (Splendor I smart), though TVS did showcase its Victor bike and concept Akula 310 (likely launch from BMW collaboration), and BMW its G310 bike. BJAUT/RE were conspicuous by their absence, though both have already launched their new products V/Himalayan before the expo. HMSI however was one of the few 2W player’s to launch a new product, and unveiled Navi – an automatic scooter + motorcycle at Rs 39,000. While the product targets the youth, we found its positioning a bit confusing. A key surprise was UM Motorcycles foraying into India with the launch of Renegade Commando at Rs 159,000-169,000. While the bike looks promising, UM’s limited network and initial capacity of 3000/month is unlikely to move rivals. Most 2W players also showcased e-bikes, including Genze/Duet E by MM/HMSI. For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. description: Prabhudas Lilladher is bullish on Shree Cement Ind has recommended accumulate rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 12000 in its research report dated February 3, 2016.
title: Accumulate Shree Cement; target of Rs 12000: P.Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Shree Cement Shree Cement (SRCM) reported Q2FY16 earnings marginally below our expectation on account of lower‐than‐expected realisations. However, company positively surprised us with steeper than expected reduction in costs. This resulted in flat EBITDA/t QoQ despite 6%/Rs230 fall in realisations. We reiterate our positive outlook on SRCM, given its highly efficient operations, quality management and strong growth potential. We maintain ‘Accumulate’ with PT of Rs12,000. We expect SRCM’s EBITDA to grow at CAGR of ~36% in FY15‐FY18 on the back of strong volume growth and bottomed‐out margins. Sizeable capacity base of 27m tonnes, strong balance sheet and quality operations would sustain premium valuations for the stock. Company has multiple options to augment the capacity through brown field expansion in East by 2m tonnes and setting up a green field plant of 4m tonnes in Karnataka (land already acquired). Plant in Karnataka would make SRCM a Pan‐India player with entry in South and Maharashtra. description: Motilal Oswal is bullish on Repco Home has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 814 in its research report dated February 8, 2016.
title: Buy Repco Home; target of Rs 814: Motilal Oswal  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Motilal Oswal's research report on Repco Home Repco’s 3QFY16 PAT grew 25.5% YoY to INR386m (5% beat); strong operating performance was driven by +32% YoY increase in net income and muted opex due to nil ESOP charges. Loan growth (30% YoY), increase in calc. NIMs (7bp YoY) and 30bp YoY increase in NPLs were the key highlights. Business momentum remained strong, with loan book growing a healthy 30% YoY to INR71.5b, whereas sanctions/disbursement also grew at healthy rate of 20/25% respectively. Despite Chennai floods, the growth parameters remained strong. Calculated NIMs improved marginally (7bp YoY) to 4.45%, whereas spreads at 3.07% were up 29bp YoY. Spreads/NIMs improvement was led by a sharp 50bp YoY decline in CoF (led by rating upgrade in the last quarter and reduction in base rates); whereas calc. yields at 12.52% were down 20bp YoY. RHFL has delivered loan book CAGR of 34%+ over FY10-15, with equally impressive earnings growth of 25%. Presence in the underserved markets, pricing power on the asset side, recent rating upgrade (which is likely to lead to lower cost of fund), stringent cost control as well as credit appraisal processes and expanding reach will ensure earnings growth in near to medium term; we expect a healthy 30%+ loan/earnings growth for the next three years. We have marginally revised our FY16 estimates by ~4% and may re-visit the same post the conference call on Thursday, 11th February. Repco is currently trading at 3.5x FY17E BV. Maintain Buy with a TP INR814 (4.5x FY17 BV). content:

description: ICICIDirect is bullish on Tata Power and has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 67 in its research report dated February 9, 2016.
title: Buy Tata Power; target of Rs 67: ICICIDirect  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}ICICIDirect's research report on Tata Power Tata Power (TPL) reported a flat 1.7% YoY increase in revenue to | 8,952 crore, as a 59.5% YoY rise in other business was offset by 1.5% and 8.7% YoY decline in revenue across the power and coal business to | 6,450 crore and | 1,922.2 crore, respectively Availability across Mundra declined to 81% vs. 85% YoY. However, the company reversed impairment losses for the project amounting to | 2,320 crore resulting in a project level PAT of | 2,163 crore vs. loss of | 243 crore YoY. Coal sales volumes and realisation were at 20.9 MT and $42.1, respectively, in Q3FY16 EBITDA, however, increased 38.5% YoY to | 2,095 crore in Q3FY16 due to 19.3% YoY fall in fuel cost After adjusting for exceptional item of | 472 crore, TPL reported a PAT of | 260 crore (I-direct estimate of | 122 crore). Losses at Tata Solar declined to | 25 crore vs. | 91 crore YoY, respectively Tata’s Mumbai operation continues to remain strong, providing stable cash flows. However, the delay in APTEL’s interim order on Mundra is likely to impact the project’ cash flow, negatively impacting its financials for FY16E. Furthermore, the ongoing delay in execution of the Arutmin stake sale will impact TPL’s debt reduction plan. Accordingly, we have revised our SOTP target price to | 67 by assigning a targeted EV/reserves multiple for Bumi at 2x vs. 3x earlier. However, the stock price has corrected significantly recently. We believe the ongoing concern is already factored in the CMP of | 59. Thus, we upgrade TPL to BUY. description: Shares of Britannia Industries gained more than 3 percent intraday Wednesday on the back of robust numbers declared by the company in September-December quarter (Q3).
title: Britannia up 3% post good Q3 numbers; to demerge arm into co  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Moneycontrol BureauShares of Britannia Industries gained more than 3 percent intraday Wednesday on the back of robust numbers declared by the company in September-December quarter (Q3).The company's consolidated net profits increased by 51.2 percent at Rs 207.6 crore against Rs 137.3 crore, in the same quarter last fiscal.Its EBITDA was up 46.6 percent at Rs 322 crore and EBITDA margin was up at 14.4 percent versus 10.8 percent.The company has approved the demerger of manufacturing business division and retail sales business division of Daily Bread Gourmet Foods, a wholly-owned subsidiary of company, into the company.The turnover of the demerged entity stood at Rs 5,69,76,580, which is 0.08 percent of the total turnover of Britannia.According to SP Tulsian of sptulsian.com, generally, the problem in this volatile market is that expensive stocks have been seeing some profit booking and corrections. But, I think that once this volatility stops, otherwise also, I am expecting a positive behaviour on Britannia.""If you see, maybe for last one week or so, it has not seen that kind of correction. So, maybe this result will see the renewed buying coming back into the stock, but results are good and I have a positive view going ahead," he said.At 09:51 hrs Britannia Industries was quoting at Rs 2,828.10, up Rs 50.25, or 1.81 percent on the BSE.Posted by Rakesh Patil$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: SP Tulsian of sptulsian.com has a positive view on Britannia Industries.
title: Positive on Britannia Industries, says SP Tulsian  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}SP Tulsian of sptulsian.com told CNBC-TV18, "In Britannia Industries results are really good because profit after tax (PAT) is of Rs 207 crore against Rs 137 crore and operating profit has seen a big jump, almost about more than Rs 100 crore, from Rs 187 crore to Rs 294 crore. Generally, the problem in this volatile market is that expensive stocks have been seeing some profit booking and corrections. But, I think that once this volatility stops, otherwise also, I am expecting a positive behaviour on Britannia.""If you see, maybe for last one week or so, it has not seen that kind of correction. So, maybe this result will see the renewed buying coming back into the stock, but yes, results are good and I have a positive view going ahead," he said.I ahve not seen any problems in Bharat Forge , same thing for Motherson Sumi . Aurobindo Pharma , looking to the results and even going by the Apollo Tyres also, let us understand the Chinese threat. If you break Apollo Tyres ' number, we accepted that Q2 was the worst for the company and now, compare Q2 with Q3 I do not see any kind of problems. It is flat. Let us accept that in Q2, I am talking sequentially, the Indian operations have taken a big beating, maybe in terms of margin or maybe fall in the turnover. In fact European operations have shown double the increase in the EBIT. So, Apollo Tyres is the direct, is the worst stock facing the Chinese threat, because we have the Chinese threat in the truck tyres segment. It is not there in the two-wheelers while Ceat is the least affected." "Maybe if you want to have the pecking order, probably Apollo Tyres is the worst, then JK Tyre  and  MRF . So, we all knew that these kind of problems are going to be faced by the tyre industry, so taking that into consideration, I do not think that Apollo Tyres' results should be taken in as a big disappointment. If you take a sequential call on the Q3 over Q2 because Q2 was a clear acceptance that yes, things are going bad for their European operations. India is having a big threat.""Europe has vastly shown a good improvement in the working, but yes, Indian operations are continue to languish because of the Chinese threat."$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Emkay is bullish on Lupin has recommended accumulate rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 1955 in its research report dated February 8, 2016.
title: Accumulate Lupin; target of Rs 1955: Emkay  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Emkay's research report on Lupin Beat on EBITDA/PAT led by higher operating income which was nearly 3x expectations at Rs 1.9bn US sequential growth surprised as well – USD36mn QoQ despite lack of launches, largely driven by price hikes and higher volumes. Indicates much stronger Q4FY16/Q1FY17 ahead due to the full impact of price hikes and new launches Q3 outperformance and management commentary should improve near term earnings visibility though triggers through 2HFY17 and beyond still evolving Maintain Accumulate with TP of Rs 1,955/share, valuing the company at 22x FY18E EPS of Rs 89/share. Key risk remains further delay in approvals Overall though the price hikes and steady stream of launches alleviates near term earnings uncertainty, triggers for 2HFY17 and beyond still uncertain. See the stock supported by improved near term visibility. Maintain ACCUMULATE rating with target price of Rs 1,955/share valuing the company at 22x FY18e EPS of Rs 89/share. Key risk remains further delay in approvals. description: Axis securities has recommended hold rating on ABB with a target price of Rs 1213 in its research report dated February 8, 2016.
title: Hold ABB; target of Rs 1213: Axis securities  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Axis securities's research report on ABB ABB’s Q4CY15revenue at Rs24bnwasin line withour expectation of Rs24bn. EBITDA margin improved 290 bps YoYand beat our estimate by 180 bps. PAT at Rs1.3bn was 17% above our estimate on higher EBITDA (20% beat)offset somewhat by higher tax rate (38%) during the quarter. Order inflow at Rs20.6bndeclined by17% YoYdue to lack of large orders from conventional sectors, however base orders grew by ~10% YoY. Management indicated that demandfrom conventional sectors (steel, cement, etc.) and exports remainedweak (declined to ~12% of sales from ~17% in CY14), however impact was offset by growth from new sectors such as renewables, railways, etc. as well as growth in opex- driven services business (~Rs 10 bn in CY15).We cut our CY16 revenue growth to 10% (vs14% earlier) due to lower than expected order inflow in Q4 and flat order backlog YoY. Accordingly, we cutour CY16 EPS to Rs24 (Rs27 earlier).We introduce our CY17E EPS at Rs 30. Our TP stands atRs 1,213 (40x CY17E). description: Axis Direct is bullish on Arvind Ind has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 344 in its research report dated February 8, 2016.
title: Buy Arvind; target of Rs 344: Axis Direct  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Axis Direct's research report on Arvind Arvind’s Q3 consolidated revenue at Rs 21.6 bn (Rs 20.7 bn in Q3FY15) was marginally below our estimate of Rs 22.6 bn. Revenue from textiles at Rs 12.8 bn remained flat due to lower denim volumes. While Brands & Retail grew 12% YoY (Rs 7.4 bn), strong growth in Brands (up 22%) was offset by de-growth in Retail due to Megamart store closures (-16%).EBITDA at Rs 2.8 bn (flat YoY; our est of Rs 3 bn).Textiles margin at 18% (flat YoY), Brands &Retail at 7.6% (up 60 bps).We expect margin to improve on the back of maturing brands, rationalized Megamart stores and ramp up of new garment facility. Maintain BUY:We maintain our FY16E and FY17E EPS at Rs 14 and Rs 19 with SoTP-based TP at Rs 344 based on 7x FY17E EBITDA multiple for Textiles and 15x FY17E EBITDA for Brands & Retail. description: Nooresh Merani, CEO at Analyse India is of the view that one may keep a long term view in Gati.
title: Keep long term view in Gati, says Nooresh Merani  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Nooresh Merani, CEO at Analyse India told CNBC-TV18, "If you look at the operational performance that Gati has come out with, the earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortisation (EBITDA) margin came in close to 8.1-8.2 odd percent, but what has happened is with the investments, they are probably doing an expansion of their network pipeline. That is probably taking a toll on how their bottomline and the margin performance is pan out.""In terms of how the realty business has panned out for Gati, we are still assuming an annuity loss of around Rs 40-45 odd crore. On the e-commerce business, you have probably seen some improvement happening on a quarterly run-rate basis and that has probably happened because of the kind of sheer volume growth that we are probably witnessing in the e-commerce industry.""I think e-commerce has held up pretty well, the investments that they are doing even on the warehousing front, related to their Kausar business, even that is going to take some amount of toll on to the return ratio, so you are going to see a very slow and gradual recovery when it comes to earnings from Gati on a consolidated basis. They have actually cut down on the pincodes as well in the non-profitable routes that they used to cater to.""There is a consolidation plan in place. You are probably looking at, as I mentioned earlier, the network being improved and that expansion is entailing higher capital expenditure (Capex) and probably a tent on the return ratio. So, the investor needs to have a view of more than 2-3 years to say the least. And again, goods and services tax (GST) implementation is going to be a huge kicker for stocks like Gati. When that happens is a big question mark, but when it does happen, that is going to be a huge booster for earnings. From an interim point of view, the earnings will be under pressure, so one has to keep that patience into the stock and a long-term view of at least two years," he said.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Precision Camshafts, the auto ancillary company, disappointed investors on Monday, the listing day. The stock closed at Rs 177.45 on the National Stock Exchange, down 4.6 percent compared to issue price of Rs 186.
title: Precision Camshafts ends at Rs 177.45, down 4.6% on listing day  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Moneycontrol Bureau Precision Camshafts , the auto ancillary company, disappointed investors on Monday, the listing day. The stock closed at Rs 177.45 on the National Stock Exchange, down 4.6 percent compared to issue price of Rs 186. After opening at Rs 165, it fell as much as 17 percent in early trade to hit an intraday low of Rs 154.50 but then it managed to recoup some of its losses during the day to touch day's high of Rs 185. The stock was opened at Rs 165. Maharashtra-based Precision Camshafts manufactures over 150 types of camshafts for small and mid-sized passenger vehicle engines to a large number of companies, including some overseas original equipment manufacturers (OEM). The Rs 240-crore funds raised from the public issue will be utilised for setting up a machine shop for ductile iron camshafts at its unit at Solapur in Maharashtra, which is being put up for Rs 200 crore, and for other general corporate purposes. The company also plans to set up two more new machine shops for ductile iron camshafts and assembled camshafts by 2018.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Edelweiss Financial Services has been appointed as the lead merchant banker, while AZB & Partners and Nishith Desai Associates will be the legal advisors to the issue, according to sources.
title: BSE hires merchant bankers, legal team for its IPO  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Keen to launch its initial public offering (IPO), top stock exchange BSE has hired merchant bankers and a legal team for the issue. Edelweiss Financial Services has been appointed as the lead merchant banker, while AZB & Partners and Nishith Desai Associates will be the legal advisors to the issue, according to sources. BSE had late last month sought approval from capital markets regulator Sebi for launching the IPO, saying it is in compliance with all the requirements for the listing. The exchange has been seeking to get listed for a long time but necessary clearances have not been forthcoming on one or the other issue. While the rival National Stock Exchange (NSE) plan for an IPO seems to have stuck as it is pitching hard for self-listing but Sebi is believed to be firm on its rule that only allows cross-listing of stock exchanges. On the other hand, BSE has no problem with cross-listing. In 2012, BSE had hired 14 investment banks, including Bank of America Merrill Lynch, JP Morgan, Barclays, UBS, Kotak Mahindra Capital, ICICI Securities, Edelweiss Capital, Axis Capital and IIFL for its public issue. In a letter written to Sebi last month, BSE said that it is in full compliance with the requirements of the new SECC (stock exchanges and clearing corporations) Regulations and therefore it can proceed with its IPO plans. The exchange had requested Sebi to provide approval "permitting BSE to proceed with the IPO and listing of BSEs shares on a recognised stock exchange". Sebi, in January, had amended the existing SECC regulations to make it easier for stock exchanges to list their shares through an IPO. The move follows demand from investors in stock exchanges for listing of the bourses which can provide them an opportunity to unlock the value of their investments. BSE has been seeking to get listed for a long time and it had earlier filed an application with Sebi in this regard in 2013.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Ratnesh Kumar, Market Expert told CNBC-TV18, "Aviation is so hyper competitive, it is so capital intensive, historically I found it very tough to take fundamentally long term calls on the aviation sector. I am sure there are good airlines around the world which from time to time make money for investors. However, on a generic basis it is a tough sector to make a fundamental call and there are more structural growth story kind of sectors both in terms of business growth and even in terms of profitability and margins. So, I would avoid that segment."On Friday, Jet Airways ended at Rs 570.85, up Rs 41.40, or 7.82 percent on the BSE.$("

description: Ashish Kyal of wavesstrategy.com is of the view that one may buy Asian Paints with a target of Rs 935.
title: Super Six stocks you can bet on February 8  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}On CNBC-TV18's show Super Six, market gurus Simi Bhaumik, Gaurav Bissa and Ashish Kyal place their bets on two stocks each, thus offering investors a variety of options to choose from. Investors can read into the detailed analysis before agreeing to any or all the bets. Simi Bhaumik of simibhaumik.com I would suggest SKS Microfinance to go long today. This stock has staged a fresh breakout above Rs 563 and it is expected to do well today. My stoploss would be below Rs 550 and targets on the upside would be Rs 578 and Rs 584. Second stock is Motherson Sumi Systems . This stock is also looking well and it is likely to do well even today. Stoploss should be below Rs 262 and targets would be Rs 278 and Rs 282. Gaurav Bissa of LKP Securities My first recommendation today is a buy on Pidilite Industries . The stock has been trading in a range last few weeks, even few months. It was relatively stable as compared to some of the other midcaps which witnessed significant battering when it was seen plunging. I would recommend going long for target of Rs 625 and one can have a stoploss at Rs 585. My second recommendation is a buy on SKS Microfinance . The stock has seen consistent short covering; a very positive sign for the stock and this has been followed by fresh longs. It is one of the very beautiful patterns for the derivative part. It makes a good case for going long. For a short-term target of Rs 585 which if held can lead to another 30-40 points move from those levels. One can have a small stoploss at Rs 555 and go long in the stock. Ashish Kyal of wavesstrategy.com If you look at the charts of Asian Paints , this stock has continued to outperform when the volatility in the overall market has increased. There is a potential that this stock might outperform, both from short to medium-term perspective. One can buy Asian Paints with a stoploss of Rs 875 and the short-term target can be expected at Rs 935 on upside. The next stock is going to be sell on Maruti Suzuki . This stock has been drastically underperforming and we can see there has been a sharp sell-off from Rs 4,600 level to near about Rs 3,750 and still there is no recovery in the stock even when Nifty managed to close positively. This has been an underperformer. One can sell Maruti with a stoploss of Rs 3,880 and the target can be expected near the zone of Rs 3,530 on long side.$("

description: Shares of Lycos Internet gained 10 percent intraday Monday as it is going to acquire an Austrian company, TriTelA Gmbh, which owns the asset - mysms messenger and the tech platforms SPH Wien and Kika Social.
title: Lycos Internet gains 10%; to acquire Austrian company   - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Moneycontrol BureauShares of Lycos Internet gained 10 percent intraday Monday as it is going to acquire an Austrian company, TriTelA Gmbh, which owns  mysms messenger and the tech platforms SPH Wien and Kika Social.In this deal the Lycos will issue 2.848 crore additional shares in return for the 100 percent ownership of the company."mysms is a messenger that synchronises SMSes and instant messages between the wide range of mobile, web and desktop platform - all through a single cloud based-account. This product already has three million users and synchronising several hundred millions of messages," as per BSE release."SPH Wien is a content management and analytics platform for video and Kika Social is an unified platform for social media listening, engaging and measurement," it added.The company's third quarter (Sept-Dec) net profit increased by 27 percent at Rs 125.17 crore against Rs 98.87 crore, in the same quarter last year. At 09:24 hrs Lycos Internet was quoting at Rs 29.50, up Rs 2.15, or 7.86 percent on the BSE.Posted by Rakesh Patil$("

content:

In any case Punjab National Bank (PNB) looks good, in fact it could actually look like short-term reversal formation and so, there is a possibility that PNB can actually move up from the current level. I have kept a target at Rs 98.70 and put a stop loss at Rs 91.85. I have a feeling that the stock is likely to do well just as steel companies would." "You can still bet on Tata Steel and the target would be Rs 245 and put a stop loss below Rs 229 or Rs 228.80. However, problem with Tata Steel or JSW Steel would be that they are so tooted after Friday’s price action as well as the announcement of our MIP that you may not get a real good risk reward scenario in today’s trading. So, I have avoided steel for that reason," he said."However, if you look at Vedanta and Hindalco Industries put together , place them side by side, similar kind of formation, short term reversal and the kind of volumes they attracted suggested that some definite buying interest is there.""Metals can actually display a sustainable rally even if the Nifty continues to remain range bound. So, buy Vedanta with a stop loss below Rs 70.50 with target of Rs 79 and Hindalco with stop loss of Rs 68.75 and target of Rs 75.50. There are essentially short-term reversal formation but they can morph into good intermediate uptrend as well if things go in their favour.""I don’t think the rally in banking stocks is already over. There could be some more tailwind and stocks like Axis Bank and ICICI Bank can still move up; Rs 213 to about Rs 215 would be the target for ICICI Bank. For Axis Bank, Rs 414 would be the target, so if you play long here keep a close stop loss of about Rs 403 for Axis Bank and Rs 207.90 for ICICI Bank. You can still trade long in these stocks."$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Mayuresh Joshi of Angel Broking is of the view that one may hold Hindalco Industries.
title: Hold Hindalco Industries, says Mayuresh Joshi  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Mayuresh Joshi of Angel Broking told CNBC-TV18, "The kind of weak business environment that we are seeing in terms of end realisations either for aluminium or copper or zinc for that matter, I think those realisations are expected to remain soft over the next few quarters on multiple counts; what is happening with China, the LME inventory levels are at record high levels and though production cuts have started happening in the recent few weeks, is not going to justify the kind of demand, the contraction that we are witnessing in the end-user industries and that is a clear reflection in terms of how the pricing has panned out. So aluminium per tonne is closer to USD 1,500 mark and it has corrected significantly even alumina prices are down significantly on a quarter-on-quarter and year-on-year basis.""So what has happened in Hindalco Industries in terms of their capex, I think a large part of their capex specifically related to Novelis is largely over and we are expecting huge amount of positive cash flows to start generating over the next few years and the management is very hopeful in reducing their net debt to equity specifically on its overseas operations and even on consolidated scale," he added."On Novelis the management is hopeful of increasing the part of the auto component share to around 25 percent of the total revenues that Novelis generates. So there was a long drawn out plans but from an immediate medium-term perspective the pain related to realisations in terms of how demand and volume growth will pan out, still persists though the ramp up has happened in Mahan as well as Aditya and Utkal is working at optimal capacity.""We still believe that the end realisation will still remain soft unless there is huge amount of spike either coming through from demand perspective or realisation improving because of operating leverage. So we are neutral at this point of time but the investors need to hold on for at least two-three years, if one needs to have a positive traction and expect or hope for the commodity cycle to turn for better in the next few quarters," he said.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Khambatta Securities is bullish on Sun Pharma has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 980 in its research report dated February 15, 2016.
title: Buy Sun Pharma;target of Rs 980: Khambatta Securities  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Khambatta Securities's research report on Sun Pharma Sun Pharmaceuticals Ltd. (Sun Pharma) total income remained flat y-o-y but grew marginally at 3.6% q-o-q to Rs 70,821 mn in 3Q FY16, in-line with our expectations for the quarter. EBITDA remained flat y-o-y but increased 12.2% q-o-q to Rs 21,690 mn. EBITDA margin decreased 61 bps y-o-y but increased 235 bps q-o-q to 30.6% during 3Q FY16, exceeding our expectations for the quarter, mainly due to lower than expected Cost of Goods Sold and Employee benefits expense as a percentage of revenues. Net profit increased 259.9% y-o-y and 28.6% q-o-q to Rs 14,229 mn. Net margin increased 1439 bps y-o-y and 391 bps q-o-q to 20.1% in 3Q FY16, exceeding our expectation mainly due to better than expected performance at operating level further enhanced by lower than expected tax expense.Though Sun Pharma continues to face integration issue with Ranbaxy, negatively impacting the company’s profitability, profitability of the company is improving with the help of Taro’s performance and improvement in US business. Research & Development (R&D) expense is expected to remain high due to expense related to development of MK-3222 (Tildrakizumab), an investigational therapeutic antibody candidate, which is currently being evaluated in Phase 3 registration trials for the treatment of chronic plaque psoriasis, a skin ailment. We continue to believe that profitability will be negatively impacted by cost associated not only with integration of Ranbaxy but also remediation efforts at Halol, Mohali, Devas, Poanta Sahib and Toansa facilities. However, Sun Pharma Management has indicated that it expects to approach US FDA for re-inspection of Halol plant during 1Q FY17. Also, the company has successfully launched generic Gleevac on 1 Feb 2016 and expects to garner 30% market share gradually. Management has continued to supply Doxil to other markets from Halol facility without interruption and expects to continue doing so but sales have been impacted by competition. For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: According to the latest weekly update on the processing status of draft offer documents, Sebi has said clarifications were awaited on the IPO of these four companies as on February 19, 2016.
title: Sebi seeks clarification from 4 companies on IPO plans  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Capital markets regulator Sebi has sought clarification from merchant bankers of four companies including Advanced Enzyme Technologies regarding their proposed initial public offerings. KPR Agrochem, S P Apparels and Thyrocare Technologies are the other companies from which Sebi has sought information. Without disclosing the details of clarifications sought, Sebi has said that it is awaiting response from Lead Managers for the proposed public offers. According to the latest weekly update on the processing status of draft offer documents, Sebi has said clarifications were awaited on the IPO of these four companies as on February 19, 2016. The next update would be uploaded on Sebi's website on February 29. Sebi said it might issue observations on draft offer documents within 30 days, after receiving satisfactory reply from the lead merchant bankers regarding the clarification or additional information sought from them. KPR Agrochem, S P Apparels and Thyrocare Technologies had filed draft papers with Sebi in December, while Advanced Enzyme Technologies approached the regulator last month. Most of these companies plans to utilise IPO proceeds for business expansion plans and working capital requirements. The regulator had received last communication from KPR Agrochem and S P Apparels in January. As per the draft papers, Thyrocare Technologies, which runs a diagnostic laboratory chain across the country, plans to come out with a public issue of up to 10,744,708 equity shares. Coimbatore-based S P Apparels intends to garner up to Rs 215 crore through fresh issue of shares, while its existing shareholders will offload 9,00,000 equity shares. KPR Agrochems IPO comprises fresh issue of equity shares worth Rs 180 crore and an offer for sale of up to 50 lakh shares. Advanced Enzyme Technologies IPO consists of fresh issue of shares aggregating up to Rs 60 crore and an offer for sale of up to 44,73,470 scrips by the existing shareholders. Since the beginning of the year, as many as seven firms -- Mahanagar Gas, GVR Infra Projects, Maini Precision Products, Equitas Holding, G N A Axles, Nihilent Techonologies and New New Delhi Center for Sight -- have received Sebis approval to launch their IPOs. $("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Shares of Ashok Leyland fell 3 percent intraday Tuesday on a media report that Japanese partner issued a notice for ending joint venture (JV) signed in 2008.
title: Ashok Leyland drops 3% on notice by Japanese partner to end JV  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Shares of Ashok Leyland fell 3 percent intraday Tuesday on a media report that Japanese partner has issued a notice to end a joint venture (JV) signed in 2008. "Beleaguered joint venture for small trucks between Japanese auto major Nissan and Hinduja group flagship Ashok Leyland hit a nadir with Nissan issuing a termination of licence notice to one of their three JV companies, effectively sounding a death knell to the idea of growing the business together," a report said. The report further said dispute between partners is for a paltry sum of Rs 2.34 crore in royalty, which Nissan says Leyland owes the JV while Leyland alleged that its partner illegally diverted and used plant machinery in violation of government commitments and regulations. The JV companies had availed Export Promotion Capital Goods (EPCG) scheme, an incentive given by the government to facilitate exports, while importing machinery for the production of Evalia/Stile vehicles by specifically mentioning the name of location to which they were to be imported. In 2008, Ashok Leyland joined hands with Nissan Motor Company, Japan, to develop and manufacture light commercial vehicles, under both the Ashok Leyland and Nissan brands, in the 2.5 to 7.5 tonne segment. They signed three separate JVs for vehicle manufacturing, power train manufacturing and technology development. First offering from this JV was 2.5 tonne Dost. At 13:10 hours IST, the scrip of Ashok Leyland was quoting at Rs 90, down Rs 2.20, or 2.39 percent on the BSE.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Inox Wind shares rallied more than 5 percent intraday Monday after commissioning common power evacuation systems at its Lahori site in Madhya Pradesh.
title: Inox Wind up 5%, commissions power evacuation systems in MP unit  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Moneycontrol Bureau Inox Wind shares rallied more than 5 percent intraday Monday after commissioning common power evacuation systems at its Lahori site in Madhya Pradesh. The Noida-based wind energy solutions provider said common power evacuation systems for wind park comprise of a 220 KV sub-station and a 220 KV transmission line and are capable of supporting power evacuation of 200 MW. Inox Wind's Lahori site includes projects for leading independent power producers like Ostro Energy (backed by Actis) and Tata Power Renewable Energy (TPREL). The company presently has more than 600 MW of developed and under development projects in state. At 13:12 hours IST, the scrip of Inox Wind was quoting at Rs 238.95, up Rs 6.75, or 2.91 percent amid high volumes on the BSE.Posted by Sunil Shankar Matkar$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Rahul Shah, Associate VP, Equity Advisory Group at Motilal Oswal recommends buying Canara Bank 170 Put, Infosys and Pidilite Industries.
title: Pick Canara Bank 170 Put, Infosys, Pidilite Industries: Rahul Shah  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Rahul Shah, Associate VP, Equity Advisory Group at Motilal Oswal told CNBC-TV18, "We had decent sell-off in most of the sectors but I think technology looks like that it is bottoming out. We saw that in a lot of stocks fresh longs getting created in last three sessions. So, I feel Infosys is one stock which has created lot of resistance at around Rs 1,100 or so. So, I feel that should add for a near-term China wall. IT as a sector looks promising, so the best pick would be Infosys in that. So, I would buy the stock with a stop loss of Rs 1,100 and target of Rs 1,200."" Pidilite Industries has done quite well in such turmoil, so I think this will continue to do well going forward also. I think fresh longs still remains intact and then the stock which is hitting new high in a bear market rally, I feel it can still outperform in the current level as well. So I would buy Pidilite Futures with a stop loss of Rs 630 and target of Rs 670," he said."I think in PSU banks, the pain remains. I don’t think we have seen some short covering but again I think larger picture still remains bearish. Canara Bank has been seeing some sell-off but I think still technically also and the way the future segment as well some more downside in there. However, I think the way the markets have been showing some sign of pullback, the best strategy is to buy Puts of Canara Bank . So, with 170 Put trading at around Rs 3.50 or so, keep a stop loss of Rs 2 and target of Rs 7, buy 170 Put option of Canara Bank." "If you look at auto indices, it has been showing some momentum and overall BSE Auto if you look at, I think it is showing a positive sign. So, I think two wheelers as well as four wheelers, a lot of stocks like Hero Motocorp and Tata Motors look to be top picks. In that case Tata Motors looks quite attractive. Post results the stock has seen some smart rally also. So, buy 320 Call around Rs 4.5-5 which is trading, keep a stop loss of Rs 3 and target of Rs 10 in that."$("
