description: Watch the interview of Ashu Madan of Religare Securities and Manas Jaiswal of manasjaiswal.com with Surabhi Upadhyay and Nigel D'Souza on CNBC-TV18, in which they shared their readings and outlook on specific stocks and sectors.
title: Your Stocks: What to buy in volatile market  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Watch the interview of Ashu Madan of Religare Securities and Manas Jaiswal of manasjaiswal.com with Surabhi Upadhyay and Nigel D'Souza on CNBC-TV18, in which they shared their readings and outlook on specific stocks and sectors. Manas Jaiswal of manasjaiswal.com MEP Infrastructure Developers MEP Infrastructure Developers is still making lower tops and lower bottoms and few days back the stock fell below 50-day moving average. We have witnessed some recovery from lower levels but the overall trend is still weak. On any bounce back near Rs 45-46, the investor should exit from the long position and should make fresh long only if it closes above Rs 50.Tata Motors If you see long-term charts of Tata Motors , it has lot of support near Rs 280 to Rs 250 and few days back the stock made a low of around Rs 280 and we witnessed a sharp upmove also. If one can hold it for one year, he/she can see the price of around Rs 400-410. I think one can hold it and keep a stoploss below Rs 280.Mphasis Mphasis has corrected almost Rs 125 from the top and now it has lot of support near Rs 400-390 levels, so I think the investors can hold it. One can hold with a stoploss of Rs 390 and it has resistance near Rs 440-475 but if it breaks that then possibly the stock can come up to around Rs 525-550. Ashu Madan of Religare SecuritiesCipla Cipla is certainly a hold. The numbers have not been that great but the stock in the last one year has come out with fluctuating performance – highs and lows and up and down. With all this taking into stride, I would say that the current juncture of the market and what has happened to stock certainly I would suggest that, if somebody holds it for a decent period of time and some body is a long-term investor Cipla is not a stock one should book losses.BHEL Bharat Heavy Electricals (BHEL) has clearly showing de-growth in order book, in results everywhere. So, that is a biggest concern and I don’t think there can be a meaningful rebound in the stock. There could be some rebound because of the market. There are two reasons why the stock are down one is the inflicted pain because of the self performance and secondly overall market, so even if market improves there could be slight bounce back. However, whether it has happens in a short-term because Budget is in the corner, expiry is there and BHEL being frontline stock and if you look at this expiry probably BHEL is the stocks which is probably overbought for this expiry. Everybody who has bought at any level is stuck in, so look for an opportunity to get out of stock.Monte Carlo Fashions After initial de-growth Monte Carlo Fashions looks to be back on track. So, I would suggest that in the current market situation Monte Carlo is a stock, I am not too unduly worried about it at this level. So, I would suggest a hold, may be in next couple of quarters we could see some better performance and probably a better price. So, it is a hold from my side.Mphasis There could be some bounce back but I would advise to exit Mphasis . It is a volatile stock and quarterly numbers have not been too great, the visibility is not that great. I expect the stock to appreciate by another 25 percent BUT at this point in time there could be a possibility of some rebound but that's enough. So the first level of Rs 440 is the best possible target as I can visualise.NCL Industries At this juncture NCL Industries has a potential to go up because it was a swift up movement; in 10 months from Rs 80 to Rs 180, so at the peak lot of people got trapped but at this price it's a hold. If the investor holds it at this juncture, probably in sometime there could be a possible upside and we could see Rs 120-125 levels. I think that is the time one should exit but hoping that it will go beyond Rs 166 in next one year or so, looks remote and I would not say it will be a prudent call to hold for that long.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Shares of state-run Rashtriya Chemicals and Fertilisers (RCF) surged 7.5 percent intraday Monday ahead of likely clearance for its urea plant in Maharashtra.
title: RCF likely to get PIB clearance for urea plant, stock jumps 7.5%  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Shares of state-run Rashtriya Chemicals and Fertilisers (RCF) surged 7.5 percent intraday Monday ahead of likely clearance for its urea plant in Maharashtra. RCF is likely to get clearance from the Public Investment Board (PIB) for establishing a new urea plant at its current manufacturing facility at Thal in Maharashtra with an estimated investment of Rs 5,500 crore. As per the proposal, an ammonia-urea plant will be set up at Thal in Maharashtra with a capacity of 1.27 million tonnes per annum at the company's current manufacturing location. According to the source, tender for the plant's engineering and construction has been awarded to a consortium of Technip and L&T. The total estimated cost of the project is at Rs 5,500 crore. PIB examines the investment plans put forwarded by the individual ministries in lieu of the respective public sector undertakings. After getting the PIB nod a note would be moved for the cabinet approval. The Mumbai-based PSU's annual urea capacity is more than 2 million tonnes and it also produces various grades of complex fertilisers at its two manufacturing units in Thal and Trombay in Maharashtra. At 14:55 hours IST, the scrip of Rashtriya Chemicals and Fertilisers was quoting at Rs 42.80, up Rs 2.55, or 6.34 percent on the BSE.(With inputs from PTI)$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Ashwani Gujral of ashwanigujral.com told CNBC-TV18, "One may buy BEML with a stoploss at Rs 1000 and target of Rs 1065.""One may buy Bharat Electronics (BEL) with a stoploss at Rs 1140 and target of Rs 1175.""One may buy National Buildings Construction Corporation (NBCC) with a stoploss at Rs 885 and target of Rs 935.""One may sell Canara Bank with a stoploss at Rs 172 and target of Rs 160.""One may sell Power Finance Corporation with a stoploss at Rs 154 and target of Rs 142."$("

NBCC is a buy with a stop loss of Rs 875 and target of Rs 910. Gujarat State Fertilizers & Chemicals is a buy with a stop loss of Rs 60 for target of Rs 69."" Bosch is going through a pullback move. It had a large correction. So I don’t think you are going to see great follow through here but possibly a pullback rally could easily take you back towards Rs 18,000 but not much more than that. This week is about Budget sensitives and that is why people should look at it more carefully," he said."Pharmaceutical stocks should be bought regardless of the Budget. So Sun Pharma given that it has been the best performer this year, all declines are getting bought. So this is now a buy with a stop loss around Rs 800 and maybe look for the stock slowly getting back towards Rs 1,000."$("

description: Shares of Godrej Properties climbed 3 percent intraday Monday after a media report indicated that the company is likely to sell commercial assets worth Rs 1,500 crore during the year.
title: Godrej Properties up 3% on 2016 target to sell Rs 1500 cr assets  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Shares of Godrej Properties climbed 3 percent intraday Monday after a media report indicated that the company is likely to sell commercial assets worth Rs 1,500 crore during the year. Buoyed by a big ticket deal at its office complex at BKC in Mumbai, the realty firm is targeting a sales revenue of about Rs 1,500 crore this year through monetisation of its commercial assets in Mumbai, Kolkata and Chandigarh. Godrej Properties in September had sold 4,35,000 square feet of office space at Bandra-Kurla Complex (BKC) in Mumbai for a good valuation of Rs 1,479 crore. "We have commercial assets worth about Rs 1,400-1,500 crore in BKC, Kolkata and Chandigarh. We are targeting to sell these properties this year," Godrej Properties MD and CEO Pirojsha Godrej said. The company has completed the construction of its commercial properties at Kolkata and Chandigarh, while the BKC project would be completed in next 3-4 months, he added. Godrej Properties, the real estate arm of the Godrej group, has about 300,000 sq ft of office space left in the BKC project and about a million sq ft of commercial space in Kolkata and Chandigarh. At 12:46 hours IST, the scrip of Godrej Properties was quoting at Rs 281.15, up Rs 6.20, or 2.25 percent on the BSE.(With inputs from PTI)$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Shares of JSW Steel gained 2 percent intraday Monday after the company re-commissioned blast furnaces at its Viiayanagar and Salem Works plants.
title: JSW Steel re-commissions blast furnaces at 2 plants, stock up 2%  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Moneycontrol Bureau Shares of JSW Steel gained 2 percent intraday Monday after the company re-commissioned blast furnaces at its Viiayanagar and Salem Works plants. The company said these plants were shut down in August and November 2015, respectively, adding re-commissioning work of blast furnace at Dolvi works is in an advanced stage and is expected to be operational shortly. Its plant at Vijayanagar is one of the largest single location steel producing facility in the country with a capacity of 10 million tonne per annum (MTPA). With this, currently it has an installed steel-making capacity of 14.3 MTPA. At 12:36 hours IST, the scrip of JSW Steel was quoting at Rs 1,100.90, up Rs 17.10, or 1.58 percent on the BSE.Posted by Sunil Shankar Matkar$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Parag Thakkar of HDFC Securities is of the view that one can accumulate L&T on dips and feels that Tata Motors looks interesting.
title: Accumulate L&T on dips, Tata Motors looks interesting: Parag Thakkar  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Parag Thakkar of HDFC Securities told CNBC-TV18, "From a longer term perspective, so many stocks might look good at these levels because valuations are very compelling but Larsen and Toubro (L&T) as we all know has its own issue. One is size, on a Rs 80,000 crore topline to grow at 15 percent is very difficult in this kind of scenario. When capex cycle is down globally, you have no capex in oil and gas, even on the India side only roads and power transmission seems to be firing otherwise other segments are down.""They have that asset ownership business, BOT business where something like Hyderabad Metro is there where they have to fund it. There will be a huge leverage taken. So, those kind of issues remain in L&T. All said and done, from a longer term perspective, it is a best proxy play for infrastructure in India. So, definitely at these valuations, one can look to buy on dips very gradually and that is my advice for most of the largecap beaten down stocks," he said. "One interesting thing in this market is that all very large businesses have become very small market cap companies; that is very interesting. Tata Motors with a topline of Rs 2,75,000 crore and EBITDA of Rs 40,000 crore is trading at EV of around Rs 1,30,000 crore. So, those are very interesting opportunities.So, those kind of buying opportunities one should gradually buy because you never know, gradually on every dip one should accumulate."$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Shares of Bharat Petroleum Corporation (BPCL) added 4 percent intraday Wednesday. The company has got environment nod for Rs 337 crore pipeline project in Kerala.
title: BPCL up 4% on environment nod for Rs 337cr pipeline project  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Shares of Bharat Petroleum Corporation (BPCL) added 4 percent intraday Wednesday. The company has got environment nod for Rs 337 crore pipeline project in Kerala."Based on the recommendations of the Expert Appraisal Committee (EAC), the Environment Ministry has given coastal regulation zone (CRZ) clearance to BPCL's project 'laying heat traced pipeline' from south tanker berth to Kochi Refinery in Ernakulam, Kerala," a senior government official said.The CRZ clearance has been given to the project, subject to some conditions, the official said.BPCL, which operates two refineries, one each at Mumbai and Kochi, has pipelines from respective ports to the refineries for transfer of low pour intermediates. The proposed project at Kochi would put in place heat traced pipeline for transfer of high pour intermediates like High and Low Sulphur Vacuum Residues and Vacuum Gas Oil (VGO), thereby adding further value to BPCL.As per the proposal, BPCL will lay heat traced pipeline by replacing redundant crude oil pipeline handle HSVR/LSHS from North Tanker Berth/South Tanker Berth to Kochi Refinery and the pipeline will be laid in the existing corridor.As part of this project, two booster pumps and necessary strengthening/augmentation of South Tanker Berth including replacement of a loading arm are also envisaged.with inputs from PTI$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: SP Tulsian of sptulsian.com has a positive view on Adani Ports with a target of Rs 240-250 in next three months.
title: Positive on Adani Ports, target Rs 240-250 in next 3 months: SP Tulsian  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}SP Tulsian of sptulsian.com told CNBC-TV18, " Gujarat Pipavav Port and Adani Ports have bottomed out. Adani Ports was ruling at around Rs 280-300 and it fell to Rs 180.. So, if you go by their Q3 numbers, I do not think that there has been severe drop in the volumes because people have been very apprehensive, tapering exports of the country, lower coal handling by the port, because they are more specialised in the coal handling and all that. Those fears are not seen from the Q3 numbers.""With a view of about one year, I am positive on the stock, I will not be surprised to see a price of Rs 240-250 in the next three months and in 2016, it can be an outperformer," he said.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Emkay is bullish on Insecticides India Ltd and has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 380 in its research report dated feburary 15, 2016
title: Buy Insecticides India Ltd; target of Rs 380: Emkay  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Emkay's research report on  Insecticides India  Ltd Revenues at Rs 1.5bn (+8% yoy) came in line with estimates. Formulation segment revenues recorded healthy growth of 13% yoy whereas technical segment revenues declined 13% yoy on the back of sluggish demand B2B segment and fall in prices of key chemicals ■ Gross margins improved 230 bps yoy to 34% on account of lower input prices. EBITDA margins saw 240 bps yoy compression due to steep increase of 40% in other expenses ■ Forex loss in the tune of Rs13mn, and higher tax rate at 38% impacted profitability as RPAT declined 64% yoy to Rs 10mn below our estimate of Rs 1.9mn ■ Challenging operating environment in the technical segment remains a concern. Cut FY16/17 estimates to factor in overall weak demand. However, we remain positive on the long term growth prospects of the domestic agrochemical industry. Retain buyInsecticide India posted 8% yoy revenue growth to Rs 1.5bn (in line with estimates) led by healthy growth in the formulation segment (+13% yoy) while technical segment continued to face demand pressure in the B2B segment resulting in drop of 13% yoy in segment revenues.Also, softening in prices of key chemicals further impacted realizations in the technical segment.For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: KRChoksey is bullish on Union Bank Of India and has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 145 in its research report dated Feburary 15, 2016
title: Buy Union Bank Of India; target of Rs 145: KRChoksey  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}KRChoksey's reserch report on Union Bank of India . Marred by higher slippages and significant jump in provisions, net profit for Union Bank managed to put up INR 785 mn which was seen down almost 74% Y-o-Y and 88.1% Q-o-Q. Moreover, tax-write backs to the tune of INR 3320.4 mn proved as savings grace containing further PAT decline. While the asset quality stress for the bank is still not behind, we reckon the CASA mobilization, stable operating profits and capital augmentation plans should form key triggers to boost earnings performance going forward, retain BUY.Valuation & Recommendation: Tax write-backs during the quarter contained the acute earnings decline for Union Bank. Also, higher slippages and dissatisfactory capital adequacy remain an overhang. While the bank engages with balance sheet clean-up exercise, the credit growth appears bleak for the forthcoming quarter too. However, credit quality concerns and capital issues stand largely factored in the price with the bank trading at lower end at 0.7x P/ABV FY17E. Hence, we retain BUY on the stock, but revise our target price downwards to INR 145 (earlier INR 210) incorporating higher slippages and provisions in the light of RBI AQR. Introducing FY18 estimates into our numbers, we value the bank at 0.86x P/ABV FY17E and 0.81x P/ABV FY18E. We continue to remain watchful of shaping up of credit off-take and quality and the strengthening of the capital base to reflect into strong earnings.Highlights Slippages for the quarter stood at INR 34 bn; the AQR slippages stood at INR 19.2 bn, 60% of the accounts stand under AQR. The remainder assets under AQR are performing assets and the Management is confident that they may not have to provide for these in Q4FY16. Restructured slippages stood at INR 13 bn; these include AQR slippages to the tune of INR 9.5 bn. Overseas slippages have stood at INR 4.6 bn. The SDR loans amounted to INR 7.2 bn during hte quarter, the outstanding SDR stands at INR 27.2 bn. The 5/25 loans amounted to INR 11.9 bn spanning across 3 accounts, the 5/25 pipeline comprises of another 4 accounts weighing INR 33 bn and the total outstanding 5/25 loans stand at INR 83.5 bn spread across 14 accounts. A steel account forms part of the 5/25 loans. Outstanding standard restructured assets excluding SEBs as % to Gross Advances stood at 3.0% during the quarter. 61% of the branch network of Union bank is situated in rural and semi-urban markets. The capital adequacy for the bank stood at 10.3% and CET 1 ratio at 7.45%. The RWA to gross advances stood at 75% during hte quarter. The Bank activated 3.44 lakh Dormant accounts during Q3 of FY2015-16. In addition, the Bank added 9.55 lakh CASA accounts during December Quarter. For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.  $("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: KRChoksey is bullish on Nestle India Ltd and has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 6240 in its research report dated Feburary 15, 2016
title: Buy Nestle India Ltd; target of Rs 6240 ; KRChoksey  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}KRChoksey research report on Nestle india Nestle India ltd declared its Q4CY15 & CY15 results Net Sales stood at INR 19594.6Mn which was down by 23% y-o-y and up by 12% q-o-q due to Maggi controversy which had taken place in last 6 months. EBIDTA stood at INR 3694.4 Mn which was down by 34% y-o-y and up by 37% q-o-q and margin stood at18.9% with decrease of 321bps y-o-y and increase of 341bps q-o-q. PAT was at INR 1831.9Mn which was down by 44% y-o-y and up by 47% q-o-q. PAT Margin remained at 9.3% which was down by 361bps y-o-y and up by 222bps q-o-q.Valuations & Views:Nestle growth and margins remained under pressure due to MAGGI Noodles controversary. With management confidences on Maggi episode and to bring back the Maggi on shelf and receive good response from consumers. The stock is currently trading at an EPS of 168.7 its CY17E. We recommend a ‘BUY’ rating on the stock with a target price of INR 6240, giving an upside potential of 23.4%. For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.   $("

description: Emkay is bullish on Moil  and has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 262, in its research report dated Feburary 15, 2016.
title: Buy Moil; target of Rs 262: Emkay  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Emkay's research report MOIL .Sales volume for fines and non- fines fell steeply by 67% and 44% YoY, while on quarterly basis volumes fell by 38% and 34% to 0.13 mt and 1.23 mt respectively Revenue for the quarter declined by 60% YoY and 40% QoQ to Rs 878 mn. On YoY basis, fines and non- fines realizations dropped by 30% and 24%, while they rose slightly on sequential basis by 2% and 7% to Rs 2546/tonne and Rs 7081/tonne respectively, EBITDA stood at Rs 153 mn, down 85% YoY and 22% QoQ. APAT stood at Rs 540 mn, (-50% YoY and +11% QoQ), adjusting for exceptional item on account of write down of value of finished goods inventory worth Rs 409 mn, Margins are likely to remain weak on lower volumes, however, focus on high grade ore , will help it lift its realization from this levels. We have revised our estimates factoring in lower volume and prices. Maintain Buy with a revised target price of Rs 262. ValuationWe understand that the domestic demand has been poor due to weakness in steel industry. Imports so far have been lower than last year, however fall in demand has been steeper. The company has been focusing more on the product mix to resist fall in realizations. In Q3FY16, it has been successful also to some extent in this regard. We believe, it will be clearer going forward. Nevertheless, considering recent sharp fall in manganese ore prices and weak volume, we have revised our estimates. Our current FY16, FY17 and FY18 Mn ore sales volume estimates stand at 0.76 mt, 0.97 mt and 1.06 mt respectively. We have also revised down our price assumptions further to Rs 6700/ tonne and Rs 7000/ tn for FY17 and FY18 respectively. For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Mayuresh Joshi of Angel Broking likes TVS Motor and Britannia Industries.
title: Like TVS Motor, Britannia: Mayuresh Joshi  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Mayuresh Joshi of Angel Broking told CNBC-TV18, "The entire sector when you talk about the durable or non-durable part was expensive after the recent contraction that we have seen. We are probably looking at some amount of value buys probably emerging from this space itself. Specifically, on the two-wheelers side our own take is that if the monsoon are expected to be good and this is what we are reading from reports, you might probably see the rural discretionary player specifically the players like Hero Motocorp and TVS Motor probably benefit in terms of a good monsoon." "What we like within this space is TVS Motor. The management commentary there of regaining markets share or getting market share close to 16 percent mark of getting EBITDA margins close to their double digit figure 10 percent are very encouraging signs and they are getting supported by the new launches," he said. "When you are talking about the other stuff in consumer discretionary space, what we probably like at this juncture are stocks like Britannia Industries if they correct further from the current level. You are probably looking at stocks like Blue Star. The numbers were exceptionally good on all three of their business segments whether that be room air conditioning segment or their engineering product segment or even on their industrial segments." "Clearly, I think the numbers were far better than we probably expected. When you are talking about the two-wheeler space, TVS Motor is something that we probably prefer from a two year time horizon."$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Rajat Bose of rajatkbose.com is of the view that Asian Paints may test Rs 866 while HDFC Bank may hit Rs 1010.
title: Asian Paints may test Rs 866, HDFC Bank Rs 1010: Rajat Bose  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Rajat Bose of rajatkbose.com told CNBC-TV18, " Asian Paints  is very close to its 200 exponential moving average and each time the stock states that it is bouncing back. I am betting on that kind of a bounce back, so I will put a stop loss below Rs 829 and the targets would be Rs 866. Asian Paints generally gives a rally, so today it should not be an exception." "For HDFC Bank , Rs 960 happens to be a very critical support and that level is unlikely to breached, so I will put a stop loss there. I am taking a contra call on HDFC Bank. I understand the sentiment around banking stocks are pretty bad. However, HDFC Bank from these levels can give a bounce back and that bounce back could take it up to say Rs 1,010. So that is the target for the day," he said."In  Punjab National Bank (PNB) Rs 67 is the target and once Rs 67 is taken out then probably Rs 63-62 could be there on the downside. As of now Rs 67 is a strong support. So I expect that it will hold. PNB looks pretty bad in the sense that it is a trending down stock." "The other sell call that I have is on BHEL . The stock has actually given a new low today which is below Rs 101 and because of that I think you can put a stop loss above Rs 104 and trade for a target of about Rs 95-92.""BHEL looks pretty bad, in fact market is looking so bad that weak stocks like BHEL may actually go down. A surprising bounce in Aurobindo Pharma is pretty disconcerting. Is it just a short covering or something more."$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Mayuresh Joshi of Angel Broking is of the view that one can buy Dr Reddy's Laboratories on dips for long term.
title: Buy Dr Reddy's Laboratories on dips for long term: Mayuresh Joshi  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Mayuresh Joshi of Angel Broking told CNBC-TV18, "Within the pharmaceutical space, I think Dr Reddy's Laboratories after the sharp contraction that we have probably witnessed over the last few weeks related to FDA concerns, numbers a little bit below the estimates. Secondly expectations of numbers being soft can well continue. In Q4, the stock can very well correct 6 to 7 percent from the current level.""Our own take is it had got a very strong ANDA pipeline. The combination of Para IV, finished dosage forms (FDFs) and domestic formulations business including UCB acquisition has done exceedingly well. The calibrated sales in Venezuela and rest of the world pharmaceuticals services and active ingredients (PSAI) and AD growth that we are probably seeing is getting compensated by India which has grown 34 percent with US which has grown 18 percent and valuations are become attractive," he said. "So, our own take is that Dr Reddy's can actually have a 17-18 percent earnings growth over the next couple of years. So, any decline on to that stock also becomes a very good buying opportunity for long term investors."$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Axis Securities is bullish on SBI has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 190 in its research report dated February 12, 2016.
title: Buy SBI;target of Rs 190: Axis Securities  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Axis Securities's research report on SBI State Bank of India (SBIN) reported a lackluster quarter marked by decline in margin (8 bps QoQ to 2.9%) and sharp deterioration in asset quality, primarily due to RBIs assessment. As a consequence, SBIN reported a much lower PAT of Rs 11.2 bn (down 62% YoY). Headline asset quality deteriorated with GNPLs up 28% QoQ and ratio up 95 bps QoQ at 5.1%. Slippages were much higher at Rs 207 bn (6.7% vs. 1.9% in Q2FY16), of which ~70% stemmed from asset quality review. Management guided that asset quality pain will continue in the next quarter as well. Advances growth was healthy at 13% YoY, driven by corporate and retail book. We expect 11% loan CAGR over FY15-18.We cut our earnings estimate by 35%/16% for FY16/17 to factorincurrent weak performance. Given near term asset quality pain, we also reduce our target multiple on standalone book to 1x from 1.1x earlier. Consequently, our SOTP-based TP gets revised to Rs 190 (23% upside) from Rs 235 earlier. At CMP of Rs 154, SBIN trades at 0.7x FY17E ABV (adjusting for cost of investments). Maintain BUY. content:

On annualised basis, they have December ending, so for the CY'15 on consolidated basis, EPS is at Rs 105 against Rs 56 of CY'14," he said. "We are seeing many such companies in the midcap and smallcap where we have the potential or the earnings have come so decent as the case here that it has 45 percent growth in the margins. I won’t be surprised to see the share moving to Rs 2,400-2,500 maybe in next three to four months," he added."If you want to take a fundamental call on  Wockhardt , you need to have a horizon of 6-12 months where I am very positive on the stock."$("

description: ICICIDirect is bullish on Wonderla has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 460 in its research report dated February 15, 2016.
title: Buy Wonderla;target of Rs 460: ICICIDirect  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}ICICIDirect's research report on Wonderla Wonderla’s revenues increased 6.5% YoY to | 50.4 core led by 20.6% YoY in realisation while footfalls declined 11.7% YoY. Poor weather conditions adversely impacted the performance of the company, leading to lower-than-expected revenues and margins The Bengaluru amusement park revenues increased 7.3% YoY to | 26.8 crore. Kochi amusement park revenues increased 8.3% YoY to | 22.2 crore. Resort revenues increased 4.2% YoY during the quarter On the margin front, the EBITDA margin declined 802 bps YoY to 36.1% (below I-direct estimate of 45.2%) due to an increase in employee expenses (up 25.7% YoY led by top level hires and new employees for Hyderabad park) and other expenses (up 50.0% YoY on account of | 4.85 crore provision for service tax) As a result, net profit in the quarter declined 4.0% YoY to | 12.3 crore A high entry barrier due to huge capital investment and limited number of large amusement parks in India coupled with favourable demographics and rising discretionary spend augur well for WHL. WHL has consistently maintained an EBITDA margin of 44.0% (highest among Indian and global peers). Further, we believe that a healthy balance sheet (0.03x D/E vs. 1.46x for Adlabs), strong cash flow generation and revenue & EBITDA CAGR of 26.8% and 27.0%, respectively, in FY15-18E demand premium valuations. Given the recent correction in the stock, valuations have become attractive. We have arrived at a DCF based target price of | 460. content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Axis Securities's research report on IGL IGL’s PAT at Rs1,051mn was in line withour/Street estimate. Volume grew at 4.3% YoY due to recovery in CNG volumes (~75% of total volumes; up 4.1% YoY). Gross margin at Rs 9.8/scm was highest-ever, but EBITDA margin was flat QoQ at Rs 5.1/scm due to high opex. We maintain BUY and value IGL at Rs 580 (10% upside), which can improve materially if IGL gets grant of authorization for new cities (Gurgaon, Faridabad). description: Axis Securities is bullish on Tata Motors has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 442 in its research report dated February 12, 2016.
title: Buy Tata Motors;target of Rs 442: Axis Securities  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Axis Securities's research report on Tata Motors Tata Motors' (TTMT) consolidated EBITDA was broadly inline with our/consensus est. with JLR EBITDA margin at 14.4% beating our est. of 14.1% (Street was 14.5%) and standalone margin at 4.6% missing our est of 5%. Our EBITDA estimates are unchanged, but higher than expected depreciation and interest has resulted in an FY17 PAT cut of ~10%. description: Axis Securities has recommended hold rating on Oracle Fin Serv with a target price of Rs 3400 in its research report dated February 12, 2016.
title: Hold Oracle Fin Serv; target of Rs 3400: Axis Securities  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Axis Securities's research report on Oracle Fin Serv OFSS delivered in-line license fees at USD 23 mn (Q3FY15:16mn) but higher bonus provisions, lower revenue bookings in services business and elevated attrition impacted EBITDA. Segmental margin both in Product/Services segment were down QoQ. Forex loss and higher tax rate (~35%) led to PAT being lower than our estimate.Q3 witnessed deal wins across Asia, Africa, Europe and the U.S. leading to revenue visibility. While deal pipeline remains healthy with strong momentum in digital and compliance related spends, emerging concerns in BFSI vertical can impact growth. Margin may be impacted due to higher attrition rate (>20% for 8 quarters).Our license fee assumptions for FY16/17 largely remain intact at USD 93/ USD 117mn. However, continued weakness in services business, lower margin in product business in Q3, elevated attrition and higher tax assumptions lead us to reduce our FY17 earnings by ~11%. Tax rates to increase by ~200 bps due to operations in high tax countries. We revise our TP to Rs 3,400 (earlier: Rs3,804). Maintain HOLD given 3% upside from CMP ofRs3,309. The stock trades at 17x /15x FY17E/FY18E EPS of Rs 200/Rs 224. description: Bank of India's stock plunged 6.53 percent to Rs 80.10 after the ratings agency revised the outlook on the firm to negative from stable as it sees the asset quality of the state-run lender weakening over 12-18 months, straining its profitability.
title: PSU banks continue to tumble; IOB, Bank of India hardest hit  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Shares of public sector banks, led by IOB , tumbled by up to 9 percent today after S&P said capital requirements of PSU lenders for provisioning of bad loans are likely to shoot up, exposing them to possible downgrades. Indian Overseas Bank tanked 9.24 percent to Rs 21.60 on BSE after S&P put the lender on 'CreditWatch' with negative implications. Bank of India 's stock plunged 6.53 percent to Rs 80.10 after the ratings agency revised the outlook on the firm to negative from stable as it sees the asset quality of the state-run lender weakening over 12-18 months, straining its profitability. Syndicate Bank nosedived 4.35 percent, Punjab National Bank fell 4.27 percent, IDBI Bank shed 3.63 percent and SBI tanked 3.19 percent. Capital requirements of PSU banks for provisioning of bad loans are likely to shoot up exposing them to possible downgrades, S&P said yesterday as it trimmed outlook on Bank of India to 'negative' from 'stable'. It also put Indian Overseas Bank on 'CreditWatch' with negative implications. Standard & Poor's Ratings Services said the PSU lenders are in a weaker position on the capitalisation front than their private sector peers and may find it difficult to raise capital given their weak performance. "Any sharp deterioration in asset quality could further weaken banks' credit profiles," S&P said in a report. As regards IOB, it said a 'CreditWatch' with negative implication stems from S&P's expectation that mounting losses would strain the state-run lender's capital base. The US-based agency has retained 'negative' outlook on the ratings of Syndicate Bank. Hit hard by mounting bad loans, many leading state-owned banks reported their highest ever quarterly losses totalling over Rs 12,000 crore, while banking majors like SBI and PNB witnessed sharp erosion in profits.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Emkay is bullish on Dish TV has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 100 in its research report dated February 3, 2016.
title: Buy Dish TV ; target of Rs 100: Emkay  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Emkay's research report on Dish TV Consolidated revenue was at Rs7.7bn (+2.5% qoq), EBITDA stood at Rs2.7bn (+4.1% qoq) with EBITDA margin at 34.4% (+52bps qoq). Net profit was at Rs685mn vs Rs870mn in Q2FY16, impacted by higher depreciation and lower other income Weak KPI’s: ARPU was at Rs172 vs Rs171 in Q2FY16, lower than expected. Net adds at 0.32mn vs 0.34mn in Q2FY16 was a disappointment. Lower subscriber addition led to healthy FCF of Rs1296mn vs Rs849mn in Q2FY16. Debt pre-payment of Rs3bn came as a lone positive. Management target further debt reduction of Rs1.5bn in 4Q Management expects subscriber addition to jump in Q4FY16. ARPU to remain suppressed due to Zing and recent launch of Rs99/p.m. package. We estimate ARPU of Rs176 (+2.2%) for FY17E, ARPU growth may get restricted if service tax increases further Weak subscriber addition compared to competitors and suppressed ARPU was key negative. Cut target multiple to 10x EV/EBITDA (last 3 year average) with revised PT of Rs100. Sharp stock price correction limits downside, however, consistent improvement in KPI’s to drive re-rating Dish TV disappointed with substantially lower net adds and weaker than expected ARPU, however, debt pre-payment of Rs3bn was positive. Subscriber addition to rebound while ARPU to remain suppressed due to launch of low end package. Healthy FCF and further deleveraging is the key for stock re-rating. Key risks to our call: 1) license fee ruling against DTH operators, 2) significant down trading within the packages due to aggressive price increase, 3) rise in competitive intensity, and 4) INR depreciation. We have not factored impact of lower license fee based on TRAI recommendations in our estimates as it is yet to be approved by government. description: The Rs 451-crore IPO received bids for 10,93,20,930 shares against the total issue size of 1,01,37,557 shares, data available with the NSE till 1900 hrs showed.
title: Quick Heal IPO oversubscribed almost 11 times  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}The initial public offer (IPO) of software provider Quick Heal Technologies was oversubscribed 10.78 times on the last day of the offer. The Rs 451-crore IPO received bids for 10,93,20,930 shares against the total issue size of 1,01,37,557 shares, data available with the NSE till 1900 hrs showed. The portion set aside for qualified institutional buyers (QIBs) has been subscribed 4.34 times, while retail investors saw 3.8 times subscription, sources said. Meanwhile, non institutional investors category was subscribed a whopping 36.7 times. Quick Heal has already raised Rs 133.9 crore through issue of shares to 10 anchor investors. The company has fixed the price band at Rs 311-321 for its IPO. The IPO, which would close today, consists of fresh issue of Rs 250 crore and an offer for sale of about 62.70 lakh equity shares by promoters Kailash Sahebrao Katkar and Sanjay Sahebrao Katkar, as well as Sequoia Capital India Investment Holdings III. ICICI Securities, Jefferies India and JPMorgan India are the book running lead managers while Link Intime India is the registrar to the public issue. Quick Heal is the third company this year to have come out with an IPO after TeamLease Services and Precision Camshafts Limited. While the proceeds from the offer of sale would not go to Quick Heal Technologies, the Rs 250-crore funds raised from fresh issue of equity shares would be used by the company for advertising and sales promotion and capital expenditure for research and development. The proceeds would also be invested to purchase, develop and renovate its office premises in Kolkata, Pune and New Delhi, as well as general corporate needs. The company is a provider of security software products and solutions in India. Quick Heal's equity shares are proposed to be listed on BSE and NSE. $("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Edelweiss has recommended hold rating on Power Finance with a target price of Rs 240 in its research report dated February 09, 2016.
title: Hold Power Finance; target of Rs 240: Edelweiss  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Edelweiss's research report on Power Finance Power Finance Corporation’s (PFC) Q3FY16 PAT of INR15.8bn (up 2.5% YoY) came in lower than our estimates. The divergence was due to Essar Mahan (INR16bn) and Jas Infra (INR2bn) slipping into NPA and upfronting of standard asset provisioning on restructured assets (to 4.25% from 3.5% at INR2.5bn against requirement to meet it by FY17). Corollary of higher interest income reversal was the 30bps QoQ decline in NIMs, leading to muted revenue momentum (NII down by >2% QoQ). However, controlled opex (down >50% YoY) supported profitability. Disbursements gained traction (up 8% YoY at INR108bn) feeding into 12.5% YoY loan growth. Implementation of project UDAY (wherein the state government will take over debt of SEBs) means lower yields for PFC putting current NIMs under risk. We expect some pressure on growth as well with limited avenues for working capital funding going forward, and slower than expected investment cycle in power sector. Despite favourable valuations at 0.5x FY18E P/ABV, near-to-medium term challenges and riskier impaired loans seem to fairly price the stock. We maintain ‘HOLD’.Though implementation of UDAY potentially augurs well for the entire power value chain, it poses risks to PFC’s near to medium term earnings. We pay heed to undemanding valuations, but uncertainty could challenge PFC’s high returns profile, and risks surrounding its impaired loans (especially on private exposure) seem to fairly price the stock. We maintain ’HOLD/SU’ with TP of INR240. description: Karvy is bullish on Amrutanjan Health Care has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 504 in its research report dated February 05, 2016.
title: Buy Amrutanjan Health Care; target of Rs 504: Karvy  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Karvy's research report on Amrutanjan Health Care At the beginning of a slack in its flagship product-yellow balm, Amrutanjan has introduced new formats to replace the same, roll on for convenience in body and head ache and strong neutral coloured balm for headache. The awareness and a rush of larger players in the body ache, aid Amrutanjan in rapid expansion of the segment. Amrutanjan has started on a trajectory of being valued at higher multiples from early CY14 and is now stabilizing at a PE of 32.8x closer to its +1 standard deviation of its average last four years PE of 23x. We expect an EPS CAGR growth of 31% in FY15-17E. We are valuing Amrutanjan at an average PE of last two years which is when the upward trajectory began for Amrutanjan PE multiple. We are valuing it at a PE of 28.4x its FY17E EPS of Rs.17.7 for a target price of Rs.504, an upside of 25% from current market price. We are initiating coverage of Amrutanjan with a “BUY” recommendation. description: Karvy is bullish on has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 3100 in its research report dated February 04, 2016.
title: Buy Hawkins Cooker; target of Rs 3100: Karvy  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Karvy's research report on Hawkins Cooker Hawkins Cookers Ltd. has recorded top line growth 10.1% CAGR from FY13 to FY15. In FY15, top line grew by 12.6% against 7.6% in FY14. The key growth drivers of Hawkins Cookers is its continuous innovation of new products every year and strong branding through constant advertising of their products. The R&D expenditure for innovation has recorded CAGR of 68.5% from FY13 to FY15. On the other hand, advertising expenses have recorded CAGR of 32% from FY13 to FY15. The above two factors have enabled Hawkins to grow the volume sales by 6.6% in Pressure Cooker and 9.5% in Cookware in FY15. The top line of Hawkins is expected to grow at CAGR of 8.5% from FY15 to FY17E. At CMP of Rs.2666, the stock is trading at P/E of 32.7x for FY17E. With the anticipated increase in top line due to strong brand positioning, innovation and new product launches, which were favourably received by the market, with strong balance sheet & financial ratios, we expect that the consumer expenditure will further increase as the economy revives and hence there will be growth in Hawkins Cookers Ltd. top line and bottom line as well. Based on P/E of 38.0x, we initiate the coverage with a “BUY” rating for a Target Price of Rs.3100 representing an upside of 16%. description: Emkay is bullish on DCM Shriram and has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 131 in its research report dated February 3, 2016.
title: Buy DCM Shriram; target of Rs 131: Emkay  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Emkay's research report on DCM Shriram Consolidated revenues at Rs 12.5bn (+6% yoy) came below our est of Rs 12.9bn on the back of lower than est sales in sugar business EBIT margin improved 210bps yoy to 5.3% however were lower than est 7.9% due to lower than est margins in agri business While weakness sugar business led to EBIT loss of Rs 19mn, higher realizations in chloralkali led to 780bps EBIT margin expansion in chemical business. PBT stood at Rs624mn registering a growth of 119% yoy Improvement in sugar realizations and increased sales in agri business if monsoon is normal remain key trigger for the stock. EPS estimate increased by 8% to factor in lower tax rate for FY16. Maintain Buy reco For FY16, we reduce our tax rate assumption to 16% from 22% earlier resulting in 8% increase in our EPS estimate to Rs 17 for FY16 while we leave FY17 estimates unchanged. We continues to maintain Buy reco on the stock with retain our target price of Rs 168 (8x FY17E EPS) For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. description: Motilal Oswal is bullish on Suprajit Eng has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 705 in its research report dated Februrary 10, 2016.
title: Buy Aarti Drugs; target of Rs 705: Motilal Oswal  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Motilal Oswal's research report on Aarti Drugs Revenues at INR 265cr, +2% YoY were 3% lower than our estimate of INR 273cr. Although the company increased its capacity specifically in metformin, during the current quarter, it did not have any impact on revenue as most of it is exported to nations in Africa and Middle East which have witnessed a demand slowdown due to decline in crude oil prices. Thus exports for the company witnessed a double digit decline. Slowdown is particularly observed in case of governments of many of these nations who are curbing imports and depleting their inventories. However domestic revenues which form 60% of the overall topline, recorded double digit growth. EBITDA at INR 43.1cr is lower by 1% YoY and is 6% below our estimate of INR 45.8cr. EBITDA margins at 16.3% were 60bp lower YoY. PAT at INR 17.0cr declined 23% YoY which is 10% below our estimate of INR 18.9cr. Higher tax rate of 25% in the current quarter against 16% in 3QFY15 impacted PAT growth. PBT growth stood at -13%. The company is likely to witness gradual improvement in topline growth from 4QFY16 onwards when it starts the sale of high value products initially in the anti-diarrheal and anti-diabetic segment viz. metformin and later in anti-biotics. We believe FY17E topline growth will recover to 15% which should translate into 22% growth in profits on the back of higher operating leverage. Aarti Drugs is a high quality proxy play on the pharma industry. The company is climbing higher in the API value chain by selectively expanding into those APIs which are being currently imported and are of higher value. Based on the below expected performance in 3QFY16, we reduce our earnings estimates for the company by 11%/ 17% for FY16/17E. Despite this we expect the company to grow its profits at 20% CAGR over FY16-18E. We value Aarti Drugs at 18x Sep 2017E EPS which is a 20% discount to the mean multiple commanded by formulation companies and maintain our BUY rating on the stock with a target price of INR 705/share (earlier INR 800) For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.$("

content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}On CNBC-TV18's show Super Six, market gurus Simi Bhaumik, Gaurav Bissa and Ashish Kyal place their bets on two stocks each, thus offering investors a variety of options to choose from. Investors can read into the detailed analysis before agreeing to any or all the bets.Simi Bhaumik of simibhaumik.comI would recommend GAIL India to go long today. Expecting a recovery in the stock, maintain a stoploss below Rs 335, targets on the upside would be Rs 355 and Rs 362. Asking all to go short in LIC Housing Finance with a stoploss above Rs 436 as the stock has staged a major breakdown on daily charts. As long as it holds below Rs 432, use any minor rally in the stock to go short. Maintain a stoploss above Rs 436, targets on the downside would be Rs 416 to Rs 410.Gaurav Bissa of LKP SecuritiesMy first recommendation today is a buy on Idea Cellular . The stock has seen good amount of correction, significant shorts were seen getting built. Some amount of short covering has already started. If we see some fresh longs then I feel good amount of upside from the current levels can be seen. I would recommend going long, one can have a target of Rs 110 in mind. One can keep a stoploss at Rs 98. My second recommendation today is a sell on YES Bank . The stock has seen good amount of upside already but it has been unable to sustain higher levels. Long unwinding is seen, I would recommend going short. One can have a stoploss at Rs 765 and play for targets of Rs 700.Ashish Kyal of wavesstrategy.com Just Dial after briefly consolidating around Rs 550, gave a negative breakout in previous session. The momentum has been strong and there has not been any kind of relief rally even now. So, one can short Just Dial with a stoploss of Rs 550 and the target can be expected at Rs 430 on downside. description: Prabhudas Lilladher is bullish on Cummins has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 1030 in its research report dated February 3, 2016.
title: Buy Cummins; target of Rs 1030: Prabhudas Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Cummins Cummins (KKC) reported PAT of Rs1.78bn in Q3FY16j below our estimate due to weak exports revenue and one‐time provision for inventory write‐down. KKC commented that the economy is showing signs of revival mainly in segments like Infrastructure, Mining, Railways, Defence etc driven by government spending. Outlook on exports remains weak; however, KKC expects to gain market share in export for LHP products which should support growth. The company expects the domestic business to grow 10‐15% and exports to grow by 0‐5% for FY16 and expects similar trends for FY17. We remain positive on KKC’s potential in the domestic market, driven by structural factors like revival in Infrastructure/Industrial demand, unreliable quality of power in India and lack of credible options for power back‐up and medium‐to‐long term potential of exports. Low capacity utilization of 65% also leaves an upside surprise on margin once volumes improve The stock is trading at 27.5x FY17E earnings. We have cut our earnings by ~10% for FY17& FY18 to factor in weak export outlook and increased tax rate. We remain positive on KKC’s medium/long term potential in the domestic market, driven by structural factors like revival in Infrastructure/Industrial demand, unreliable quality of power in India, lack of creditable options for power back‐up and strong export potential. Low capacity utilization of ~65% also leaves upside surprise on margins once volumes improve. Maintain “BUY” For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.$("

description: Shares of Britannia Industries gained more than 3 percent intraday Wednesday on the back of robust numbers declared by the company in September-December quarter (Q3).
title: Britannia up 3% post good Q3 numbers; to demerge arm into co  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Moneycontrol BureauShares of Britannia Industries gained more than 3 percent intraday Wednesday on the back of robust numbers declared by the company in September-December quarter (Q3).The company's consolidated net profits increased by 51.2 percent at Rs 207.6 crore against Rs 137.3 crore, in the same quarter last fiscal.Its EBITDA was up 46.6 percent at Rs 322 crore and EBITDA margin was up at 14.4 percent versus 10.8 percent.The company has approved the demerger of manufacturing business division and retail sales business division of Daily Bread Gourmet Foods, a wholly-owned subsidiary of company, into the company.The turnover of the demerged entity stood at Rs 5,69,76,580, which is 0.08 percent of the total turnover of Britannia.According to SP Tulsian of sptulsian.com, generally, the problem in this volatile market is that expensive stocks have been seeing some profit booking and corrections. But, I think that once this volatility stops, otherwise also, I am expecting a positive behaviour on Britannia.""If you see, maybe for last one week or so, it has not seen that kind of correction. So, maybe this result will see the renewed buying coming back into the stock, but results are good and I have a positive view going ahead," he said.At 09:51 hrs Britannia Industries was quoting at Rs 2,828.10, up Rs 50.25, or 1.81 percent on the BSE.Posted by Rakesh Patil$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Motilal Oswal is bullish on Ramco Cements has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 450 in its research report dated Februrary 9, 2016.
title: Buy Ramco Cements; target of Rs 450: Motilal Oswal  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Motilal Oswal's research report on Ramco Cements Ramco Cement’s (TRCL) 3QFY16’s volume de-growth reduced from double digit level of previous 5 quarters to 5.4%YoY (-5% QoQ) to 1.63mt led by broader stabilization in south market and base effect. Realizations were resilient at 0.5% QoQ. With marginal contribution from wind power business, revenue stood at INR8.1b (3.3%YoY, -7% QoQ).TRCL offers strong play on southern recovery due to (a) superior brand, (b) edge over cost efficiencies, and (c) visibility of deleveraging (stared in FY16). Our assumption of 6% volume and 4% price CAGR to drive 15%/22% EBITDA/PAT CAGR for TRCL in FY16-18. We upgrade FY16- 18 EBITDA by 6-12% to factor in better price, volume and cost. The stock trades at 9.3x/7.2x FY17E/18E EV/EBITDA, and EV/ton of USD97. We maintain Buy with a TP of INR450, an upside of 20% (valuing cement business at 8.5x FY18E EBITDA, EV/ton of USD105). description: KRChoksey is bullish on PNB has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 100 in its research report dated Februrary 9, 2016.
title: Buy PNB; target of Rs 100: KRChoksey  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}KRChoksey's research report on PNB Reporting PBT Loss with doubling of provisions on the back of worsening asset quality, Punjab National Bank (PNB) reported dismal performance for Q3FY16. Moreover, had it not been for the tax write-backs of INR 9087 mn, the bank would have posted loss on the bottom-line level. Thus, the bank managed to put out PAT at 510 mn that de-grew 93% Y-o-Y; way below our expectations. While the bank continues to engage in balance sheet clean-up exercise exerting pressures on earnings, arduous times are here to stay even as we foray into next fiscal.Thanks to the accelerated provisions, PNB reported loss at the PBT level for Q3. With balance sheet clean-up exercise in offing, the credit off take and margins remained sedate. RBI directive led to almost 50% recognition of stressed assets for the bank. Going forward, as the asset quality review process remains underway, the bank is expected to maintain elevated asset quality pressures reporting higher NPAs and higher slippages. Besides, levered corporate exposures and meaningful restructured pipe-line only indicates pain is here to stay for the bank. Given the asset quality baggage and the subsequent earnings pressures, the return ratios for the bank are anticipated to be at dismal levels. While the stock is already trading at the lowest band of historical multiples, the further downside is limited; however, the upside is capped too. Therefore, we maintain ACCUMULATE rating on the stock, and incorporate higher NPLs into our estimates, trimming our earnings estimates over FY16-18E. We revise our target price downwards to INR 101 (earlier INR 154), valuing the bank at 0.9x P/ABV FY17 and FY18E. At CMP, the stock trades at 0.8x P/ABV FY17E. For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Motilal Oswal's research report on Suprajit Eng Suprajit's 3Q is not comparable as Phoenix has been consolidated this quarter while we do not have comparable numbers from the prior period. Standalone revenues have risen 13%, EBITDA is up 24% while profits are up 27%. Consolidated results have recieved a boost from Phoenix acquisition with 60% revenue growth and 88% profit growth. description: KRChoksey is bullish on Guj State Petro has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 151 in its research report dated Februrary 9, 2016.
title: Buy Guj State Petro; target of Rs 151: KRChoksey  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}KRChoksey's research report on Guj State Petro Gujarat State Petronet Ltd. reported revenue of INR. 2481 mn down 1.9% QoQ and up 2.0% Y-o-Y due to lower transmission volume. EBITDA was also down 6.7% QoQ at INR 2092 mn due to higher operation and maintenance expenses. Profit stood at INR. 1235 mn (boosted by higher other income) up 13.8% on QoQ and 39.1% on Y-o-Y basis. Transmission volumes stood at 23.1 mmscmd which was down 5.1% QoQ and up 0.7% YoY. Implied tariff was higher 0.9% on a QoQ and down 6.2% on a YoY basis to INR 1,080/mscm.We remain positive on the stock considering the following trigger points. 1- ONGC to enhance domestic production by 10‐15mmscmd over 1‐3 years. 2- CBM production is poised to grow by 6‐8mmscmd over 2‐3 years. 3- Commissioning of Mundra terminal by FY18. We model transmission tariff at INR 1215, 1230 and 1267 mscm and volumes at 25.8, 27.5 and 29.3 mmscmd for FY16/17/18. We assign ‘ACCUMULATE’ rating on the stock with the target price of INR 151/share based on the mix of EV/EBITDA, P/E and DCF methodology. Currently Stock trades at 14.3x FY17E EPS of INR 9.5. description: Motilal Oswal is bullish on PTC India has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 80 in its research report dated Februrary 9, 2016.
title: Buy PTC India; target of Rs 80: Motilal Oswal  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Motilal Oswal's research report on PTC India During 3QFY16, PTC India reported revenues stood at INR29.4b (up 4% YoY), vs estimate INR36.4b. Lower than estimate revenue was owing to lower realisation while volumes were 3% ahead of estimate. Reported EBIDTA stood at INR545m (up 19% YoY), though post inclusion of rebate and surcharge income of INR126m. Thus, adjusted for the same, EBIDTA stood at INR419m, below estimate of INR446m. This was led by higher operating expenditure rather than lower trading margin. Reported PAT stood at INR453m, tad higher than estimate of INR424m owing to rebate/surcharge and marginally lower tax rate. We expect PTC to report consolidated net profit of INR3.4b in FY16E (up 8% YoY) and INR3.7b in FY17E (up 10% YoY). PTC trades at 5.2x PER and 0.7x P/B on FY17E basis. Our SOTP based TP is INR80/sh, valuing trading income at 8x FY18E, PTC Financial services at market valuation less 25% HOLDCO discount and other investment at book value. Buy. description: Prabhudas Lilladher is bullish on Maruti Suzuki has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 4844 in its research report dated January 28, 2016.
title: Buy Maruti Suzuki; target of Rs 4844: Prabhudas Lilladher  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Maruti Suzuki Maruti Suzuki’s (MSIL’s) performance in Q3FY16 was weak due to lower‐thanexpected EBITDA margins, coupled with lower non‐operating income and higherthan‐ expected depreciation provision. While MSIL’s sales growth at 19.9% YoY to Rs150.8bn was on expected lines, EBITDA margin at 14.4% was impacted by a combination of provision for bonus with retrospective effect from April 2014, higher sales promotion and marketing expenses, adverse fixed cost incidence due to decretion of inventory and higher maintenance cost for the Gurgaon plant. Resultantly, EBITDA was Rs21.7bn, which was lower than expectation of Rs23.8bn, while reported profit was Rs10.2bn, which though higher 27.1% YoY, was lower than expected. We lower our EPS estimate by 8.5% for FY16e and 7.1% for FY17e to factor in the tepid Q3FY16 performance. We expect revenue CAGR of 18% over FY15‐18e, with an adjusted profit CAGR of 28.8% and EBITDA margin expansion of 280bps to 15.8%. The stock is currently trading at 18.6x FY17e EPS. Our revised target price is Rs4,844 based upon 22xFY17e (previously Rs4,977). At our price target, MSIL would trade at a cash PE 15x FY17e (currently trades at 12.7x). We maintain ‘BUY’. For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. description: Ratnesh Kumar, Market Expert is of the view that one may avoid aviation space.
title: Avoid aviation space, says Ratnesh Kumar  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Ratnesh Kumar, Market Expert told CNBC-TV18, "Aviation is so hyper competitive, it is so capital intensive, historically I found it very tough to take fundamentally long term calls on the aviation sector. I am sure there are good airlines around the world which from time to time make money for investors. However, on a generic basis it is a tough sector to make a fundamental call and there are more structural growth story kind of sectors both in terms of business growth and even in terms of profitability and margins. So, I would avoid that segment."On Friday, Jet Airways ended at Rs 570.85, up Rs 41.40, or 7.82 percent on the BSE.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Jai Bala of Cashthechaos.com feels that Maruti Suzuki may slip to Rs 3300-3400.
title: Maruti Suzuki may slip to Rs 3300-3400, says Jai Bala  - Moneycontrol.com
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Jai Bala of Cashthechaos.com told CNBC-TV18, " ICICI Bank and State Bank of India together are a problem for the market, that is what is holding back the market. We want both these stocks to pickup and once the banking index were to cross above 15700 it would be because both these stocks have stabilised. Both of them are still in a problem zone. It is looking like it is trying to stabilise but it is not yet picking up but we want that to happen for the overall health of the market."He further added, " Maruti Suzuki has had a stellar run from 2012. So, it is a very welcome correction. I think the correction is still ongoing. There is still little bit of downside left for the stock. It will come somewhere close to Rs 3300-3400 and stabilise somewhere around there. Then post that it will go to record highs but you have got to be patient for this stock to correct a bit more, don't get impatient and try to pull the trigger here. It has corrected quite a bit but still there is a small bit of downside to be done for the stock in the short term. I think that will be stabilising around Rs 3300-3400."$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Firstcall Research is bullish on Wim Plast Ind has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 1880 in its research report dated February 25, 2016.
title: Buy Wim Plast;target of Rs 1880: Firstcall Research  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Wim Plast,Wim Plast
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Firstcall Research's research report on Wim Plast Wim Plast Limited is one of the group companies of ‘cello’ group. Wim Plasts Limited was incorporated on 7th of October, 1988 as a Private Limited Company. Registrar at Bombay, Maharashtra and latter it was converted into a Public Limited Company on 14th July 1993. CELLO begins its journey by manufacturing plastic household goods. Presently the company has manufacturing units at Daman, Baddi and Chennai also have Depots in Gujarat, Rajasthan, Andhra Pradesh, Haryana and Punjab and have strong consumer base through out the country. And recently the new additional Manufacturing Unit in Kolkata was started in February 2013. In the year 1994 Cello Group ventures stepped into manufacturing moulded furniture. Elegant, versatile and durable, cello furniture brings convenience and style to consumers at surprising economical price, made from special grade plastic and state-of-the-art moulds from Italy. Cello Furniture becomes a household name in short span of time for its range of products and quality. Cello Group entered the plastic moulded ball pen Writing Instruments market in the year 1995, cello exploded on the scene with cello Clear Pens with Swiss tips and German ink and changed forever the way pen ran on paper. The revolutionary new smear free, smooth flowing pen not just took the market by storm but marked a new era in writing instruments in India. Not too long after, the company unveiled two more models Prism and Crystal and with that started as a mere 3-machine Company, took wings. The Company’s production techniques include Injection Moulding and Extrusion Technology. The Technological process is subject to up gradation from time to time and efforts are continuously made to absorb the latest Technology. This results in the up- gradation of production process with improved results of operations. The Company does not have any Subsidiary Company. We recommend ‘BUY’ in this particular scrip with a target price of Rs. 1880.00 for Medium to Long term investment. description: KRChoksey has recommended hold rating on Canara Bank with a target price of Rs 177 in its research report dated February 26, 2016.
title: Hold Canara Bank;target of Rs 177: KRChoksey  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Canara Bank,Canara Bank
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}KRChoksey's research report on Canara Bank Business re-organization and RBI’s AQR review dented the Q3FY16 earnings performance of Canara Bank. While the business consolidation exercise continues to deter the top-line, the focus on built-up of staunch liability franchise with increased thrust on both asset (retail loan traction) and liability side (CASA augmentation) should aid improved business performance ahead. For now, the weak liability franchise and persistent pressures on asset quality continue to haunt the bank’s performance. Maintain HOLD.Canara Bank continues to disappoint on the earnings front and Q3FY16 bottom-line stood abysmally low. While the bank engages itself into re-organization exercise consolidating its balance sheet, the earnings pressures stand imminent even as we foray into FY17 ahead. The AQR review and the much elevated stressed asset ratio prompt us to maintain negative near-term outlook. We reckon the long term business strategy to focus on retail franchise traction laid out by the new MD and CEO appears promising, the worries still do not stand priced in. While we maintain HOLD recommendation on the stock, we revise our target price downwards to INR 177 (earlier INR 289) so as to accommodate the sharp earnings cut, lower business growth and higher asset quality pressures. We value the bank at 0.6 x P/ABV FY17E and roll over FY18 estimates valuing the bank at 0.6x P/ABV FY18E. At CMP, the stock trades at 0.5 FY17E P/ABV. description: Karvy is bullish on Mahindra CIE Ind has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 225 in its research report dated February 26, 2016.
title: Buy Mahindra CIE;target of Rs 225: Karvy  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Castings & Forgings,Mahindra CIE,Mahindra CIE,Mahindra CIE Automotive
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Karvy's research report on Mahindra CIE Mahindra CIE’s (MCI) consolidated revenue for Q3FY16 was at | 1268 crore (up 1.1% YoY). EBITDA margin contracted 220bps QoQ to 8% (vs. our estimate of 11%) as it was adversely affected by costs associated with migrating parts from the closed Jeco to other plants. Exceptional item of | 77.8 crore includes restructuring of MFE (laidoff 200 employees) & inventory write down of Metalcastello. PAT came in at | 14.8 crore, down 65.2% YoY (vs. estimate of | 61 crore) . Standalone revenues grew 4.8% YoY to | 396.5 crore, driven by its key customers (M&M and Tata Motors production grew ~3% YoY). EBITDA margins were at 7.2%, down 114 bps QoQ as the benefit of lower input cost was partially passed. Higher power & employee expense & withdrawal of export incentives also impacted profitability. PAT declined 62.1% YoY to | 5 crore vs. our estimate of | 13 crore . MCI has changed its accounting year from financial year (FY) to calendar year (CY). Assuming a weak demand environment and a slower pace of margin expansion we have moderated our estimates. However, we remain positive on turnaround possibilities.Mahindra CIE Auto is a unique case of valuation considering the massive turnaround possibilities. With cost controls & economic recovery playing out, we expect utilisation levels to improve leading EBIT margins to rise to ~9% and RoCE expansion to ~13% in CY17E. CIE’s track record on turnarounds via cost control and high focus on financial metrics give us confidence. We value MCI at 10x CY17E EV/EBITDA multiple, to arrive at a target price of | 225. We maintain BUY recommendation on the stock. content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Sudarshan Sukhani of s2analytics.com told CNBC-TV18, "I have been upbeat on pharmaceutical. Pharma is now divided in two parts midcap and largecap and they have already gone through a cycle and that cycle was a correction cycle, the correction seems to be over. So, Lupin and Sun Pharmaceutical are both buying opportunities."He further added, "Now because of the dynamics of the futures & options (F&O) expiry which I don’t understand at all I don’t think you should be willing to take a day trade here. Buy today, if you make money by the end of expiry today, good for you otherwise carry it. The trend is up for both of them.""I am not sure IT is the sector to be in today. Even Infosys is a little weak and you don’t want to go and short Infosys or Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), so it is best avoided. It is a short covering bounce. They are making lows and then bouncing from those lows. It is not enough to justify any kind of buying there. Maybe at some point, not now, I don’t know but at some point if this bounce stalls that will become a short sell. There is no buying." " Bharat Earth Movers (BEML) is technically good. It just bottoming out, so even without the Railway Budget and I don’t think the Budget would affect it one way or the other, it is a buying opportunity. If you want to make a position BEML is a very good chart. KEC International is a complete avoid and do would Siemens and Larsen & Toubro (L&T) be not today," he said. " LIC Housing Finance is giving us a sell signal. I don’t even know how to take these signals now after these big declines. There is nothing to buy. Housing Finance companies are giving very despondent charts and LIC Housing is a positional short."$("

Besides, the company is considering a pre-IPO Placement of up to 42 lakh equity shares aggregating up to Rs 125 crore with certain investors. The proceeds of the issue will be utilised for repayment of loans, to fund working capital requirements and for other general corporate purposes. As per the Draft Red Herring Prospectus (DRHP) filed with Sebi, the company's IPO comprises of equity shares worth Rs 450 crore. The issue is being managed by SBI Capital Markets, ICICI Securities and IDFC Bank. The equity shares will be listed on the BSE and NSE. HPL an electric equipment manufacturing company. It makes metering solutions, switchgears, lighting equipment and wires & cables. $("

description: Karvy is bullish on Minda Ind Ind has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 881 in its research report dated February 25, 2016.
title: Buy Minda Ind;target of Rs 881: Karvy  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Minda Ind,Minda Ind,Minda Industries
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Karvy's research report on Minda Ind Consolidated revenues are expected to grow at CAGR of 12% between FY16E-18E majorly driven by Clarton Horns and MJ castings growth. Their share in the consolidated revenues is likely to jump by 300bps by FY18E accommodated by moderate growth in standalone sales due to higher exposure in the two-wheeler market. 9MFY16 revenue has increased by 14% (YoY). Gross profit margin has significantly gone up by 160bps during this period as compared to 9MFY15 led by lower raw material costs. EBITDA margins have soared up to 8.6% in 9MFY16 as compared to 7.1% during 9MFY15. Going forward, we expect EBITDA margins to be 8.9% in FY16E and 9.1% in FY18E assuming better realizations and raw material benefits to continue. Operating profit margins are expected to be 4.8% in FY16E and is likely to get better by FY18E to 6.2%. This is because of higher depreciation impact on account of capex due to increase in stake in Minda ASEAN, additional investment of Rs.140Mn in Minda Kosei and the Mexican Plant (Euro 6Mn spread over 2015-2018) with regard to Clarton Horns, which has led the Net block as on Sep’15 to increase by ~Rs. 1500Mn, 37% more as compared to Mar’15. RoE is expected to increase to 21.8% in FY16E and further to 25.3% in FY18E from 15.4% in FY15 driven by higher top-line growth and operating efficiency. RoCE is expected to improve to 19.4% in FY16E from 12.2% in FY15 and further reach 22.7% in FY18E driven by a notable push in gross profit margins in the recent quarters and also we have assumed the loan books to reduce. At CMP of Rs.753, Minda Industries Ltd is currently trading at 8.6x FY18E EPS. We value the company at P/E 10.1x for FY18E EPS for a target price of Rs.881 based on the company’s future prospects. We, therefore, initiate coverage on Minda Industries Ltd with a “BUY” rating for a target price of Rs. 881 representing an upside potential of 17% in a 12-15 month period.
