description: Shares of United Spirits rallied more than 6 percent intraday after Vijay Mallya resigned as chairman of the company. Even addition of stock into futures & options segment by NSE also boosted sentiment.
title: United Sprits up 6% on resignation by Vijay Mallya as chairman  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,United Spirits,United Spirits,Diageo,Vijay Mallya
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Moneycontrol Bureau Shares of United Spirits rallied more than 6 percent intraday after Vijay Mallya resigned as chairman of the company. Addition of stock into futures & options segment by NSE also boosted sentiment. "United Spirits has entered into an agreement with Vijay Mallya under which he has resigned with effect from February 25 from his position as chairman and non-executive director of the company, and from his position as a director of Royal Challengers Sports Private Limited (RCSPL) and Four Seasons Wines," the company said in its filing. After his resignation, Mahendra Kumar Sharma, independent director and chairman of the audit committee, is appointed as chairman of board with effect from February 25, 2016. After resignation, he will become founder Emeritus of the company. Analysts say it is positive for the stock. Abanti Sankara-Narayan of United Spirits says that the agreement is an affirmative action to end Mallya's association with USL. Diageo will pay USD 75 million to Vijay Mallya, out of which USD 40 million will be paid with immediate effect and balance over next five years. In addition to that, Diageo will pay USD 15 million per season for the Smirnoff sponsorship for Force India Formula 1 team. This payment will be charged to exceptional items in FY16 in Diageos books. Mallya, who has agreed to a 5-year global non-compete clause, will now have no personal liability to Diageo. He also agreed to not pursue any claims against United Spirits, Diageo and their affiliates. With Mallya's resignation, United Spirits is a complete Diageo's company which holds 54.7 percent in USL. Additionally, the stock is added to futures & options segment of National Stock Exchange today. At 11:50 hours IST, the scrip of United Spirits was quoting at Rs 2,707.00, up Rs 42.35, or 1.59 percent on the BSE. Posted by Sunil Shankar Matkar$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Shares of Dishman Pharmaceuticals and Chemicals rallied 7 percent intraday Thursday after the board members approved bonus issue and amalgamation of the company.
title: Dishman Pharma up 7% on board nod for bonus issue, amalgamation  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Dishman Pharma,Dishman Pharmaceuticals & Chemicals,bonus issue,amalgamation
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Moneycontrol Bureau Shares of Dishman Pharmaceuticals and Chemicals rallied 7 percent intraday Thursday after the board members approved bonus issue and amalgamation of the company. "Board of directors, on February 24, has recommended a bonus issue of equity shares in ratio of one equity share for every one equity share held, as on the record date to be determined by the board. It will be subject to approval by the shareholders," the Ahmedabad-based pharma company said in its filing. The board also announced amalgamation amongst company, Dishman Care and Carbogen Amcis India (CAIL) after approval for slump sale of effluent treatment plants undertaking from the company to CAIL (a wholly owned subsidiary) as a going concern. The company said total consideration for transfer of ETP Undertaking will be Rs 15 crore, adding that upon amalgamation, equity shares of Dishman Care held by company will be deemed to be cancelled. Dishman Care is engaged in market research, business development and marketing of disinfectant products to be manufactured by the company. After amalgamation of company with CAIL, it decided to change name of Carbogen Amcis India to Dishman Carbogen Amcis that will be listed on BSE and NSE. Accordingly, Dishman Pharma's shareholders will get one share of CAIL for every one share held in the company. "Pursuant to amalgamation, shareholding of CAIL will be miror image of shareholding of the company and equity shares of CAIL held by Dishman will be deemed to be cancelled," the company said. CAIL is engaged in research and development, including regulatory filings of certain pharmaceutical molecules for some of overseas subsidiaries of the company. The scheme of arrangement will be subject to approval of shareholders and Gujarat High Court & other authorities. At 09:21 hours IST, the scrip of Dishman Pharmaceuticals & Chemicals was quoting at Rs 320.25, up Rs 14.95, or 4.90 percent on the BSE.Posted by Sunil Shankar Matkar$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Dhananjay Sinha - Head, Institutional Research at Emkay Global Financial Services is of the view that one can pick Asian Paints, Britannia Industries and Marico and likes YES Bank, HDFC Bank and HCL Technologies.
title: Pick Asian Paints, Britannia; like YES Bank, HDFC Bank: Emkay
tags: Business,Markets,Paints & Varnishes,Asian Paints,Britannia,Marico,Yes Bank,HDFC Bank,IndusInd Bank,Tata Motors,Hero Motocorp,Bajaj Auto,HCL Tech,Lupin,Sun Pharma,Dhananjay Sinha,Dhananjay Sinha,Emkay Global Financial Services,Asian Paints,Britannia Industries,Marico,Yes Bank,HDFC Bank,IndusInd Bank,Tata Motors,Hero Motocorp,Bajaj Auto,HCL Technologies,Lupin,Sun Pharmaceutical Industries
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Dhananjay Sinha - Head, Institutional Research at Emkay Global Financial Services told CNBC-TV18, "I am overweight on consumer space, so, I think that urban consumer will do well. We will have to see what the government does with respect to rural allocations. I am expecting expansionary Budget especially in the context that you will have state election. So, I think there will be certain allocation for rural sector as well. So, in consumer space, the picks that we have are Asian Paints , Britannia Industries and  Marico .""In the banking space, we still sort of like the consumer banks such as YES Bank , HDFC Bank and maybe IndusInd Bank . In autos we have been overweight and over there we see value in Tata Motors . Maybe two wheelers also can be considered like Hero Motocorp and Bajaj Auto ," he said. "Generally, we have been overweight in the IT space. We like HCL Technologies and in pharmaceutical space we have Lupin and Sun Pharmaceutical Industries ."$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Shares of Suzlon Energy gained 1.5 percent intraday Friday. The Suzlon group won a maiden order of 71.40 MW wind power project from Gujarat Industries Power Company.
title: Suzlon Energy gains on 71.40MW order win in Gujarat  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Suzlon Energy,Suzlon Energy,Gujarat ,Gujarat Industries Power Company,Suzlon group
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Moneycontrol BureauShares of Suzlon Energy gained 1.5 percent intraday Friday. The Suzlon group won a maiden order of 71.40 MW wind power project from Gujarat Industries Power Company.The company will install 29 units of S97-120m wind turbine generators (WTGs) with all steel hybrid tower and 5 units of S97-90m WTGs with tubular tower having rated capacity of 2.1MW each.The project is located at Kutch, Gujarat and will be completed in three phases with execution completed by April 2017."The company will execute the entire project on a turnkey basis and will also provide operation and maintenance services for a period of 20 years through an integrated service package," as per BSE release.Ishwar Mangal, Chief Sales Officer, Suzlon Energy said, "Gujarat has been at the forefront of generating power through renewable energy sources and Suzlon has played a pivotal role in contributing to its renewable energy portfolio."Posted by Rakesh Patil$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: According to Gaurang Shah of Geojit BNP Paribas, one may stay invested in Axis Bank.
title: Stay invested in Axis Bank, says Gaurang Shah  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Axis Bank,Gaurang Shah ,Gaurang Shah,Geojit BNP Paribas,Axis Bank
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Gaurang Shah of Geojit BNP Paribas told CNBC-TV18, "It is not only our market which is down year to date but even markets globally. So, these are difficult times we are sailing through an unchartered territory. We need some patient investors and long-term view if you are buying into this kind of market with lot of uncertainties.""We do have a positive coverage on Axis Bank and our preference in entire banking universe first goes towards private sector banks and selective few names in the PSU banks. If one has got an investable amount and has a time horizon about a year and a year and a half, my advice would be to hold on to your investment," he added.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

content:

description: SP Tulsian of sptulsian.com isof the view that one can buy Arvind with a target of Rs 275.
title: Buy Arvind, target Rs 275: SP Tulsian  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Arvind,SP Tulsian,SP Tulsian of sptulsian.com,Arvind
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}SP Tulsian of sptulsian.com told CNBC-TV18, "In last three months, Arvind has not broken or breached the support of Rs 260. So, maybe there was a lot of delivery based buying seen in the counter, but correspondingly we have seen the longs having created in the March series also. So, what happens sometimes, those who have been holding the stock, they get out of the stock, but create the similar long position in the future and that is what has happened. Honestly, I was not expecting that to happen. Probably yesterday's event, at the time of the expiry indicated that it had bottomed out." "The stock has corrected below Rs 250. This is an entry point for investors, or maybe for the positional traders because I will not be surprised to see the share moving back to level of Rs 275 also in this series which can give you a rise of Rs 20 from here," he said.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Ashu Madan of Religare Securities is of the view that one may hold NCL Industries.
title: Hold NCL Industries, says Ashu Madan  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,NCL Industries,Ashu Madan,Ashu Madan,Religare Securities,NCL Industries
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Ashu Madan of Religare Securities told CNBC-TV18, "At this juncture NCL Industries has a potential to go up because it was a swift up movement; in 10 months from Rs 80 to Rs 180, so at the peak lot of people got trapped but at this price it's a hold."He further added, "If one holds it at this juncture, probably in sometime there could be a possible upside and we could see Rs 120-125 levels. description: Mayuresh Joshi of Angel Broking likes cement, infra and largecap IT space.
title: Like cement, infra, largecap IT space: Mayuresh Joshi  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Computers - Software,HCL Tech,Infosys,ACC,Bajaj Auto,Mayuresh Joshi of Angel Broking,HCL Technologies,Infosys,ACC,Bajaj Auto
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Mayuresh Joshi of Angel Broking told CNBC-TV18, "Clearly from a sectoral perspective what we are probably liking is something like cement/infrastructure as a space. Our entire take is with the government's focus on infrastructure/housing expected to gather steam and again input cost staying benign, the realisation in terms of topline growth, volume growth and demand revival are key themes which should probably happen over the next two to three quarters.""Probably large cap IT is something that we are also liking at this juncture. Yes, there are a few jitters in how the US economy is shaking up and how discretionary spends might happen but going by the historical trends and what has happened in the quarter gone by we are clearly seeing client mining activity picking up, a few of the companies like HCL Tech have showing transformational deal wins in excess of USD 1 billion odd in terms of TCV and client mining activity along with utilisation levels have picked up for companies like  Infosys . So, large cap IT is something that we will continue to prefer at this point of time," he said."Clearly specific auto names, though there is every chance that there might be some duty changes happening but clearly auto stocks and expectation of demand revival with pay commissions coming through, specific two wheelers and specific four wheelers are looking quite decently poised at this point of time."$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Emkay is bullish on Ahluwalia has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 355 in its research report dated February 15, 2016.
title: Buy Ahluwalia;target of Rs 355: Emkay  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Ahluwalia,Ahluwalia,Ahluwalia Contracts India
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Emkay's research report on Ahluwalia Revenue came in at Rs3.2 bn +20% YoY largely in line with our expectation of Rs3.3 bn on stable execution run rate EBITDA came at Rs394 mn +60.1% YoY higher than expectation of Rs371 mn driven by higher than expected margins. EBITDA Margin came 12.3% +309 bps YoY versus expectation of 11.25%, Management maintain EBITDA Margin guidance of 12.5% in FY17E Interest cost came in at Rs66 mn -29.1% YoY, -12.1% QoQ, lower than expectations of Rs80 mn. The company is seeing benefits of reduction in the bank guarantee charges as well some reduction in the borrowing cost. Given the revenue & margin visibility, reduction in leverage and improvement in working capital which will drive the earnings CAGR of 28% over FY16-18E. Maintain Buy, with a target price to Rs355/share Interest cost came in at Rs66 mn -29.1% YoY, -12.1% QoQ, lower than expectations of Rs80 mn. The company is seeing benefits of reduction in the bank guarantee charges as well some reduction in the borrowing cost. Tax rate came in at 33% in Q3FY16 against expectation of 25%. The company expects tax rate to be 26-30% for FY16 and it will return to full tax rate from FY17 onwards. Net profit came at Rs199 mn +46.3% YoY versus expectation of Rs202 mn driven by better operational profitability. Higher than expected tax rate gets offset by lower than expected capital cost. The other income is lower at Rs18 mn as there is no interest on receivables from clients recorded during this quarter. The company had accumulated losses of Rs200 mn at the beginning of FY16, which it has distributed equally in each quarter (Rs50 mn) which led to the lower tax rate. The company also expects a tax refund of Rs250-300 mn in Mar-Apr 2016. The company expects its Kota bus terminal project to launch in 1-1.5 months’ time. For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Emkay is bullish on Voltas has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 318 in its research report dated February 16, 2016.
title: Buy Voltas;target of Rs 318: Emkay  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Voltas,Voltas
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Emkay's research report on Voltas Voltas reported 37% YoY growth in revenues – Electro-mechanical projects and services (EMPS), engineering products and services (EPS) and unitary cooling products (UCP) increased by 56%, 38% and 13% YoY respectively. EBITDAM decline by 160 bps YoY to 4.5%. Recommend Buy with target price of Rs318. Going forward, margins are expected to gradually improve in the EMPS segment as slow moving orders move out of the backlog and newer projects with better profitability (threshold margins of >5%) come into execution. In the UCP segment, we expect Voltas to retain its market share albeit with some impact on margins. In the air -cooler segment, Voltas has increased its product range and dealership network and is expected to gain revenue traction in the upcoming season. Voltas has a strong balance sheet and cash flow generating capabilities which will help it wither the storm in the near to medium term. The stock trades at FY18 P/E multiple of 16x. Maintain Buy with a target price of Rs318 per share. For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. $("

.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Mayur Milak of Anand Rathi told CNBC-TV18, "With the recent stock price correction that has happened and we already know that the average crude price is lower than what they have put it in the last quarter, I see no reason why the outlook should not be positive for the entire aviation pack and particularly  SpiceJet . description: VK Sharma of HDFC Securities recommends buying Jet Airways 560 Call and Britannia Industries 2800 Call.
title: Buy Jet Airways 560 Call, Britannia 2800 Call: VK Sharma  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Jet Airways,Britannia,Lupin,VK Sharma,VK Sharma of HDFC Securities,Jet Airways,Britannia Industries,Lupin
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}VK Sharma of HDFC Securities told CNBC-TV18, "One of the reasons why I chose Jet Airways was primarily from the fact that in aviation you don’t have any other stock in that derivative segment. Yesterday we did see January data come in and trafiic increasing by 23 percent. The company has gone ahead and increased its market share from Rs 18-18.7 percent. So, there are nothing to talk about derivatives but 25 percent aviation turbine fuel (ATF) is down in the current quarter. We expect that the stock should do well. I am suggesting to buy Jet Airways 560 Call at around Rs 12, target at around Rs 8 and with the target of Rs 20. Book your profits whenever that amount comes."" Britannia Industries went up sharply yesterday. It went up by 4 percent and open interst has increased only by 1 percent. So, I am suggesting to buy Britannia 2800 Call at a premium of around Rs 28. Yesterday it had quoted around Rs 35, so keep a stop loss at Rs 15 with a target around Rs 50," he said." Lupin is one of those other stocks apart from IT and let say private sector banks which are doing well. Yesterday the price went up by 3 percent, OI also has been added by 3 percent. We saw positions being added into this stock yesterday. So, my strategy here is to buy the 1800 Call at around Rs 18. Mind you yesterday it closed around Rs 23. I am suggesting it to bought only at Rs 18, so this stock should open lower and that point of time you can buy. Stop loss may be at around Rs 12 with target of around Rs 30 in Lupin."$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Watch the interview of Ashish Kyal of wavesstrategy.com and Gaurang Shah of Geojit BNP Paribas with Surabhi Upadhyay and Nigel D'Souza on CNBC-TV18, in which they shared their readings and outlook on specific stocks and sectors.
title: Check out: Top chart picks by market experts  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Ashish Kyal,wavesstrategy,Gaurang Shah,Geojit BNP Paribas,stocks,sectors
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Watch the interview of Ashish Kyal of wavesstrategy.com and Gaurang Shah of Geojit BNP Paribas with Surabhi Upadhyay and Nigel D'Souza on CNBC-TV18, in which they shared their readings and outlook on specific stocks and sectors. Gaurang Shah of Geojit BNP Paribas Adani Port In this kind of a market you need to be careful what you are buying in case if you are buying it from a short to medium term. And if you are buying stocks which have been under pressure, my sense is that you may end up on the losing side. So, in case if you want to exit from here and of course you have got a whole host of events lined up today, the last day or the next week we come back we face the expiry and the week after that we will face the Budget. So, our sense is that at least for the next week or 10-15 days the markets are going to be extremely choppy. One may use any kind of pull back on the higher side to lighten up Adani Port and if you are looking at it from a long term point of view then our advice would be to look at private sector banking which has corrected. From a long term, private sector banks looks quite attractive. Even something in autos like Tata Motors DVR, Tata Motors look quite promising to me from a long term point of view. So, use pull back to lighten up these kind of stocks.Tata Elxsi Good time to get into the Tata Group stock but you need to identify what you are buying and not only Tata Group, there are other companies in the IT sector which have been well managed and has created value over a period of time. So, with that perspective and given that Tata Elxsi has run up quite a bit, you might see some kind of volatility, so you need to stay away from that kind of volatility. In our view, Infosys or HCL Technologies, either of these companies may turn out to be a better investment idea from a long-term point of view and it may actually create great value for you. As a disclosure, we do have positive coverage on both of them, so my advice would be to buy either Infosys or HCL Technologies .Century Textiles One does expect some kind of recovery post the big event in form of Budget once it is done and dusted with and if the Finance Minister has to deliver some pleasantries, so don’t sell it out at current levels. Wait out; Century Textiles is down because the entire market is down and so is the markets globally, so you don’t need to worry about that. The problem is from a long-term point of view whether it is advisable to stay invested in this stock. There have been a lot of news flows surrounding this particular company. In case if you want to say with the textile sector, our preference would be Arvind . This is one particular stock which has delivered consistent numbers and the outlook looks quite positive in terms of their business. So, if you want to stay in the textile, maybe something like a Arvind is preferable. So, you can lighten up on Century Textile at any kind of pullback. In case if you want to make a shift from here and look at a relatively safer bet, then maybe Sun Pharmaceutical or Lupin from the pharmaceutical pack or in the IT space, HCL Technologies or Infosys ; this is the broad preference that I can suggest.HPCL I would say hold on to Hindustan Petroleum Corporation (HPCL). There is a lot of to and fro as far as the output is concerned from OPEC whether to maintain a January level or not. Iran on the flip side has had a hard stand. They are not willing to budge as far as the output is concerned. In fact they wanted to increase their output from 5 lakh barrels per day to maybe 8-8.5 lakh barrels per day. As a disclosure, we do have a positive coverage on HPCL and BPCL . From a long-term point of view, our target stands at about Rs 1,000-1,050 on HPCL and our guess is that after this initial boil that you are seeing on the crude oil, once the dust settles down and the noise subsidies you could possibly see oil again heading lower which is the best case scenario for oil marketing companies. Ashish Kyal of wavesstrategy.comMan Industries Man Industries has bounced back from Rs 45 and rallied towards Rs 125 till September last year but then it again started crashing down and it is now substantially lower back towards Rs 50 levels. I would suggest to definitely be out of the stock like this. So any pullback from here should be used as an exit opportunity because it doesn’t make sense to be with this stock that has been underperforming for almost eight years now and it is better to invest in something in stocks like probably Asian Paints , which has been doing exceptionally good, something like Ashok Leyland that has been outperforming the overall sell off that we have seen over the past few days and week. So I think it is better to be with the largecaps and that too with the outperforming stocks rather than something like this that has been all over the places over past many years.Suzlon Energy Even last week, Suzlon Energy has been all over the places. It moved from Rs 9 to Rs 35-36. It then crashed back towards Rs 11, it then moved again towards Rs 28 and now it is again back to Rs 12. So I would suggest staying back with a stock that has been moving in this fashion is absolutely not a good investment. It is better to be moving out of a stock like this with such a high volatility and no clear direction, no clear trend and it has been also moving below its important moving averages. It is better to stay out with Suzlon and invest in other largecap companies probably something like Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) or something like Asian Paints , Ashok Leyland . So any rallies towards the level of Rs 17-18 should be a good exit price and on the downside one can probably use Rs 11 as a very strict stoploss for the existing position.L&T If the horizon is one year, then one should hold Larsen and Toubro (L&T). It has corrected sharply from the levels of Rs 1,850 to these low of around Rs 1,000. Over the past few days, we have seen some kind of bounce back activity, which is happening and the stock has now arrived again towards the 50-days moving average. It is going to be very crucial for it to cross above Rs 1,200, which is the resistance zone. So, if it manages to cross above Rs 1,200 then we can see the levels of Rs 1,350 or Rs 1,400 on upside. So, one can hold this stock from a year's perspective, but one has to apply a stoploss which should be near Rs 950. If this stock crosses or closes below Rs 950, I am not sure where it is headed. So, use Rs 950 as a very strict stoploss and there can be some reversal or buying activity which might be emerging in this stock after a long time.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Concern of an increased excise duty on tobacco in the upcoming Budget is pressurising ITC stock. Shares of the FMCG major slipped 4 percent intraday on Monday.  Analysts see excise duty hike of 10-17 percent in cigarettes. Motilal Oswal expects a blended excise duty increase of 10 percent. In FY15-16, excise duty was hiked 25 percent in cigarette lengths less than 65mm and 15 percent increased for lengths over 65 mm.
title: Fear of 10-17% excise duty hike wrecks ITC ahead of Budget
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,ITC,Nasrin Sultana,ITC,FMCG,excise duty hike,cigarette,Motilal Oswal,tobacco,Jefferies,Macquarie
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Moneycontrol Bureau Concern of an increased excise duty on tobacco in the upcoming Budget is pressurising ITC stock. Shares of the FMCG major slipped 4 percent intraday on Monday. Analysts say there may be an excise duty hike of 10-17 percent in cigarettes in FY17. Motilal Oswal expects a blended excise duty increase of 10 percent. Higher-than-expected excise hikes may impact already dampened cigarette volumes. Cigarette industry is already facing a crunch in volume in last few quarters due to multiple excise duty hike initiated by the government for four consecutive years.  In FY15-16, excise duty was hiked 25 percent in cigarette lengths less than 65mm and 15 percent increased for lengths over 65 mm. According to Motilal Oswal,  ITC may implement a weighted average price hike of 10-11 percent to pass on the excise duty increase. It adds that in such a scenario, cigarette volumes may decline 8-10 percent in FY17.Kotak says Budget FY17 may see moderate rise of 5-10 percent in excise duties on cigarettes. "If duty hike is in line with our expectations, we would expect the impact on ITC to be positive. A 15 percent hike in duties shall have a negative sentimental impact; however, we believe the same is factored into the price as of now," it adds in a report. ITC’s key product tobacco-based items mainly cigarette sales volume saw a moderate decline in December quarter to 4.5 percent after four quarters of double digit declines. ITC’s cigarette sales volume has fallen over 20 percent in the last three years due to steep increases in taxation and subsequent price hikes.After Q3 results, analysts were, however, hopeful of growth in cigarette volumes. Jefferies had said that low single-digit decline in cigarette volumes was better than beaten-down expectations and likely indicates a bottoming out of demand. According to Jefferies, revival in overall consumption trends should kick start cigarette volume recovery for ITC in due course.Macquarie also said that while cigarette volume outlook will continue to depend on excise duty changes in the Union Budget, after three years of decline in volumes, the base has become favourable for volume growth in cigarettes.At 11:39 hrs ITC was quoting at Rs 297.60, down Rs 7.25, or 2.38 percent on the BSE.Follow @ NasrinzStory $("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Shares of Electrosteel Steels spiked more than 12 percent intraday Monday as a media report suggested that change in management is likely to take place in the company soon.
title: Electrosteel Steels jumps 12% on hope of management change  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Electrosteel St,Electrosteel Steels,strategic debt restructuring,SDR,RBI,Reserve Bank of India
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Shares of Electrosteel Steels spiked more than 12 percent intraday Monday as a media report suggested that change in management is likely to take place in the company soon. "The change of management at Electrosteel Steels, the first company where lenders had applied the strategic debt restructuring (SDR) last year, is now going to be through the non-SDR route," a media report said. Seventy-five percent of the lenders, in value, have agreed in principle to change the management in favour of London-based First International Group (FIG) and China's Laiwu Steel Group, outside the SDR mechanism, it added. SDR was introduced by the Reserve Bank of India last June to tackle bad loans, by allowing banks to acquire control of a defaulting company by converting the loans into equity, partially or fully. That was to be followed by bringing in new promoters after which sticky assets would be upgraded to standard ones. In September 2015, the central bank came up with another circular on a non-SDR mechanism, allowing banks to upgrade the credit facilities of borrowers whose ownership was changed outside an SDR to the standard category. In this case, banks have more power to bring in a change in ownership of borrowing entities which are under stress primarily due to operational/ managerial inefficiencies despite substantial sacrifices made by the lending banks. At 15:08 hours IST, the scrip of Electrosteel Steels was quoting at Rs 3.76, up Rs 0.35, or 10.26 percent on the BSE.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Emkay is bullish on Insecticides India Ltd and has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 380 in its research report dated feburary 15, 2016
title: Buy Insecticides India Ltd; target of Rs 380: Emkay  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Insecticides,Insecticides India, buy, emkay
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Emkay's research report on  Insecticides India  Ltd Revenues at Rs 1.5bn (+8% yoy) came in line with estimates. Formulation segment revenues recorded healthy growth of 13% yoy whereas technical segment revenues declined 13% yoy on the back of sluggish demand B2B segment and fall in prices of key chemicals ■ Gross margins improved 230 bps yoy to 34% on account of lower input prices. EBITDA margins saw 240 bps yoy compression due to steep increase of 40% in other expenses ■ Forex loss in the tune of Rs13mn, and higher tax rate at 38% impacted profitability as RPAT declined 64% yoy to Rs 10mn below our estimate of Rs 1.9mn ■ Challenging operating environment in the technical segment remains a concern. Cut FY16/17 estimates to factor in overall weak demand. However, we remain positive on the long term growth prospects of the domestic agrochemical industry. Retain buyInsecticide India posted 8% yoy revenue growth to Rs 1.5bn (in line with estimates) led by healthy growth in the formulation segment (+13% yoy) while technical segment continued to face demand pressure in the B2B segment resulting in drop of 13% yoy in segment revenues.Also, softening in prices of key chemicals further impacted realizations in the technical segment.For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. description: Icicidirect  has recommended hold on rating on the stock NRB Bearings  with a target price of Rs 122, in its research report dated Feburary 16, 2016
title: Hold on to NRB Bearings; target of Rs122: Icicidirect  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,NRB Bearings,NRB Bearings, hold, icicidirect
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Icicidirect research report on NRB Bearings NRB Bearings’ Q3FY16 sales were below our estimate due to subdues demand across two wheeler and auto segment Standalone topline declined 4.6% YoY to Rs158.8 crore, below our estimate of Rs 177.4 crore, mainly due to a lower-than-expectedrecovery in the auto space. The 2W volume growth remained tepid inQ3FY16 at 1.1% YoY, thus impacting the domestic OEM segment EBITDA declined 33.4% YoY to Rs 20.3 crore below our estimate of 32.5 crore for the quarter primarily due lower than anticipated revenue and increased stores & spare expenses and employee cost in Q3FY15. EBITDA margins declined 552 bps YoY to 12.8% mainly owing to lower sales, higher share of low margin trading business and increased operating expenses in Q3FY16 Consequently, PAT declined 36.9% YoY to Rs 7.8 crore in Q3FY16, below our expectation of Rs15.0 crore for the quarter. Valuation NRB has been a key player in the domestic bearings industry consideringits leadership position in needle roller bearings. Being an automotive centric supplier with customised product offerings, the company also enjoys a sticky client relationship like its MNC peers such as SKF, Fag and Timken and has a presence across all leading OEM players in India. NRB has consistently demonstrated a handsome financial performance with revenues and earnings CAGR of 15.6% and 65.9%, respectively, in FY09-14. Going ahead, with the overall improvement in the economy and other macro factors such as easing of inflation and lowering of interest rates, automotive volumes are expected to bounce back. NRB, being an important player in the automotive bearings space with a leadership position in needle roller bearings, is expected to be a key beneficiary. We also expect export revenues to grow at 13.0% CAGR in FY15-18E as the company continues to expand its footprint in newer geographies.While we continue to believe that NRB would be one of the keybeneficiaries of a recovery in automotive sector (given its leadership position in needle roller bearings space), the recovery would now be more back ended. We had revised our earning estimate downward to factor in tepid Q3FY16 result which reflects slower recovery in demand. We have revised our earning estimates downward by 26.2% and 17.1% for FY16E and FY17E, respectively. We roll over our valuation metric on FY18E and derive a revised target price to Rs 122 (14x FY18E PAT) vs. Rs 135 earlier. Accordingly, we maintain our HOLD rating on the stock. For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. $("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: KRChoksey is bullish on Sun Pharma has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 971 in its research report dated February 15, 2016.
title: Buy Sun Pharma;target of Rs 971: KRChoksey  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Sun Pharma,Sun Pharma,Sun Pharmaceutical Industries
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}KRChoksey's research report on Sun Pharma Sun Pharma’s result was above our estimates. Total revenues stood at INR 70.5bn registering a growth of 2.4% YoY on account of slowdown in the US business due to temporary supply constraints at its Halol plant & competitive pressure on some of the products. Taro posted sales of USD 258mn, showed growth of 9% YoY and 22% QoQ with marginal increase in volumes. Elevated other income at INR 2.2bn and lower interest cost coupled with superior operating efficiency and cost curtailment led to enhanced EBITDA at INR 21.7bn which was flattish YoY and up 12% QoQ with EBITDA margins at 30.6% down 61bps YoY and up 235 QoQ. R&D expenses during the quarter stood at INR 5.8bn, at 8.2% of sales growing by 23% YoY and 21% QoQ on account of expenses related to clinical development of Tildrakizumab. PAT stood at INR 14.2bn up 258% YoY and up 28% QoQ on account of higher tax outgo of INR 10.3bn in the corresponding quarter of the last year as compared to a tax outgo of INR 2bn (tax rate of 10% as a % of PBT). EPS for the quarter stood at INR 5.9We have increased the multiple on account of enhanced gGleevec opportunity, expectation of robust revenue from Taro’s orphan drug Keveyis (we have modeled USD 90mn as FY18E sales of the drug) coupled with Sun’s ability to turn around stressed assets and synergy benefits from erstwhile Ranbaxy in tune of USD 300mn enhancing the companies margins to 34% in FY18E. We believe, majority of remedial expenses at Halol have been undertaken by Sun and anticipate regulatory clearance by earliest at the end of FY17E. At CMP of Rs 842, the stock is trading at 24x FY18E. We revise our rating to ‘BUY’ from ‘ACCUMULATE’ on the stock with the target price of INR 971 based on 28xFY18E EPS of INR 34.7 For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Emkay is bullish on KNR Construction and has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 720 in its research report dated Feburary 16, 2016.
title: Buy KNR Construction ; target of Rs 720: Emkay  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,KNR Construct,KNR Constructions, buy, Emkay
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Emkay research report on KNR Construction Revenue came in at Rs2.19 bn +2.3% YoY against our expectation of Rs1.9 bn on stable execution rate, adjusting for the Rs148 mn claim, revenue came at Rs2.04 bn -4.6% YoY still higher than our expectation of Rs1.9 bn EBITDA came in at Rs466 mn +55.1% YoY against our expectation of Rs267 mn on higher revenue flow and margins, adjusted EBITDA margin came at 15.6% +153 bps YoY against our expectation of 14.1%. The management guides for an EBITDA Margin of 13-14% for FY17E/18E Strong order book providing long visibility and coupled with proven execution capabilities and healthy operating margins will enable strong earnings growth going ahead. Maintain buy with a target price of Rs720/share, the stock trades at 14x/10x FY17E/18E EPS.Other highlightsThe company has seen pick up its newly won projects like Madurai –Ramanathpuram Project worth Rs8.95 bn , Chittagong City outer Ring Road worth Bangladesh Rs2.62 bn, Thiruvananthapuram Bypass from Kazhakkoottam (Thiruvananthapuram) to Mukkola Junction Rs6.69, but continues to face challenge in Chennai projects due to unseasonal rains (Upgrading Arcot Villupuram Road worth Rs3.2 bn ). The company has lost Rs1.2- 1.5 bn worth of revenue to be executed in FY17E because of delay in clearances and unseasonal rains across projects. The company is qualified for 6-7 projects in irrigation segment in Telangana. We have seen tenders worth Rs300 bn being floated in the irrigation by Telangana state. Current daily toll collection at Walayar – Vadakkancherry Project stands at Rs1.1 mn per day against projected bid at Rs1.7 mn per day. The company has invested equity worth Rs1.35 bn and has given loans and advances worth Rs1.10 bn to the project. Expects to infuse Rs500 mn over the next six months for the revenue shortfall in the project. Expects Muzaffarpur Barauni Tollway project to achieve provisional COD by March 2016. The company has appointed the contractor for the road project in Arunachal Pradesh which was in JV with JKM Infra. Expects to complete 60-65% of the road project by June 2016 100% completion by June 2017. description: ICICIDirect has recommended hold rating on ACC with a target price of Rs 1400 in its research report dated February 15, 2016.
title: Hold ACC; target of Rs 1400: ICICIDirect  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,ACC
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}ICICIDirect's research report on ACC ACC’s revenues increased 3.0% YoY to | 2,846 crore (vs. I-direct estimate of | 2,771 crore) led by 4.2% YoY increase in volumes to 6.0 MT (vs. I-direct estimate of 5.8 MT) while realisation declined 1.1% YoY to | 4,744 (vs. I-direct estimate of | 4,755). For CY15, revenues were flat at | 11,432.76 crore EBITDA margins increased 91 bps YoY (down 210 bps QoQ) to 7.5% (vs. I-direct estimate of 7.9%) due to a decline in power expenses (down 7.3% YoY). EBITDA/tonne increased 12.5% YoY to | 356 (vs. Idirect estimate of | 374) The Jamul clinkering project has been delayed by a quarter and is now expected to be commissioned in Q2FY16. Grinding units at Jamul (1.1 MT) and Sindhri (1.4 MT) are also delayed and are expected to commence operations in Q2 2016 The company has recommended a final dividend of | 6 per share Being a pan-India player and having a strong balance sheet, the company is in a better position to withstand the current slowdown. However, adding to the demand slowdown, we expect volume growth to moderate further due to delay in capacity expansion. We expect margin expansion to be limited due to high cost pressure led by higher freight cost, and higher proportion of inefficient plants. Hence, we maintain our HOLD recommendation with a revised target price of | 1,400/share (i.e. valuing the stock at CY17E EV/EBITDA of 14.0x, EV/tonne of $120/tonne on CY17E capacity of 35 MT). description: Rajat Bose of rajatkbose.com recommends buying United Breweries for a target of Rs 820.
title: Buy United Breweries, says Rajat Bose  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Aurobindo Pharm,United Brewerie,Zee Entertain,HDFC Bank,Asian Paints,BHEL,Tata Motors,Rajat Bose,Rajat Bose of rajatkbose.com,Aurobindo Pharma,United Breweries,Zee Entertainment Enterprises,HDFC Bank,Asian Paints,Bharat Heavy Electricals,Tata Motors
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Rajat Bose of rajatkbose.com told CNBC-TV18, " Aurobindo Pharma is actually in a downtrend or a medium-term downtrend because the stock hazard a huge bull run and after that this is a deep correction that is going on. I will put a stop loss at Rs 651 and the targets that I am looking at is Rs 601 and Rs 575. If Auro Pharma suffers a selling pressure say around Rs 600 then Rs 575 would also be scaled and that is why I have given a second target there as well. This stock is a sell."" United Breweries has a long tail hammer line and this is generally a reversal pattern and it gives a good bounce back. I will put a stop loss at Rs 768 and given a target of Rs 820 to about Rs 822 United Breweries can give a sharp rally if it moves above say Rs 796-800 kind of levels. Then you will see next leg of the move that is up to Rs 820 which would be pretty fast," he said. " Zee Entertainment is looking pretty weak if you look at the end of day bar chart. The problem there is that the stock is very close to its major support area around Rs 360. So I will put a stop loss at Rs 357 and expecting a bounce back in today's session which might take it up to say something like Rs 372 to about Rs 375. So, basically HDFC Bank and Zee are contra calls and so is Asian Paints . United Breweries is a straight forward buy call."" BHEL in last three days have seen record volumes and after that the volumes are declining and the lows are almost at the same level. So, unless it breaks this low around say Rs 101 or Rs 100 to be precise you won’t see much of a fall." "Suppose if Rs 100 were to be taken out then in that case there could be a sharp 6-8 percent fall even on a single day. So, that is the likely possibility, at these levels you would expect a recovery only if it were to trade above Rs 110 to about Rs 113 kind of levels. However, that kind of a recovery is very unlikely given the kind of weakness that BHEL is showing.""To me the kind of movement that Tata Motors  has given from say sub Rs 299 levels, it looks pretty interesting. If it were to trade above Rs 304, Rs 334 is the supply zone. If it were to trade above that then there could be a minor pullback rally which could take it up to say something like Rs 309-310. So, the trade would be you buy it. Put a stop loss at Rs 302.50 and expect Rs 309 -311 on the upside."$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

The company has allotted 7500 rated, listed, taxable, secured, redeemable, non-convertible debentures (NCDs) of the face value of Rs 10,00,000 each on private placement basis.The said NCDs will be listed on the wholesale debt market segment of BSE, company said in BSE filling.At 10:59 hrs Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone was quoting at Rs 202.90, up Rs 2.50, or 1.25 percent on the BSE.Posted by Rakesh Patil$("

description: Mayuresh Joshi of Angel Broking is of the view that one can buy Dr Reddy's Laboratories on dips for long term.
title: Buy Dr Reddy's Laboratories on dips for long term: Mayuresh Joshi  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Pharmaceuticals,Dr Reddys Labs,Mayuresh Joshi,Mayuresh Joshi of Angel Broking,Dr Reddys Laboratories
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Mayuresh Joshi of Angel Broking told CNBC-TV18, "Within the pharmaceutical space, I think Dr Reddy's Laboratories after the sharp contraction that we have probably witnessed over the last few weeks related to FDA concerns, numbers a little bit below the estimates. Secondly expectations of numbers being soft can well continue. In Q4, the stock can very well correct 6 to 7 percent from the current level.""Our own take is it had got a very strong ANDA pipeline. The combination of Para IV, finished dosage forms (FDFs) and domestic formulations business including UCB acquisition has done exceedingly well. The calibrated sales in Venezuela and rest of the world pharmaceuticals services and active ingredients (PSAI) and AD growth that we are probably seeing is getting compensated by India which has grown 34 percent with US which has grown 18 percent and valuations are become attractive," he said. "So, our own take is that Dr Reddy's can actually have a 17-18 percent earnings growth over the next couple of years. So, any decline on to that stock also becomes a very good buying opportunity for long term investors."$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Mayuresh Joshi of Angel Broking likes TVS Motor and Britannia Industries.
title: Like TVS Motor, Britannia: Mayuresh Joshi  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Auto - 2 & 3 Wheelers,TVS Motor,Britannia,Mayuresh Joshi,Mayuresh Joshi of Angel Broking,Hero Motocorp,TVS Motor Company,Britannia Industries
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Mayuresh Joshi of Angel Broking told CNBC-TV18, "The entire sector when you talk about the durable or non-durable part was expensive after the recent contraction that we have seen. We are probably looking at some amount of value buys probably emerging from this space itself. Specifically, on the two-wheelers side our own take is that if the monsoon are expected to be good and this is what we are reading from reports, you might probably see the rural discretionary player specifically the players like Hero Motocorp and TVS Motor probably benefit in terms of a good monsoon." "What we like within this space is TVS Motor. The management commentary there of regaining markets share or getting market share close to 16 percent mark of getting EBITDA margins close to their double digit figure 10 percent are very encouraging signs and they are getting supported by the new launches," he said. "When you are talking about the other stuff in consumer discretionary space, what we probably like at this juncture are stocks like Britannia Industries if they correct further from the current level. You are probably looking at stocks like Blue Star. The numbers were exceptionally good on all three of their business segments whether that be room air conditioning segment or their engineering product segment or even on their industrial segments." "Clearly, I think the numbers were far better than we probably expected. When you are talking about the two-wheeler space, TVS Motor is something that we probably prefer from a two year time horizon."$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Emkay is bullish on Moil  and has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 262, in its research report dated Feburary 15, 2016.
title: Buy Moil; target of Rs 262: Emkay  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,MOIL
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Emkay's research report MOIL .Sales volume for fines and non- fines fell steeply by 67% and 44% YoY, while on quarterly basis volumes fell by 38% and 34% to 0.13 mt and 1.23 mt respectively Revenue for the quarter declined by 60% YoY and 40% QoQ to Rs 878 mn. On YoY basis, fines and non- fines realizations dropped by 30% and 24%, while they rose slightly on sequential basis by 2% and 7% to Rs 2546/tonne and Rs 7081/tonne respectively, EBITDA stood at Rs 153 mn, down 85% YoY and 22% QoQ. APAT stood at Rs 540 mn, (-50% YoY and +11% QoQ), adjusting for exceptional item on account of write down of value of finished goods inventory worth Rs 409 mn, Margins are likely to remain weak on lower volumes, however, focus on high grade ore , will help it lift its realization from this levels. We have revised our estimates factoring in lower volume and prices. Maintain Buy with a revised target price of Rs 262. ValuationWe understand that the domestic demand has been poor due to weakness in steel industry. Imports so far have been lower than last year, however fall in demand has been steeper. The company has been focusing more on the product mix to resist fall in realizations. In Q3FY16, it has been successful also to some extent in this regard. We believe, it will be clearer going forward. Nevertheless, considering recent sharp fall in manganese ore prices and weak volume, we have revised our estimates. Our current FY16, FY17 and FY18 Mn ore sales volume estimates stand at 0.76 mt, 0.97 mt and 1.06 mt respectively. We have also revised down our price assumptions further to Rs 6700/ tonne and Rs 7000/ tn for FY17 and FY18 respectively. For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: ICICIDirect is bullish on Wonderla has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 460 in its research report dated February 15, 2016.
title: Buy Wonderla;target of Rs 460: ICICIDirect  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Wonderla,Wonderla,Wonderla Holidays
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}ICICIDirect's research report on Wonderla Wonderla’s revenues increased 6.5% YoY to | 50.4 core led by 20.6% YoY in realisation while footfalls declined 11.7% YoY. Poor weather conditions adversely impacted the performance of the company, leading to lower-than-expected revenues and margins The Bengaluru amusement park revenues increased 7.3% YoY to | 26.8 crore. Kochi amusement park revenues increased 8.3% YoY to | 22.2 crore. Resort revenues increased 4.2% YoY during the quarter On the margin front, the EBITDA margin declined 802 bps YoY to 36.1% (below I-direct estimate of 45.2%) due to an increase in employee expenses (up 25.7% YoY led by top level hires and new employees for Hyderabad park) and other expenses (up 50.0% YoY on account of | 4.85 crore provision for service tax) As a result, net profit in the quarter declined 4.0% YoY to | 12.3 crore A high entry barrier due to huge capital investment and limited number of large amusement parks in India coupled with favourable demographics and rising discretionary spend augur well for WHL. WHL has consistently maintained an EBITDA margin of 44.0% (highest among Indian and global peers). Further, we believe that a healthy balance sheet (0.03x D/E vs. 1.46x for Adlabs), strong cash flow generation and revenue & EBITDA CAGR of 26.8% and 27.0%, respectively, in FY15-18E demand premium valuations. Given the recent correction in the stock, valuations have become attractive. We have arrived at a DCF based target price of | 460. For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Axis Securities is bullish on SBI has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 190 in its research report dated February 12, 2016.
title: Buy SBI;target of Rs 190: Axis Securities  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,SBI,SBI,State Bank of India
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Axis Securities's research report on SBI State Bank of India (SBIN) reported a lackluster quarter marked by decline in margin (8 bps QoQ to 2.9%) and sharp deterioration in asset quality, primarily due to RBIs assessment. As a consequence, SBIN reported a much lower PAT of Rs 11.2 bn (down 62% YoY). Headline asset quality deteriorated with GNPLs up 28% QoQ and ratio up 95 bps QoQ at 5.1%. Slippages were much higher at Rs 207 bn (6.7% vs. 1.9% in Q2FY16), of which ~70% stemmed from asset quality review. Management guided that asset quality pain will continue in the next quarter as well. Advances growth was healthy at 13% YoY, driven by corporate and retail book. We expect 11% loan CAGR over FY15-18.We cut our earnings estimate by 35%/16% for FY16/17 to factorincurrent weak performance. Given near term asset quality pain, we also reduce our target multiple on standalone book to 1x from 1.1x earlier. Consequently, our SOTP-based TP gets revised to Rs 190 (23% upside) from Rs 235 earlier. At CMP of Rs 154, SBIN trades at 0.7x FY17E ABV (adjusting for cost of investments). Maintain BUY. For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.$("

description: Shares of TeamLease Services were listed at Rs 860 on the National Stock Exchange Friday, up 1.2 percent over issue price of Rs 850 apiece. The stock touched an intraday low of Rs 806.65, before rallying as much as 15.5 percent to hit day's high of Rs 981.80.
title: TeamLease crosses Rs 1000-mark, up over 20% on debut  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,TeamLease Ser.,TeamLease Services,IPO
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Moneycontrol Bureau Shares of TeamLease Services were listed at Rs 860 on the National Stock Exchange Friday, up 1.2 percent over issue price of Rs 850 apiece. The stock could not hold early gains due to weak market conditions, down 5.1 percent to hit an intraday low of Rs 806.65 but it managed to claw back immediately.It rallied as much as 20.6 percent to hit day's high of Rs 1024.80. At 10:41 hours IST, it was trading at Rs 1016.70, up Rs 166.7 or 19.6 percent, with volumes of 35,59,509 shares. Initial public offer of the staffing firm received an overwhelming response from investors as the issue was oversubscribed 66 times. It was opened for subscription during February 2-4. TeamLease Services raised more than Rs 400 crore through public issue, which will be used for acquisitions and other strategic initiatives, upgradation of the existing IT infrastructure, working capital requirements and other general corporate purposes.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Motilal Oswal is bullish on Gujarat Pipavav has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 198 in its research report dated January 28, 2016.
title: Buy Gujarat Pipavav; target of Rs 198: Motilal Oswal  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Gujarat Pipavav,Gujarat Pipavav,Gujarat Pipavav Port
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Motilal Oswal's research report on Gujarat Pipavav GPPV’s 3QFY16 revenue declined 10% YoY to INR1.7b (lower than the estimate of INR1.8b), driven by lower port volumes—mainly on the bulk front. However, EBIDTA for the quarter was flat YoY at INR1b— in line with our estimate. Better container volume (de-growth muted v/s expectation) and lower bulk (lower gross margin) led to better cost absorption and better EBIDTA margin. EBIDTA margin was 61% v/s estimate of 57.3%. Higher depreciation and tax, as also lower other income, impacted PAT. Reported PAT was INR533, down 40% YoY and lower than the estimate of INR639m. We cut our earnings ~10% for FY16/17 to factor depreciation, other income and tax. We now expect GPPV to report earnings of INR2.3b in FY16 (down 38% YoY) and INR2.7b in FY17 (up 24% YoY). The stock trades at PER of 28x and P/B of 3.3x on FY17E basis. We cut TP to INR198/sh from the earlier INR206/sh. While near-term headwinds persist on demand front, sizable growth options, good quality management and high FCF/ dividend possibility are the key positives. For all recommendations, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. description: VK Sharma of HDFC Securities recommends buying Axis Bank 380 Call.

content:

Obviously for a trading bet all eyes will be on Axis Bank today, so I am suggesting to buy a Call in Axis Bank . I am suggesting to buy it lower levels. I am suggesting to buy the 380 Call at around Rs 10. It closed yesterday at around Rs 12. Keep a stop loss at Rs 7 with a target of around Rs 16." "Don’t run after the stock and if you are holding and you want to trade in that the best idea is to write a higher call when the market goes up in the morning. The market has not yet seen the bottom but you could definitely be able to exit at a higher price partially which you can cover on at a later stage," he said."However, your exit will happen in case the price does go up. So, you can earn the premium on the higher call that you will write if you have the stock otherwise there is huge amount of risk."$("

tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Hexaware Tech,Hexaware Tech,Hexaware Technologies
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Hexaware Tech Hexaware Technologies (HEXW) reported revenue miss due to seasonality, furloughs and impact of Chennai floods (~45% of employees based out of Chennai). Despite a weak Q4, HEXW reported CY15 CC revenue growth of 17.6% YoY, much ahead of most of the peers. Company won new business from new clients worth US$120m in CY15, which will be incremental tailwind for CY16 growth. HEXW has invested in sales and marketing engine in CY15 to build base for future growth. This led to margin drop in CY15, which we believe, will be partly recovered in CY16. Management has guided for CY16 revenue growth to be ahead of NASSCOM guidance of 10‐12%. Industry leading revenue growth, reasonable valuations (14.3x/12.7x CY16/17 EPS) and attractive dividend yield (~4%) make HEXW a compelling ‘BUY’. HEXW is trading at a discount to some of its peers, despite having similar or better growth profile. We expect multiple expansion for HEXW. description: Motilal Oswal has recommended neutral rating on Power Finance with a target price of Rs 186 in its research report dated Feruary 9, 2016.
title: Motilal Oswal: neutral on Power Finance; target of Rs 186   - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Power Finance,Power Finance,Power Finance Corporation
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Motilal Oswal's research report on Power Finance Power Finance Corporation’s 3QFY16 reported PAT grew 3% YoY to INR15.82b (13% miss) led by higher provisions and margins contractions. Abs. NPLs spiked 57% QoQ led to increase in provisions to INR4.8b (est. of INR 2.8b). Uptick in NPLs also led to interest reversal resulting 30bp QoQ decline in NIMs to 4.98%.  Loan growth continues to slowdown (15.6% in 3QFY15 to 14.7% in FY15 to 11.6% in 3QFY16) to INR2.23t as overall demand remains subdued. Loans to SEBs (+17% YoY) continue to be a key driver of growth as the transitional finance continued. Share of private sector in the overall loan mix declined by 30/100bp QoQ/YoY to 15.7%. Under the UDAY scheme for financially distressed discoms, state governments would take over 75% of discom debt and remaining 25% of the debt would be guaranteed by the state government. While this would mitigate some asset quality concerns, but this would negatively impact earnings, as its yields would decline to ~10% from existing 12%. Further its spread/NIM would also decline 90bp/100bp to 2.4%/3.5% respectively. ROAs are likely to decline to ~2% and with ROEs at ~14% (down from 18%+ currently). While the stock trades at cheap valuation of 0.6x FY17 P/B, we are cutting our FY16/17 estimates by 11/20% to factor in lower yields and higher credit cost, we downgrade the stock to Neutral with a TP of INR186 (0.6x FY17BV). description: KRChoksey is bullish on GAIL has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 409 in its research report dated Februrary 9, 2016.
title: Buy GAIL; target of Rs 409: KRChoksey  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,GAIL,GAIL,GAIL India
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}KRChoksey's research report on GAIL GAIL reported net profit of INR. 6640mn inline with street expectations mainly on account of increase in volumes from natural gas transmission. EBITDA came in at INR. 11560mn which was up on a QoQ and YoY due to lower other operating expenses and lower purchase of finished goods. Subsidy burden of the quarter was NIL. Transmission volumes stood at 97 mmscmd, up 3% YoY and 8% QoQ.We believe the long term prospects of the stock to be positive with new gas supplies however there are no near term triggers. Government has initiated to supply LNG to stranded power plants which will eventually increase transmission volumes and profitability despite decline in tariff’s and margins. Petchem and LPG margin outlook remains weak in near term. We believe that although the transmission volumes have bottomed out and will pick up by mid of FY16 with the ramp up of Dhabol terminal, expansion of the Dahej terminal and ramp up of the volumes of Kochi terminal. Currently GAIL is trading at 15.5x FY17 EPS of INR. 22.3. We recommend BUY on the stock with a price of INR. 409/share. description: Karvy is bullish on Amrutanjan Health Care has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 504 in its research report dated February 05, 2016.
title: Buy Amrutanjan Health Care; target of Rs 504: Karvy  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Amrutanjan Heal,Amrutanjan Health Care
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Karvy's research report on Amrutanjan Health Care At the beginning of a slack in its flagship product-yellow balm, Amrutanjan has introduced new formats to replace the same, roll on for convenience in body and head ache and strong neutral coloured balm for headache. The awareness and a rush of larger players in the body ache, aid Amrutanjan in rapid expansion of the segment. Amrutanjan has started on a trajectory of being valued at higher multiples from early CY14 and is now stabilizing at a PE of 32.8x closer to its +1 standard deviation of its average last four years PE of 23x. We expect an EPS CAGR growth of 31% in FY15-17E. We are valuing Amrutanjan at an average PE of last two years which is when the upward trajectory began for Amrutanjan PE multiple. We are valuing it at a PE of 28.4x its FY17E EPS of Rs.17.7 for a target price of Rs.504, an upside of 25% from current market price. We are initiating coverage of Amrutanjan with a “BUY” recommendation. So, to that extent, not only that it is a defensive sector and protects downside, the dividend yield also protects the downside.""At the current valuation it is forward PE ratio in the range of 13-14 depending on what EPS and growth expectation you have. With the return on equity 30 percent plus, I think this is one of the stocks. In the last three days when market has been falling sharply, this stock has not fallen at all. So, that also shows the strength in the stock in shorter term as well. While there may not be shorter term returns but it offers protection along with expectation of return over a medium to long term," he said.$("

description: Non-fuel cost per available seat kilometres (ASK) was being lowered by 4.6  (ASK) in Q3 while total cost per ASK was reduced by 15 percent in Q3.
title: Jet Airways rises 8% on highest ever quarterly profit in Q3  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Jet Airways,Interglobe Avi,Jet Airways,aircraft,Fuel cost,ASK,IndiGo,Interglobe Aviation
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Moneycontrol Bureau Shares of Jet Airways jumped over 8 percent intraday on Monday after it announced highest ever quarterly profit in October-December. Fuel cost which fell 27 percent in Q3 aided its profitability with total income growing 7.7 percent to Rs 5444 crore against Rs 5051 crore on annual basis. The aircraft's fuel expenses dropped to Rs 1235.36 crore compared to Rs 1701.07 crore in year-ago period In comparison, InterGlobe Aviation (IndiGo) which has been rising after its debut last year, saw fuel cost decline by 20 percent to Rs 1165.86 crore in the December quarter. Jet Airways group was able to generate higher passenger traffic compared to capacity deployment. Domestic capacity grew by 14.6 percent in Q3 of FY16 while passenger traffic grew 15 percent. In the international business, capacity grew by 2.6 percent while growth in passenger traffic was 5.1 percent. Non-fuel cost per available seat kilometres (ASK) was being lowered by 4.6 (ASK) in Q3 while total cost per ASK was reduced by 15 percent in Q3. At 12:11 hrs Jet Airways was quoting at Rs 604.65, up Rs 33.80, or 5.92 percent on the BSE. Posted by Nasrin Sultana Follow @ NasrinzStory  $("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Ajay Bodke of Prabhudas Lilladher is of the view that one may prefer JSPL, JSW Steel and Tata Steel.
title: Prefer JSPL, JSW Steel, Tata Steel: Ajay Bodke  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Jindal Steel,JSW Steel,Tata Steel,SAIL,Ajay Bodke,Ajay Bodke of Prabhudas Lilladher,Jindal Steel & Power,JSW Steel,Tata Steel,Steel Authority of India,ICICI Bank,Axis Bank,Punjab National Bank,State Bank of India,minimum import price  Read more at: http://www.moneycontrol.com/news/business/will-exclusions-mar-steel-mip-decision_5357321.html?utm_source=ref_article,MIP,steel reforms
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Ajay Bodke of Prabhudas Lilladher told CNBC-TV18, "It is a very bold trade move by the government and this has been a long pending demand both from the steel sector as well as from the banking sector, which has seen a large amount of stressed assets coming from the steel sector along with infrastructure sector. I think we believe that this bold move would lead to the steel companies taking a price hike of at least between USD 60 and USD 90 per tonne on the HRC, which is 17 percent hike. They can go ahead and take a higher hike but we believe that the presence of excess capacity in the industry as well as the comparative intensity will ensure that they will not be able to take the entire hike.""At the same time, the hike to 17-20 percent on various products has the potential to be a game changer for the steel industry. In addition to that, we believe that by end of February or early March, the industry also might go and apply for anti-dumping measures which in itself will take some time to come. However, in the interim for a six months period to start with, this is a very big boost that the government has given to the steel sector. This has the potential in our view to change the continuous pessimism that one is seeing on the street in case of the metal stocks," he said."We believe that certain names like Jindal Steel & Power or JSW Steel should be looked at with a medium-term perspective. Tata Steel also would be a beneficiary. However, the continuing pressure on the operations from the Corus would limit the upside in case of Tata Steel but a pure place like JSW Steel or JSPL and Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL) would be the bigger beneficiaries of this move."He further added, "On the other side, you also have the entire PSU banking space. Some of the leading private sector banks like ICICI Bank , from the conference call, this quarter, ICICI Bank being asked about what is the percentage of total steel loans, which are under stress category, NPA restructured and if I am not wrong, the number given out with around 20 percent. So that is a symptomatic of the kind of stress that the banking space has faced on the steel side. So there will be a huge relief for many of the bank companies and I expect a strong bounce back to come in names like ICICI Bank and Axis Bank , although Axis Bank is less exposed compared to ICICI Bank. Also some of the public sector undertaking (PSU) banks like State Bank of India (SBI) and Punjab National Bank (PNB). So it is a very good move and the investors would give a thumbs up for this."$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Ajay Bodke of Prabhudas Lilladher told CNBC-TV18, "Last week a few of the midcap results stood out for me. Hexaware Technologies ' numbers, although they were impacted due to the Chennai floods disproportionately around 35 percent of their total workforce is in Chennai but on the conference call, the company gave a very strong guidance. We have a target price of around Rs 300 in the medium-term for the company and earnings growth of around 22-25 percent expected over the medium-term," he added.$("

description: Dipan Mehta, Member at BSE & NSE has a negative view on PSU banks while one may find opportunities in private banking space.
title: Negative on PSU banks, says Dipan Mehta  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Banks - Public Sector,SBI,ICICI Bank,Dipan Mehta,Dipan Mehta,BSE,NSE,PSU banks,State Bank of India,ICICI Bank
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Dipan Mehta, Member at BSE & NSE told CNBC-TV18, "We have been grappling with the scenario that the worst would be over for PSU banks for the last two years or so and the worst just does not get over. So, I do not know how much to believe when these numbers do come out and they do post their provisioning for non-performing assets (NPA), whether that is the end of the story as far as NPAs are concerned.""What the market is reacting to right now is that the price to book of most of these companies is well below one, which means that the market is suspecting that even whatever loans they have classified as performing, those could also turn out to be non-performing. That is the only way it explains that such a steep discount is there to the book value where they are trading just now," he said."I am very negative on PSU banks as a whole. If by chance, you have one or two companies coming out with good set of numbers, they could frankly be opportunities to exit out of this sector completely once and for all. When you are looking at the financial services and the banking sector, there are far too many opportunities in the private sector banks and private sector non-banking financial companies (NBFC) which continue to deliver very good return. So why would you dabble in PSU banks. It could be a trading bet, but they cannot be long-term investments," he added. $("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Dipan Mehta, Member at BSE & NSE is of the view that there are opportunities in pharma stocks and feels that Alembic Pharma looks interesting.
title: Opportunity in pharma stocks, Alembic Pharma looks interesting: Dipan Mehta  - Moneycontrol.com

content:

Alembic Pharma came out with a good set of numbers. So, there are pockets of very interesting stocks within the pharmaceuticals group which investors could consider, but it is a bit of a risky industry and you must buy into a basket of pharmaceutical shares so that at least that risk diversified within the sector in the event of any US FDA action," he said.$("
