description: Software provider Quick Heal Technologies has opened its Rs 451-crore initial public offer for subscription on Monday. It has fixed issue price band at Rs 311-321 a share.
title: Quick Heal Rs 451-cr IPO opens for subscription  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Quick Heal Tech,Quick Heal Technologies,IPO,Public issue
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Software provider Quick Heal Technologies has opened its Rs 451-crore initial public offer for subscription on Monday. It has fixed issue price band at Rs 311-321 a share.The issue consists of fresh issue of Rs 250 crore and an offer for sale of about 62.70 lakh equity shares by promoters Kailash Sahebrao Katkar & Sanjay Sahebrao Katkar, and investor Sequoia Capital India Investment Holdings III. Quick Heal has already raised Rs 133.9 crore from 10 anchor investors, including BNP Paribas Advantage and Reliance MF. It has alloted 41.70 lakh equity shares at Rs 321 apiece, the upper end of the price band, to 10 anchor investors.The issue will close on February 10.  Proceeds from the offer of sale will not go to Quick Heal Technologies. The balance Rs 250 crore funds raised from fresh issue of equity shares will be used by the company for advertising & sales promotion and capital expenditure for research & development. It will also be invested to purchase, develop and renovate its office premises in Kolkata, Pune and New Delhi, as well as general corporate needs. Equity shares are proposed to be listed on BSE and NSE. ICICI Securities, Jefferies India and JPMorgan India are the book running lead managers while Link Intime India is the registrar to the public issue.(With inputs from PTI) $("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Precision Camshafts fell nearly 17 percent in early trade on Monday. The stock listed at Rs 165 on the National Stock Exchange, down 11 percent against issue price of Rs 186 per share.
title: Precision Camshafts debuts at Rs 165, falls 17% intraday  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Precision Camsh,Precision Camshafts,IPO,Listing
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Moneycontrol Bureau Auto components manufacturer Precision Camshafts fell nearly 17 percent in early trade on Monday. The stock is listed at Rs 165 on the National Stock Exchange, down 11 percent against issue price of Rs 186 per share. It was trading at Rs 171.90, down 7.6 percent (at 10:05 hours IST) with volumes of 21.6 lakh equity shares after hitting an intraday low of Rs 154.50. Maharashtra-based Precision Camshafts manufactures and sells over 150 types of camshafts for small and mid-sized passenger vehicle engines to a large number of companies, including some overseas original equipment manufacturers (OEM). The Rs 240-crore public issue closed for subscription on January 29. Proceeds from the issue will be utilised for setting up a machine shop for ductile iron camshafts at its unit at Solapur in Maharashtra, which is being put up for Rs 200 crore, and for other general corporate purposes. The company also plans to set up two more new machine shops for ductile iron camshafts and assembled camshafts by 2018.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Sudarshan Sukhani of s2analytics.com recommends buying Jet Airways.
title: Buy Jet Airways, advises Sudarshan Sukhani  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Transport & Logistics,Jet Airways,Bank of Baroda,SBI,PNB,Axis Bank,Sudarshan Sukhani,Sudarshan Sukhani of s2analytics.com,Jet Airways,Bank Of Baroda,State Bank of India,Punjab National Bank,Axis Bank
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Sudarshan Sukhani of s2analytics.com told CNBC-TV18, "In Jet Airways , there is a trade which is to buy the stock, put a stop loss below today’s low because it had gone up 10 percent and a rally towards that level is quite possible. The gap today should be maintained. However, for most other stocks, you must get out of aviation, it is going lower.""In Bank of Baroda (BoB), State Bank of India (SBI), Punjab National Bank  (PNB), and Axis Bank , there is a trade not just now but maybe towards the latter half of the day. If they start slipping, all four names are short selling ideas for the day. I don’t buy them at these elevated levels and the same applies to metals. Metals are already giving way from the highs. I think about 11:00 or 11:30 they will become short sells," he said.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

title: Buy Punjab National Bank, target Rs 104: Chandan Taparia  - Moneycontrol.com

content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Chandan Taparia of Anand Rathi Securities told CNBC-TV18, "We have seen some short covering activity in selected PSU banks which were beaten down and are down by around 15-20 percent from immediate highs. Now, we are trending positive on Punjab National Bank (PNB), Union Bank and Canara Bank but I would I like to suggest to go long on PNB.""Recently it made bottom near to Rs 86-87 zone and also surpassed its immediate falling trendline. We have seen short covering activity with positive bias which indicates that this momentum can extend to higher levels led by further short covering move. So, recommending to buy with a stop loss of Rs 90 for the upside immediate target of Rs 104," he said.$("

description: Hem Securities has come out with its report on Quick heal technologies IPO. The research firm has recommended to SUBSCRIBE the issue, in its research report
title: Subscribe to Quick Heal Technologies IPO: Hem securities  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,quick heal, software, technology ,ipo
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Hem Securities report on Quick Heal TechnologiesQuick Heal is one of the leading providers of security software products and solutions in India with a market share of over 30 percent in the retail segment according to the Zinnov Industry Report. Company's end customers include home users, small offices and home offices (SOHO), SMBs, enterprises, educational institutions, as well as government agencies and departments. Company's proprietary antivirus technology, which is based on an innovative behaviour and threat detection system, works to detect security threats including virus and malware attacks in real time to protect including desktops, laptops, mobile/ smartphones and tablets, while aiming to ensure resource availability, business continuity and an uninterrupted digital experience.As of December 31, 2015, company had over 7.13 million active licenses spread across more than 80 countries. Company’s strength Recognised Brand Name and Positive Reputation: Company's proven track record of execution over two decades has contributed to its reputation and leading market position in India for providing security software solutions. Company is one of the leading providers of security software products and solutions in India with a market share of over 30% in the retail segment according to the Zinnov Industry Report. Strong and Diversified Channel Network: As of December 31, 2015, company have over 19,000 retail channel partners, 349 enterprise channel partners, 319 government partners and 944 mobile channel partners, who act as the distributors and resellers of its solutions, and company conduct its sales and marketing activities out of 64 offices and warehouses across 36 cities in India. As of December 31, 2015, co's sales & marketing team comprised 400 employees who work  closely with its channel partners. Consistent Growth, Profitability and Cash Flow Generation: Company have grown consistently over the last few years and for the five fiscal years ended March 31, 2015, its total revenue, Gross Profit, EBITDA and restated profit for the year grew at a CAGR of 21.94%, 20.97%, 13.07% and 8.67%, respectively. Further, company achieved Gross Margins of 91.65%, 91.09%, 92.13% and 92.38%, EBITDA Margins of 29.69%, 32.09%, 42.98% and 51.30% and restated profit for the year (period) margins of 16.35%, 18.81%, 24.04% and 37.51% for the six months period ended September 30, 2015 and fiscal years 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.ValuationThe company is bringing the issue at price band of Rs 311-321 per share which will convert into p/e multiple of 45-46 per share on post issue annualized H1FY'16 eps of Rs 7 per share. Though company has seen declining trend in its EBIDTA & PAT since FY'13 on account of co's spend on R&D & other activities but looking after margins ,return ratios & positive cash flows from operations along with debt free status, financials infused optimism in company. Co's MDM ( Mobile Device management)product seems to have strong future potential. Also, company has an edge in case of margins over its global peers Symantec & Fortinet. Hence we recommend investors to subscribe the issue.For all IPO stories, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Security software firm Quick Heal Technologies, which opened its Rs 450 crore initial public offer (IPO) today, will invest part of the sum it intends to raise from capital markets into technology, capital expenditure and advertising, which it hopes will help it improve its margins.
title: Confident of upping margins, maintaining growth pace: Quick Heal  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Sanjay Katkar,Quick Heal Technologies,IPO,EBITDA,revenue,subscription,price,growth
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Security software firm Quick Heal Technologies, which opened its Rs 450 crore initial public offer (IPO) today, will invest part of the sum it intends to raise from capital markets into technology, capital expenditure and advertising, which it hopes will help it improve its margins, MD and CTO Sanjay Katkar told CNBC-TV18 in an interview. The company, which is coming out with a fresh share issue of Rs 250 crore along with an offer for sale of roughly Rs 200 crore, has said investments have led to the firm's EBITDA margins falling from a lucrative 51.3 percent to 32 percent in FY15. The company notched up sales of Rs 286 crore in FY15, and in the first half of FY16, it had sales of Rs 148 crore. But Katkar said the company was confident of maintaining its 17 percent revenue growth rate, adding that the cyclicality will help lift revenues in the second half. Quick Heal has a 30 percent market share in the Indian retail security software market -- with about 87 percent revenues coming from there -- but is now stepping up efforts in the enterprise segment. Quick Heal primarily operates in the Indian market.Below is the verbatim transcript of Sanjay Katkar's interview with Reema Tendulkar & Nigel D'Souza on CNBC-TV18.Nigel: Could you give us what exactly is the reason behind raising this Rs 450 crore and how exactly it is going to be used?A: Out of this Rs 450 crore, Rs 250 crore is a fresh issue and in this fresh issue, we plan to use around Rs 110 crore in business development advertisement and branding. Then we have around Rs 40 crore to be used in capacity building in R&D in terms of building our technological capacities, enhancing our labs from making products ready for other, bigger enterprises. The rest of the offerings also involve enhancing our infrastructure and rest of the thing is for general purpose.Reema: Let me ask you a bit about your margins. Your margins have consistently been coming down, FY13 - 50 percent, FY14 it came down to 43 percent. Now in the first half of FY16, your EBITDA margins are close to about 30 percent, so clearly there is a big fall in your margins, is that a trend that will continue even in the coming quarters?A: No, there are two things I can say, one is we have been at a very good margins from 50 percent. We have been dropping since we had consciously taken decision to invest our profits into R&D and come out with new product. So in last three years we have released all our enterprise products and the profits have been used in building them and all the development charges have been charged up to the balance sheet.So if you look at the last six months, the drop is because we have a seasonality -- being in the product industry, there is a seasonality, our last quarter is always highest earning quarter. So the margins will definitely be maintained and it is going up hence onwards.Reema: 30 percent that you saw in the first half is perhaps the bottom in terms of margins?A: That is right.Nigel: Could you give us some numbers in terms of what exactly is your current market share? What is your revenue outlook going ahead, do you think it will roughly be around Rs 300 crore on a per annum basis?A: Yes.Nigel: In the next year or so for FY17, what exactly could be your revenue and also break up what is your current market share?A: Currently, we are having 30 percent of a retail market share and we are just entering to enterprise segment these last three years and we are doing very good traction there and if you are asking for the targets, we will be definitely achieving the growth that we had been achieving since last three-four years. We had been at 17 percent compounded annual growth rate (CAGR) for last five years and I cannot speak of exact target.Nigel: You have been growing at around 20 percent. On the first half of this year, you have done only Rs 150 crore, so second half of the year is going to be much better for you?A: Yes. We have seasonality in products. So H1 is always 35-40 percent of our revenues. So second half is going to be better. $("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Shares of Rallis India rose 2 percent intraday Monday. The company is going to increase its stake in Metahelix Life Sciences from 80.51 percent to 100 percent.
title: Rallis India rises 2%; to increase stake in Metahelix Life  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Rallis India,Rallis India,Metahelix Life Sciences
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Moneycontrol BureauShares of Rallis India rose 2 percent intraday Monday. The company is going to increase its stake in Metahelix Life Sciences from 80.51 percent to 100 percent.Metahelix is a subsidiary of the Company, which will become a wholly owned subsidiary on completion of the acquisition of remaining stake.The company is going to acquire 19.49 percent stake for Rs 73.33 crore.Metahelix had generated profit of Rs 9.23 crore and 16.52 crore in FY13-14 and FY14-15 respectively.At 11:04 hrs Rallis India was quoting at Rs 164, up Rs 3.15, or 1.96 percent on the BSE.Posted by Rakesh Patil$("
").insertAfter(".clear_cls")

description: Firstcall Research is bullish on Wim Plast Ind has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 1880 in its research report dated February 25, 2016.
title: Buy Wim Plast;target of Rs 1880: Firstcall Research  - Moneycontrol.com
tags: Business,Markets,Miscellaneous,Wim Plast,Wim Plast
content:
.clear_cls{};.td_cls{border: 1px solid black;padding: 15px;}.ml35_cls{margin-left: 35px;}Firstcall Research's research report on Wim Plast Wim Plast Limited is one of the group companies of ‘cello’ group. Wim Plasts Limited was incorporated on 7th of October, 1988 as a Private Limited Company. Registrar at Bombay, Maharashtra and latter it was converted into a Public Limited Company on 14th July 1993. CELLO begins its journey by manufacturing plastic household goods. Presently the company has manufacturing units at Daman, Baddi and Chennai also have Depots in Gujarat, Rajasthan, Andhra Pradesh, Haryana and Punjab and have strong consumer base through out the country. And recently the new additional Manufacturing Unit in Kolkata was started in February 2013. In the year 1994 Cello Group ventures stepped into manufacturing moulded furniture. Elegant, versatile and durable, cello furniture brings convenience and style to consumers at surprising economical price, made from special grade plastic and state-of-the-art moulds from Italy. Cello Furniture becomes a household name in short span of time for its range of products and quality. Cello Group entered the plastic moulded ball pen Writing Instruments market in the year 1995, cello exploded on the scene with cello Clear Pens with Swiss tips and German ink and changed forever the way pen ran on paper. The revolutionary new smear free, smooth flowing pen not just took the market by storm but marked a new era in writing instruments in India. Not too long after, the company unveiled two more models Prism and Crystal and with that started as a mere 3-machine Company, took wings. The Company’s production techniques include Injection Moulding and Extrusion Technology. The Technological process is subject to up gradation from time to time and efforts are continuously made to absorb the latest Technology. This results in the up- gradation of production process with improved results of operations. The Company does not have any Subsidiary Company. We recommend ‘BUY’ in this particular scrip with a target price of Rs. 1880.00 for Medium to Long term investment.
